analyzed: bshad pa / nyi ma mi mthong ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pa dang / lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa'i sgra rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Reply: Because the desire for the nonseeing of the sun and so on and the sound of nonembodiments and so on are not different,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i tshogs gnyi gar yang @107a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i tshogs gnyi gar yang @107a * //
translated: both the collection of desires and the collection of non-desires

original: don mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would not understand the meaning.

original: 'di ltar brda ji lta ba bzhin don so sor nges pa yin yang gal te gcig las don mi rtogs na gzhan las kyang dngos su rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar brda ji lta ba bzhin don so sor nges pa yin yang gal te gcig las don mi rtogs na gzhan las kyang dngos su rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of a word is ascertained just as the sign is, but if one meaning is not understood from one word, then another meaning will not be understood from another word.

original: ci ltar 'dod pa dang khyad par med ce na /🔽bshad pa / nyi ma mi mthong ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i sgra de las byur ba'i rtogs pa shes pa yang tha snyad yang dag par grub pa la brten pa'i phyir la tha snyad grub pa la brtan pa de ni lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgra gzhan
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod pa dang khyad par med ce na / bshad pa / nyi ma mi mthong ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i sgra de las byur ba'i rtogs pa shes pa yang tha snyad yang dag par grub pa la brten pa'i phyir la tha snyad grub pa la brtan pa de ni lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgra gzhan
translated: How is there no difference between the two?

original: du yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: The understanding of the meaning of the word “sun” is the same as the understanding of the meaning of the word “not seen,” because the understanding of the meaning of the word “sun” is based on the establishment of the conventional, and the establishment of the conventional is the same in other words, such as “not seen,” which are not embodied, etc.

original: gnyi ga yang brda las don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang brda las don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Both words cause the understanding of the meaning from the sign.

original: ci ltar brda sprod pa ba rnams kyi lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa la rtogs pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bzang por 'dod pa gzhan dag kyang dngos su rjod par byed par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar brda sprod pa ba rnams kyi lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa la rtogs pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bzang por 'dod pa gzhan dag kyang dngos su rjod par byed par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Just as grammarians do not express the non-embodiment, etc. of words, because they are understood, so also others who desire the good do not express them directly.

original: rtogs pa'i stobs kyis gnyi ga dngos su sgrub par byed pa yin pa nyid la rtogs pa med na rjes su dpog par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa nges na khyad par med do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i stobs kyis gnyi ga dngos su sgrub par byed pa yin pa nyid la rtogs pa med na rjes su dpog par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa nges na khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, when both are established directly by the power of understanding, if there is no understanding, they are the same in being inferred. When this is ascertained, there is no difference.

original: des na brda ci lta ba bzhin don rtogs pa'i phyir lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa yang rjod par byed pa yin pas 'jig rten mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na brda ci lta ba bzhin don rtogs pa'i phyir lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa yang rjod par byed pa yin pas 'jig rten mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because the meaning is understood according to the convention, even non-embodiment, etc. are expressed. Therefore, the world is not overturned.

original: lus can ma yin pa'i sgra bsdu ba mi nus pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i sgra bsdu ba mi nus pa ma yin yang /
translated: It is not that non-embodiment cannot be included in words.

original: gzhan gyi bsdu ba mi nus par brtags pa des na slob dpon gyis zhar la sgra rnams la bzang po nyid nges par sun phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsdu ba mi nus par brtags pa des na slob dpon gyis zhar la sgra rnams la bzang po nyid nges par sun phyung ba yin no //
translated: However, the master has incidentally refuted the goodness of words by that investigation which considers it unable to include others.

original: des na lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba rnam par gcad pa tsam de ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la yod pas shes bya yod pa'i rgyus go bar byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba rnam par gcad pa tsam de ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la yod pas shes bya yod pa'i rgyus go bar byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since the mere exclusion of the object of expression, such as “nonembodiment,” exists in both the similar and dissimilar classes, how could it be understood through the cause of the existence of the object of knowledge?

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug srid pa de'i dogs pa rnam par chad pa ste log pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug srid pa de'i dogs pa rnam par chad pa ste log pa'o //
translated: The doubt that the reason may apply to the dissimilar class is eliminated, or reversed.

original: go bar byed pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa yang 'chad pas thob par byas pa gang ma yin pa de nyid la 'jug par nges pa'i rnam par gcad pa tsam gyis ci ltar thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: go bar byed pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa yang 'chad pas thob par byas pa gang ma yin pa de nyid la 'jug par nges pa'i rnam par gcad pa tsam gyis ci ltar thob par 'gyur /
translated: Since the so-called cause of understanding is also obtained through explaining the doubt that the reason may apply to the dissimilar class, how could it be obtained through the mere exclusion of the certainty that it applies to just that which is not obtained?

original: rnam par bcad pa tsam 'ba' zhig thun mong yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa tsam 'ba' zhig thun mong yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the mere exclusion common,

original: 'on kyang shes bya nyid la sogs @107b pa'i brjod bya nyid dang gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnam par gcod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes bya nyid la sogs @107b pa'i brjod bya nyid dang gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnam par gcod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang thun mong ba yin no //
translated: However, the nature of the object of expression, such as the knowable, and the nature of the object of comprehension, etc., are also common to the establishment of the nature of the non-elimination of phenomena.

original: ci ltar dngos po med pa shes bya nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po med pa shes bya nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is the non-existent the knowable?

original: dngos po med pa dag la yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dag la yang zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, Even in the non-existent.

original: dngos po 'dzin pas dngos po med pa mi 'dzin du chug kyang rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pas dngos po med pa mi 'dzin du chug kyang rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Even if one does not apprehend the non-existent by apprehending the existent, it is established by the conceptual mind.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni sgra'i tha snyad du rung ba brtag pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni sgra'i tha snyad du rung ba brtag pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: How? means by the nature of the investigation of suitability in verbal convention.

original: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa lhur len pa'i tshad mas ni dngos po med pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa lhur len pa'i tshad mas ni dngos po med pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: By the valid cognition that is intent on establishing the existent, the non-existent is to be established.

original: de lta ma yin na des 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid rnam par ma bzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na des 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid rnam par ma bzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, its very status as a means of engagement would not be established.

original: don gzhan rnam par bcad pa ma byas pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don nges pa med pa nyid du nye bar gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan rnam par bcad pa ma byas pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don nges pa med pa nyid du nye bar gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Without eliminating other objects, the object that is intended is not ascertained.

original: des na chu ma yin pa rnam par gcod par byed pa'i tshad mas chu 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chu ma yin pa rnam par gcod par byed pa'i tshad mas chu 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the valid knowledge that eliminates non-water is posited as the limb that engages water.

original: de skad du de yongs su gcod par byed cing de las gzhan rnam par gcod par byed la /
analyzed: de skad du de yongs su gcod par byed cing de las gzhan rnam par gcod par byed la /
translated: Thus it is said that it determines that and eliminates that which is other than that.

original: rnam pa gzhan med par yang ston par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med par yang ston par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: It also teaches that there is no other mode.

original: des na 'di ni tshad ma gcig gi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni tshad ma gcig gi byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus this is the function of one valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir dngos po sgrub pa'i tshad mas dngos po med pa yang gzhal byar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po sgrub pa'i tshad mas dngos po med pa yang gzhal byar bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the valid knowledge that establishes an entity also makes the object of comprehension an entity that is not an object of comprehension.

original: des na shes bya dang brjod bya yang yin no //
analyzed: des na shes bya dang brjod bya yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also a knowable object and an object of expression.

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos dag kyang 'dis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos dag kyang 'dis bshad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this also explains phenomena that have that kind of nature.

original: 'khrul par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it is mistaken.

original: smra ba pos kyang 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi chos gtan tshigs su brjod par mi 'os la /
analyzed: smra ba pos kyang 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi chos gtan tshigs su brjod par mi 'os la /
translated: The speaker also should not state as a reason a property that has such a nature.

original: brjod na yang rtogs pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: brjod na yang rtogs pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If he does state it, he would be ignorant.

original: smra ba po de gnyi ga'i chos su smras pas gnyi ga'i chos 'di bsgrub par bya ba yod pa las gzhan la yang 'jug par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: smra ba po de gnyi ga'i chos su smras pas gnyi ga'i chos 'di bsgrub par bya ba yod pa las gzhan la yang 'jug par brjod pa yin la /
translated: The speaker states that the property is common to both, and so he states that this property to be proven applies to something other than the subject.

original: go bar byed pa ni mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du khas blangs pas /
analyzed: go bar byed pa ni mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du khas blangs pas /
translated: Since he accepts that the reason is a cause of non-error, it is a reason.

original: de nyid 'di ma 'khrul ba yang brjod pa yin pa de'i phyir ci ltar bsnyon pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ma 'khrul ba yang brjod pa yin pa de'i phyir ci ltar bsnyon pa yin te /
translated: Since he states that it is non-erroneous, how can he deny it?

original: 'gal ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he states a contradiction.

original: 'di snyam du gnyi ga'i chos yin pa la 'ga' zhig @108a * //🔽mi 'khrul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gnyi ga'i chos yin pa la 'ga' zhig @108a * // mi 'khrul bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that although the property is common to both, it is non-erroneous in one,

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs kyi 'khrul pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs kyi 'khrul pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas yin no //
translated: then the reason would not be erroneous because it applies to the discordant side.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas 'khrul ba gang yin pa de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas 'khrul ba gang yin pa de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error in engaging in the discordant side?

original: smras pa / des na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba dang / ngas khas blangs pa la sogs pa'i chos dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / des na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba dang / ngas khas blangs pa la sogs pa'i chos dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because the properties of the thesis and so on do not engage in the discordant side,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga'i chos yin yang ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga'i chos yin yang ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
translated: there is no error of indeterminacy, even though the property is both permanent and impermanent.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe rtag pa nyid sgrub pa de'i tshe nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag ba mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de'i tshe phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe rtag pa nyid sgrub pa de'i tshe nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag ba mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de'i tshe phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug go //
translated: Thus, when permanence is established, then whatever is the concordant side, such as space and so on, at that time the discordant side does not engage in the discordant side, whatever it may be.

original: mi rtag pa bsgrub pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa bsgrub pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: And the same is true for establishing impermanence.

original: 'di snyam du gnyi gar yang phyogs su gyur pa'i sgra yang yin pa de nyid rtag gam mi rtag the tshom za bas phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang rung nyid de la 'jug pa ni 'khrul par rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gnyi gar yang phyogs su gyur pa'i sgra yang yin pa de nyid rtag gam mi rtag the tshom za bas phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang rung nyid de la 'jug pa ni 'khrul par rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the reason is inconclusive because it is doubtful whether sound is permanent or impermanent, then it is understood that the reason is mistaken because it applies to either one of the two sides.

original: smras pa / phyogs nyid ni gtan tshigs 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no //🔽the tshom za ba de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du nges pa med la /
analyzed: smras pa / phyogs nyid ni gtan tshigs 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no // the tshom za ba de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du nges pa med la /
translated: We reply: The reason is not the object of mistake because it is the side itself.🔽If there is doubt about the probandum, then it is not ascertained as the side that is contrary to it.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su nges pa gang yin pa de la ni mi 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su nges pa gang yin pa de la ni mi 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: And if it is ascertained as the side that is contrary to it, then it does not apply to it.

original: des na de ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not the object of mistake.

original: cig shos ni 'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dod pa ci lta bu zhig yin /
analyzed: cig shos ni 'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dod pa ci lta bu zhig yin /
translated: What kind of thing is the other, which is asserted to be the contrary of it?

original: ci dngos po la bsgrub bya med pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci dngos po la bsgrub bya med pa yin nam /
translated: Is it the case that the probandum does not exist in the thing,

original: 'on te skyes bus brtags pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bus brtags pa yin /
translated: or is it that it is imagined by a person?

original: gal te dngos po yin na skyes bu'i 'dod pas phyogs su byas kyang /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yin na skyes bu'i 'dod pas phyogs su byas kyang /
translated: If it is a thing, then even if it is made into a side by the desire of a person,

original: dngos po gnas bas bsgrub bya med pa dang ldan pas phyogs 'khrul pa'i yul nyid pas /
analyzed: dngos po gnas bas bsgrub bya med pa dang ldan pas phyogs 'khrul pa'i yul nyid pas /
translated: Since the object of affirmation does not exist due to the abiding of the thing, and since the object of error is not the position itself,

original: phyogs nyid ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no zhes ci ltar smra /
analyzed: phyogs nyid ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no zhes ci ltar smra /
translated: how can you say that the position itself is not the object of error?

original: 'on te skyes bu'i 'dod pas brtags pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gzhan mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bu'i 'dod pas brtags pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gzhan mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na /
translated: But if the non-concordant position is different from the concordant and non-concordant positions that are imputed by the desire of the person,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul pa dngos po par mi 'gyur zhing rjes su dpag pa tshad mar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes @108b 'di thams cad du thal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul pa dngos po par mi 'gyur zhing rjes su dpag pa tshad mar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes @108b 'di thams cad du thal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time the non-error of the reason would not be a thing, and inference would not be valid cognition. In order to demonstrate that all of this is a consequence,

original: 'dir gang zhig ces pha rol la 'dod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig ces pha rol la 'dod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dri'o //
translated: here, the opponent is asked, “What is it?” in terms of the non-concordant position that is desired.

original: cig shos kyis bsgrub par bya ba med pa'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: cig shos kyis bsgrub par bya ba med pa'o zhes smras so //
translated: The other one says, “The object of affirmation does not exist.”

original: dngos po nyid kyi bsgrub bya med pa gzung nas smras pa /
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi bsgrub bya med pa gzung nas smras pa /
translated: Having taken the object of affirmation to be a thing, he says,🔽“The non-concordant position is not a thing.”

original: 'o na ci ltar dngos po'i gnas pas bsgrub bya las bzlog pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa phung po gcig tu nges pa gnyi ga'i chos su 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar dngos po'i gnas pas bsgrub bya las bzlog pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa phung po gcig tu nges pa gnyi ga'i chos su 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how is it that the reason is not contradictory, because it is established by the fact that it is the opposite of the probandum?🔽Because it is non-erroneous with regard to the dissimilar class, and because it is a property of both in the similar class.

original: gang gi phyir gang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i phyir mi 'khrul pa yang yin la dngos po la ni gnyi ga'i chos su 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i phyir mi 'khrul pa yang yin la dngos po la ni gnyi ga'i chos su 'gyur ba ;
translated: The reason is non-erroneous because it does not engage with the dissimilar class, and it is a property of both in the similar class.

original: gtan tshigs kyis mi 'khrul pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis mi 'khrul pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-erroneous reason does not depend on the division of the similar class.

original: ci ltar mi ltos she na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi ltos she na /
translated: How does it not depend?

original: dngos por gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established by fact.

original: phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pa yin te /
translated: The dissimilar class is created by the wish of a person,

original: de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on that.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas ni mi 'khrul ba brtags pas na skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas par 'gyur gyi dngos por ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas ni mi 'khrul ba brtags pas na skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas par 'gyur gyi dngos por ni ma yin no //
translated: Since non-erroneousness is imagined in dependence on the dissimilar class, it would be created by the wish of a person, but not by fact.

original: gang gi tshe 'khrul pa'i yul phyogs su ma byas pa de nyid kyi tshe 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khrul pa'i yul phyogs su ma byas pa de nyid kyi tshe 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is not taken as a particular object of error, then it is error.

original: 'o na dngos po yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how about the property?

original: gang gi phyir rnam par gzhag pas phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so sor rnam par gzhag nas phyogs ma gtogs pa'i byas pa mi rtag pa yin no zhes phyogs ma gtogs pa'i yul la khyab pa bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par gzhag pas phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so sor rnam par gzhag nas phyogs ma gtogs pa'i byas pa mi rtag pa yin no zhes phyogs ma gtogs pa'i yul la khyab pa bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no
translated: Because it is established by the property, the similar and dissimilar instances are established separately. Having established the similar and dissimilar instances, one should not teach the pervasion of the property in a place other than the property.

original: // 'o na ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // 'o na ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how is it?

original: skyes bus byas pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la mi ltos par dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i khyab pa nyid tshad mas bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la mi ltos par dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i khyab pa nyid tshad mas bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: The pervasion that comes by the power of the fact, without relying on the distinction of the similar and dissimilar instances made by a person, is what should be taught by a valid means of knowledge.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: phyogs sam gzhan yang rung ste byas pa thams cad do //
analyzed: phyogs sam gzhan yang rung ste byas pa thams cad do //
translated: It is all that is produced, whether it is the property or something else.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni ma nges pa'i don te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni ma nges pa'i don te /
translated: The term all has an indefinite meaning.🔽All that is produced is impermanent.

original: byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes de ltar tshad mas bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes de ltar tshad mas bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is demonstrated by a valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /🔽de ltar grub na zhes smos te byas pa tsam mi rtag par grub pa yin na byas pa zhes bya ba'i chos @109a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na / de ltar grub na zhes smos te byas pa tsam mi rtag par grub pa yin na byas pa zhes bya ba'i chos @109a * //
translated: Why is it so?🔽If it were established in that way, that is, if it were established that mere production is impermanent, then the property of the subject would be established.🔽But if it were established that the property of the subject is established by a valid cognition, then the reason would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.

original: de'i go bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i go bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were established that the property of the subject is established by a valid cognition, then the reason would not be established.

original: gzhan phyogs las gzhan dag la khyab pa grub na ni go bar byed pa ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir gang zhig bsgrub par 'dod pa de phyogs yin la /
analyzed: gzhan phyogs las gzhan dag la khyab pa grub na ni go bar byed pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir gang zhig bsgrub par 'dod pa de phyogs yin la /
translated: If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.🔽If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.

original: de yang rang gi 'dod pas de ltar phyogs su byed pas gtan tshigs mi 'khrul bar sgrub pa'i don du 'khrul pa'i yul thams cad phyogs su byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gi 'dod pas de ltar phyogs su byed pas gtan tshigs mi 'khrul bar sgrub pa'i don du 'khrul pa'i yul thams cad phyogs su byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established that the reason is established by a valid cognition, then the property of the subject would not be established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it were

original: 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of a person who has the characteristic of desire is not dependent on the power of things.

original: gang gis bzlog pa'i don yang rnam pa gzhan du sgrub par 'dod par mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis bzlog pa'i don yang rnam pa gzhan du sgrub par 'dod par mi 'gyur ba /
translated: And the object of negation is not established in another way, as desired.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni dngos po ci lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni dngos po ci lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: A person’s desire is not the way things are.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan du bsgrub byas khyab pa'i chos de lta bu ni ma nges pa yin pas go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan du bsgrub byas khyab pa'i chos de lta bu ni ma nges pa yin pas go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: A property that pervades the probandum in a way that is different from that similar to it is not ascertained, and so it is not a proof.

original: gal te gang du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mngon sum rjes su dpag pas gnod pa de 'khrul pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: gal te gang du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mngon sum rjes su dpag pas gnod pa de 'khrul pa'i yul yin la /
translated: If the property to be proven is undermined by perception or inference, then the object is mistaken.

original: de yang phyogs ltar snang ba yin gyi phyogs ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang phyogs ltar snang ba yin gyi phyogs ni ma yin nam /
translated: And is that not a semblance of a position, not a real position?

original: de ci ltar na gang gis thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba phyogs 'khrul ba'i yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na gang gis thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba phyogs 'khrul ba'i yul yin zhe na /
translated: How could it be that the object of a mistaken position is the basis for this consequence?

original: bshad pa / rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: In the domain of inference, there is no contradiction with direct perception and so on.

original: tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags kyi yul ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags kyi yul ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The domain of inference is the domain of a reason that has the three modes.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la ltos te mi 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la ltos te mi 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: It is nonerroneous in relation to the classification of concordant and discordant classes.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'khrul pa'i yul phyogs su byas pas 'khrul pa spangs pa'i gtan tshigs 'di tshul gsum dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'khrul pa'i yul phyogs su byas pas 'khrul pa spangs pa'i gtan tshigs 'di tshul gsum dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since the domain of error is taken to be a domain that is the object of a person’s desire, this reason that excludes error has the three modes.

original: ci ltar mi gnod ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi gnod ce na /
translated: How is it noncontradictory?

original: tshad ma la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod na tshad ma ma yin par thal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod na tshad ma ma yin par thal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a valid cognition is contradicted by another valid cognition, it would follow that it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te gang la gnod pa yod pa de nyid tshad ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang la gnod pa yod pa de nyid tshad ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you say that that which is contradicted is a valid cognition,

original: gang la gnod pa med pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang la gnod pa med pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then that which is not contradicted is a valid cognition.

original: 'di la le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained in chapter 2.

original: 'di skad bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad ce na /
translated: You might say the following.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par gcig la gnod pa srid na 'khrul par dogs pa la gnod pa med kyang /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par gcig la gnod pa srid na 'khrul par dogs pa la gnod pa med kyang /
translated: If it is possible to refute one who possesses the characteristics of valid cognition, then even though there is no refutation of the possibility of error,

original: de'i mtshan nyid sun byung bar 'gyur @109b te ;
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid sun byung bar 'gyur @109b te ;
translated: the characteristics of that valid cognition are refuted,

original: yid brtan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid brtan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reliable.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par thal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, it follows that it is not valid cognition.

original: 'di snyam du gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid ces bya ba tshul gsum las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod pa des na gang gi yul la gnod pa de rjes su dpag pa'i mchan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid ces bya ba tshul gsum las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod pa des na gang gi yul la gnod pa de rjes su dpag pa'i mchan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin na /
translated: If you think that the statement “the subject is not refuted” is a characteristic other than the three modes, then if the object of that is refuted, it does not possess the characteristics of inference.

original: de ci'i phyir mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod na zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod na zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why do you say, “If it possesses the characteristics, it is refuted”?

original: bshad pa / gnod pa med pa yang mtshan nyid yin na ni gtan tshigs de'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gnod pa med pa yang mtshan nyid yin na ni gtan tshigs de'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If not being refuted is a characteristic, then the characteristic of that reason is indeterminate.

original: 'di la gnod pa mi srid do zhes de ltar ni nges nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa mi srid do zhes de ltar ni nges nus pa ma yin la /
translated: One cannot ascertain that “it is impossible for it to be refuted.”

original: tshad ma 'ga' zhig las gnod pa med par nges na yang de nyid las bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma 'ga' zhig las gnod pa med par nges na yang de nyid las bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is ascertained that there is no contradiction by some valid cognition, then the reason is pointless, because the probandum is established by that alone.

original: mtshan nyid mi nges pa can yin na yang de go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi nges pa can yin na yang de go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it has an indefinite characteristic, then it is not an awareness-causer.

original: sgrub par byed pa gang gi don du mi 'khrul pa bsam pa 'ga' yang gang gi yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gang gi don du mi 'khrul pa bsam pa 'ga' yang gang gi yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For the sake of which the proof is non-erroneous, that is not the proof of anything at all.

original: gang gi phyir tshul 'dis phyogs las gzhan la khyab pa sgrub na go bar byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la tshad mas gang zhig gang gis khyab pa'am ma khyab pa de nyid de'i go bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul 'dis phyogs las gzhan la khyab pa sgrub na go bar byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la tshad mas gang zhig gang gis khyab pa'am ma khyab pa de nyid de'i go bar byed pa'am /
translated: Because in this way, if the pervasion is established in something other than the position, it is not an awareness-causer. Therefore, by valid cognition, whatever is pervaded or not pervaded by whatever, that alone is its awareness-causer or not its awareness-causer.

original: go bar byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: go bar byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because of that,

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas dngos po'i chos dngos po la 'khrul pa med pa nyid rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas dngos po'i chos dngos po la 'khrul pa med pa nyid rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: the nature of things is not established by the mere wish of a person, because it is non-erroneous with respect to things.

original: thams cad go bar byed par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad go bar byed par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that everything would be an awareness-causer.

original: nged kyi ltar na de ltar 'ga' zhig go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na de ltar 'ga' zhig go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: According to us, however, this is how some people understand it.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dbye bas khyab pa smra ba gang yin pa de dag gi ltar na /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dbye bas khyab pa smra ba gang yin pa de dag gi ltar na /
translated: As for those who maintain pervasion by way of dividing the similar and dissimilar instances,

original: gang gi tshe 'khrul pa'i yul phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khrul pa'i yul phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: when the object of error is made into the similar instance,

original: 'khrul pa med la gang gi tshe phyogs su mi byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med la gang gi tshe phyogs su mi byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: then, when it is not made into the similar instance,

original: sgrub par byed pa nges bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul lo zhes dngos po nyid du smra na'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nges bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul lo zhes dngos po nyid du smra na'o //
translated: the probative argument is in error with regard to the probandum.

original: shin du dag pa zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin du dag pa zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad du byed pa'o //
translated: “Very pure” means “ridiculous.”

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i chos ma nges par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i chos ma nges par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that the property of both is indeterminate,

original: med pa'i chos 'gal bar brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: med pa'i chos 'gal bar brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to show that the property of nonexistence is contradictory, he says:

original: med pa'i chos brjod na ni 'di'i gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa'i chos brjod na ni 'di'i gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the property of nonexistence is stated, the reason is contradictory.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of nonexistence?

original: rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: The exclusion.

original: gal te rnam par bcad pa gnyi ga'i chos kyang @110a * //
analyzed: gal te rnam par bcad pa gnyi ga'i chos kyang @110a * //
translated: If the exclusion is the property of both,

original: yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it existent?

original: bshad pa / dngos po nyid la dngos po tsam khyab pa'i don rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po nyid la dngos po tsam khyab pa'i don rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: Response: The meaning of the pervasion of mere thing by thing is the exclusion of that.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i rnam par bcad pa ni dngos po med pa la nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i rnam par bcad pa ni dngos po med pa la nges pa yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of non-thing is like this exclusion.

original: rnam par bcad pa de ni dngos po 'gal la yang mi srid pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa mtha' dag la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa de ni dngos po 'gal la yang mi srid pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa mtha' dag la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since that exclusion is impossible for a thing that is contradictory, and since it exists for all non-things, it is contradictory.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i chos rnam pa 'di gsum ga yang yod pa sgrub pa la gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i chos rnam pa 'di gsum ga yang yod pa sgrub pa la gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, none of these three types of phenomena that are related to thing, non-thing, and both are characterized by a reason that establishes existence.

original: chos rnam pa gsum las rnam pa gzhan te /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum las rnam pa gzhan te /
translated: A phenomenon that is a different type

original: bye brag gzhan yang mi srid ngo //
analyzed: bye brag gzhan yang mi srid ngo //
translated: from these three types is also impossible.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na yod pa bsgrub bya ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na yod pa bsgrub bya ma yin no //
translated: Since that is so, existence is not the object of affirmation.

original: ci ste sgrub par byed pa nyid yin na ci ltar skyon med ce na /
analyzed: ci ste sgrub par byed pa nyid yin na ci ltar skyon med ce na /
translated: But if it is the object of affirmation, how can there be no fault?

original: de tsam zhes bya ba yod pa tsam khyab pa skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yod pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa 'di sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa la ni yod par grub pa'i chos can la spyi'i tshul gyis ma grub pa ma
analyzed: de tsam zhes bya ba yod pa tsam khyab pa skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yod pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa 'di sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa la ni yod par grub pa'i chos can la spyi'i tshul gyis ma grub pa ma
translated: “That much” means that mere existence is the proof of the property to be proven, such as being momentary. In the proof of mere existence, the property to be proven is not established by the general mode in the subject that is established as existent.

original: yin la / gal te yod pa tsam de dngos po tsam khyab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des khyab pa tshad mas rnam pa ci zhig ltar nges na de'i tshe 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yin la / gal te yod pa tsam de dngos po tsam khyab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des khyab pa tshad mas rnam pa ci zhig ltar nges na de'i tshe 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: If mere existence is ascertained by valid knowledge to be pervaded by mere thing, which is the property to be proven, then at that time there is no contradiction.

original: gal te yang bzlog pas khyab pa grub pa nyid 'gal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang bzlog pas khyab pa grub pa nyid 'gal ba yin gyi /
translated: If the establishment of the pervasion by the reverse is contradictory,

original: de ma grub pas 'gal ba ma yin pa de lta na yang khyab pa ma grub pa la 'gal bar dogs kyi /
analyzed: de ma grub pas 'gal ba ma yin pa de lta na yang khyab pa ma grub pa la 'gal bar dogs kyi /
translated: then it is not contradictory because it is not established. Even if it is like that, there is doubt about the nonestablishment of the pervasion, but

original: grub pa la ma yin pa des na khyab pa grub na 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa la ma yin pa des na khyab pa grub na 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: there is no doubt about the establishment. Therefore, if the pervasion is established, there is no contradiction.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba ni khyab pa ma grub pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba ni khyab pa ma grub pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pas /
translated: Doubt about the reversal from the discordant side is merely a reason for the nonestablishment of the pervasion.

original: de grub na ldog pa kho na yin pa des na ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de grub na ldog pa kho na yin pa des na ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If it is established, then it is only a contradiction. Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: gang gi phyir ci ltar grub par bya ba ltar yod pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa la ni ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges par thal ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ci ltar grub par bya ba ltar yod pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa la ni ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges par thal ba med do //
translated: Because it is an establishment of what exists as it is to be established, there is no consequence of nonestablishment, contradiction, or indeterminacy.

original: de ltar zhar las 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhar las 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus completed the digression,

original: dkyus ma nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to conclude the main point, it is said:

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: These two are reasons.

original: de nyid rang gis bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'gal ba yin gyi gzhan ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rang gis bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'gal ba yin gyi gzhan ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: They are contradictory in establishing the opposite of what is to be established by oneself, but they are not contradictory in any other way.

original: go bar byed pa nyid ni 'brel ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin la /
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid ni 'brel ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin la /
translated: Being a means of knowledge is preceded by a relation.

original: de yang @110b gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dag la khyad par med pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'brel ba ci 'dra ba can yin pa 'gal ba yang de dang 'dra ba can kho na'o zhes de ltar bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi chos rnam pa bzhi bshad
analyzed: de yang @110b gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dag la khyad par med pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'brel ba ci 'dra ba can yin pa 'gal ba yang de dang 'dra ba can kho na'o zhes de ltar bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi chos rnam pa bzhi bshad
translated: Moreover, there is no difference between those that are contradictory and those that are inconsistent with a reason. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that a reason that has a certain type of relationship is also contradictory in the same way, the master [Dignāga] explained four types of reasons.

original: do // de dag kyang sngar dper brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: do // de dag kyang sngar dper brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, they were already exemplified above.

original: khyad par srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / spyi gzhal bya nyid ma nges pa yin yang nges par smra ba'i phyir rgol ba bsal ba'i don du slob dpon gyis gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / spyi gzhal bya nyid ma nges pa yin yang nges par smra ba'i phyir rgol ba bsal ba'i don du slob dpon gyis gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Although the particular, such as life, and the general, such as the object of comprehension, are uncertain, in order to eliminate the objection that they are stated as certain, the master [Dignāga] stated two [types of reasons].

original: ma nges pa de yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba 'chad pa'i skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa de yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba 'chad pa'i skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that uncertainty will be explained when the occasion arises to explain fallacious reasons.

original: ldog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gcod pa gtsor bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ldog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gcod pa gtsor bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: [The master Dignāga] stated two [types of reasons] in order to primarily establish the exclusion of the discordant class.

original: gtan tshigs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa go ba nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa go ba nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The reason is understood by the reversal of the discordant side.🔽It is not that, having established the probandum, it causes the reversal of the other.

original: bsgrub bya bsgrubs nas gzhan zlog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bsgrub bya bsgrubs nas gzhan zlog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, there are three types of property of the subject.

original: ci ltar zhe na 'di ltar zhes smos te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na 'di ltar zhes smos te /
translated: How is it so? It is said:

original: rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi sgo thabs des ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi sgo thabs des ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: By that method of the mere pervasion, the reason is not understood.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs las rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs las rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because from the reason of impermanence, non-arising from effort is not understood.

original: mi rtag pa de ni rtsol ba las ma byung ba bsgrub pa na glog la sogs pa la mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa de ni rtsol ba las ma byung ba bsgrub pa na glog la sogs pa la mthong ba nyid do //
translated: When that impermanence is established as not arising from effort, it is seen in lightning and so on.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas go bar byed pa yin na mi rtag pa nyid kyang go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas go bar byed pa yin na mi rtag pa nyid kyang go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is understood by way of pervasion, impermanence would also be understood.

original: mi rtag pa nyid 'di las ni bsgrub bya rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid 'di las ni bsgrub bya rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: From this impermanence, the probandum is not understood.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa dang lhan cig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba go bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa dang lhan cig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba go bar byed pa yin na /
translated: Because if the pervasion is understood from the presence of the reason in similar instances,

original: 'di la ni ldog pa med pas rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di la ni ldog pa med pas rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa la /
translated: but here there is no presence of the reason in similar instances, only its absence.

original: dper brjod pa gzhan nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: dper brjod pa gzhan nye bar bkod do //
translated: To anticipate this qualm, another example is provided.

original: 'o na reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir sgra rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la bsgrub bya rtogs par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir sgra rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la bsgrub bya rtogs par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in the case of the argument, “Sound is permanent because it is not tangible,” the probandum is understood to exist.

original: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa dag las log pa yin gyi /
analyzed: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa dag las log pa yin gyi /
translated: Being not tangible is the opposite of impermanence, etc.,

original: mi rtag pa nyid lta bur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid lta bur ni ma yin no //
translated: but not like impermanence itself.

original: 'di snyam du 'di la yang gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'di la yang gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: One might think, “In this case, too, the reason is not the principal pervader because it occurs in only one part of the similar instances.

original: des na rtogs pa med pa yin no zhes dogs na @111a * //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa med pa yin no zhes dogs na @111a * //
translated: Therefore, there is no understanding of the probandum.”

original: dper brjod pa gzhan nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: dper brjod pa gzhan nye bar bkod de /
translated: To anticipate this qualm, another example is provided.

original: 'o na ni 'dir mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag la khyab pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba stobs dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'dir mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag la khyab pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba stobs dang ldan zhing /
translated: But in this case, the forward pervasion is strong because it pervades all of the similar class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig la ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa stobs chung ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig la ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa stobs chung ba yin no //
translated: The counter pervasion is weak because it is seen to be absent in some of the dissimilar class.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid bsgrub bar bya ba la mi rtag pa nyid mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag la yod pa /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid bsgrub bar bya ba la mi rtag pa nyid mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag la yod pa /
translated: Impermanence is present in all of the similar class, which is the probandum that arises as soon as it is sought.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ni phyogs gcig nam mkha' la sogs pa las ldog pa yin no //🔽'di snyam du 'dir yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ni phyogs gcig nam mkha' la sogs pa las ldog pa yin no // 'di snyam du 'dir yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is absent in one part of the dissimilar class, such as space.

original: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: You may think, “In this case, it is not understood because there is no counter pervasion of the entire dissimilar class.”

original: gal te gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa yin pa de lta na ni 'on gang 'ga' zhig byas pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa yin pa de lta na ni 'on gang 'ga' zhig byas pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: If the reason is a counter pervasion of the entire dissimilar class, then it is like this: Whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: rtag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dag 'dis ldog pa'i don ci 'dra ba bzhin brjod pa de 'dra ba kho na bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus su chos can la yod par nges pa gtan tshigs su 'dod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dag 'dis ldog pa'i don ci 'dra ba bzhin brjod pa de 'dra ba kho na bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus su chos can la yod par nges pa gtan tshigs su 'dod par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were so, then it would be asserted that the reason is the ascertainment that the subject has a property just like the one expressed in the proof.

original: de lta yin na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa'i rgyus go bar byed pa nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa'i rgyus go bar byed pa nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then it would be asserted that the reason is understood by the power of the exclusion of the discordant class.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba mi mthun ba'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa med na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba mi mthun ba'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa med na /
translated: If it were not so, then without the exclusion of the discordant class,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be possible to teach the exclusion from all discordant classes.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub bya rtogs par byed pa'i dus su mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog bar nges pa go bar byed par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub bya rtogs par byed pa'i dus su mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog bar nges pa go bar byed par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if at the time of understanding the probandum, the reason is asserted to be the understanding of the ascertainment that the subject is excluded from all discordant classes,🔽then the reason would be the ascertainment that the subject has a property just like the one expressed in the proof.

original: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can la rtag pa dang me med rnam par bcad pa ma byas par ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las log par nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can la rtag pa dang me med rnam par bcad pa ma byas par ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las log par nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without the exclusion of permanence and the absence of fire in regard to the subject, sound, place, etc., it is not possible to ascertain the exclusion from all discordant instances.

original: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par the tshom za la /
analyzed: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par the tshom za la /
translated: One is in doubt as to whether sound, place, etc. are themselves discordant instances.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos por the tshom za ba'i chos can de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos por the tshom za ba'i chos can de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa yin no //
translated: When the reason is applied to a subject which is in doubt as to being a discordant instance, there is the suspicion that it is applied to a discordant instance.

original: de'i phyir gal te rtogs pa pos mthong ba der mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa nyid byas bas bsgrub bya go bar byed ba de lta na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rtogs pa pos mthong ba der mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa nyid byas bas bsgrub bya go bar byed ba de lta na /
translated: Therefore, if the proponent understands that the probandum is made known by the exclusion of the discordant instance, then

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun @111b pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun @111b pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: the reason is shown to be excluded from all discordant instances.

original: gal te ci ltar rtag pa rnam par bcad nas de rnam par bcad par mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid rtogs na shugs kyis rtag par mi rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar rtag pa rnam par bcad nas de rnam par bcad par mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid rtogs na shugs kyis rtag par mi rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one understands impermanence by way of the elimination of permanence, then does one not understand permanence by implication?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang gnas skabs gang du mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya ba de'i tshe shugs kyis go bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa mi rtogs so //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang gnas skabs gang du mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya ba de'i tshe shugs kyis go bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa mi rtogs so //
translated: Although that is true, still, at the time when one understands impermanence by way of the mode of proof, one does not understand by implication the elimination of the discordant side.

original: de ma rtogs na yang gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za bas /
analyzed: de ma rtogs na yang gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za bas /
translated: And if one does not understand that, then one doubts that the reason is absent from the discordant side.

original: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par nges pa nye bar sdud par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par nges pa nye bar sdud par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how could one draw the conclusion that the subject, such as sound or a place, is impermanent?

original: de'i phyir gal te gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa de ltar na mi rtag pa nyid du nges pa nye bar sdud par nus pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa de ltar na mi rtag pa nyid du nges pa nye bar sdud par nus pa yin /
translated: Therefore, if the reason is ascertained to be absent in the discordant side, then it is able to ascertain impermanence.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam bar bcad pa nyid bsgrub bya'i chos can la byas pas gang na 'di yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri tsam yang med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam bar bcad pa nyid bsgrub bya'i chos can la byas pas gang na 'di yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri tsam yang med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since the exclusion of the discordant side is itself the property of the subject, wherever this exists, the discordant side is completely absent, and so the discordant side is understood to be nonexistent.

original: des na bsgrub pa'i shugs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad par bya ba yin ;
analyzed: des na bsgrub pa'i shugs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad par bya ba yin ;
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of the discordant side is established by implication.

original: sgrub par rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub par rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not that the establishment is understood by the exclusion itself,

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the reason would be indeterminate.

original: rnam par bcad pan yid rtogs na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par nges pas gtan tshigs nyams pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pan yid rtogs na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par nges pas gtan tshigs nyams pa med pa nyid do //
translated: If the exclusion is understood, then the reason is not undermined, because it is ascertained to be the opposite of all the discordant side.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba 'di yod pa tsam gyis bsgrub bya rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba 'di yod pa tsam gyis bsgrub bya rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mere existence of this concomitance does not prove the probandum.

original: mi rtag pa nyid las rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid las rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because impermanence is not understood from effort.

original: mnyam pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyam pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by equality,

original: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because impermanence is not understood from the non-sensible.

original: gtso che bas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso che bas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by predominance,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la rtsol ba las byung ba nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la rtsol ba las byung ba nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because effort is not understood from impermanence.

original: de bzhin du khyad par byed pa ma yin pas na rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin yang log pa'i khyab pa yod na rtogs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par byed pa ma yin pas na rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin yang log pa'i khyab pa yod na rtogs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, even though concomitance is not predominant because it does not make a distinction, if there is pervasion by the opposite, there is understanding.🔽For example,

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa ston pa'o //
translated: this shows an example.

original: 'dir ni rtsol ba las byung ba @112a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni rtsol ba las byung ba @112a * //
translated: Here, effort is

original: nyid mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa yin yang /
analyzed: nyid mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa yin yang /
translated: present in one similar instance.

original: 'di'i ldog pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyab pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i ldog pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyab pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: Because of this, the opposite of the reason is seen to pervade the discordant side.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin ba dang / ldog pas mi mthun ba'i phyogs khyab pa'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin ba dang / ldog pas mi mthun ba'i phyogs khyab pa'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the reason is not the principal positive concomitance and because the opposite of the reason pervades the discordant side,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba de lta bu nyid du shes pa gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba de lta bu nyid du shes pa gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: it is said that “it is like that,” and that is the reason.

original: ci ltar shes pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar shes pa zhe na /
translated: How is it known?

original: gang rtsol ba las byung ba de ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa mthun pa'i phyogs la gcig tu nges par ro //
analyzed: gang rtsol ba las byung ba de ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa mthun pa'i phyogs la gcig tu nges par ro //
translated: It is known that “whatever is produced is impermanent” because the opposite of the reason pervades the discordant side alone.

original: de lta bu gtan tshigs yin bas na rtag pa rnam bar bcad pa nyid kyi rgyus gtan tshigs mi rtag pa go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bu gtan tshigs yin bas na rtag pa rnam bar bcad pa nyid kyi rgyus gtan tshigs mi rtag pa go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Since that is the reason, the reason “impermanent” is understood by the cause of the exclusion of permanence.

original: sgrub pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not understood by the cause of affirmation.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par nges pa'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin du chug pa de lta na yang ci ltar rtag pa rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par nges pa'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin du chug pa de lta na yang ci ltar rtag pa rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Suppose one said that although it is the case that the statement “Sound is impermanent” is a reason that definitely excludes all discordant factors, how could it be understood in terms of the exclusion of permanence?

original: bshad pa / ldog pa rtogs na ngag 'di'i nus pa zhes bya ba'i don 'brel pa nyid gang yin pa de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / ldog pa rtogs na ngag 'di'i nus pa zhes bya ba'i don 'brel pa nyid gang yin pa de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: When the exclusion is understood, the capacity of this statement is complete, that is, the relation is complete.

original: dag 'di'i don ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: dag 'di'i don ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The reason is the exclusion of all discordant factors.

original: de ni ldog pa rtogs par gyur na 'brel pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni ldog pa rtogs par gyur na 'brel pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When the exclusion is understood, the relation is complete.

original: de 'dra ba'i ldog pa de yang sgra la rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad pa yin na 'gyur la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i ldog pa de yang sgra la rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad pa yin na 'gyur la /
translated: That exclusion is like this: If it is the exclusion of permanence in sound, then it is so.

original: sbyor ba gzhan la ni me med pa rnam par bcad pa yin na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan la ni me med pa rnam par bcad pa yin na 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the exclusion of the absence of fire in relation to another application, then it is so.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang sa phyogs su rtag pa dang me med rnam par bcad pa byas pa gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las bzlog pa dang ldan par shes pa de lta na go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang sa phyogs su rtag pa dang me med rnam par bcad pa byas pa gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las bzlog pa dang ldan par shes pa de lta na go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one knows that the reason, “the absence of the existence of sound and place,” is the opposite of all the discordant sides, then it is the cause of understanding, but not otherwise.

original: sgrub pa go bar bya ba yin na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la mi mthun pa'i phyogs su dogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag la ldog par mi nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa go bar bya ba yin na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la mi mthun pa'i phyogs su dogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag la ldog par mi nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the proof were the object of understanding, then because of the doubt that the subject of the probandum is the discordant side, the doubt that it occurs in the discordant side would not be certain to be the opposite of all the discordant sides.

original: cig shos kyis lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: cig shos kyis lan smras pa ni /
translated: The other one replies:

original: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de dag las tha dad pa tsam ni sgra dang sa phyogs @112b la sogs pa'i chos can de la go bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de dag las tha dad pa tsam ni sgra dang sa phyogs @112b la sogs pa'i chos can de la go bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The mere difference from those, such as permanence, is not the object of understanding in that subject, such as sound and place.

original: tha dad pa tsam des ni rtogs pa bo la dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa tsam des ni rtogs pa bo la dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere difference does not cause doubt in the one who understands.

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi de nyid mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa go bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi de nyid mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pa go bar bya ba yin no //
translated: However, the universality of impermanence and so on is understood as the exclusion of the dissimilar and the unmixed, which is the elimination of the dissimilar class.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: The idea is this:

original: sgrub pas rtogs na shugs kyis rnam par bcad par 'gyur ba dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pas rtogs na shugs kyis rnam par bcad par 'gyur ba dka' ba yin no //
translated: If it were established by a proof, it would be difficult to understand the exclusion by implication.

original: des na 'di la 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bsgrub pa dang rnam par gcod pa gnyi gcig car nyid bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di la 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bsgrub pa dang rnam par gcod pa gnyi gcig car nyid bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this case, both the establishment and the exclusion are done simultaneously, saying This is just that, not something else.

original: rnam par gcod pa tsam la ni dogs pa cung zad kyang med do zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa tsam la ni dogs pa cung zad kyang med do zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that there is not the slightest doubt about mere exclusion.

original: gal te de dag gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te de dag gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are not necessarily...

original: gal te spyi mi mthun pa las rnam par bcad pa ma rtogs na mngon par 'dod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi de nyid nges par mi 'gyur to /
analyzed: gal te spyi mi mthun pa las rnam par bcad pa ma rtogs na mngon par 'dod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi de nyid nges par mi 'gyur to /
translated: If the exclusion from the dissimilar is not understood, then that very universality of impermanence and so on, which is the desired object, will not be ascertained.

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because there would be doubt.

original: gzhan rnam par bcad pa byas na yang de rnam par bcad pa cig shos kyis rang bzhin nges pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir spyi gzhan nges pas ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhan rnam par bcad pa byas na yang de rnam par bcad pa cig shos kyis rang bzhin nges pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir spyi gzhan nges pas ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: If the exclusion of other is understood, then the exclusion of that other is understood. Since the nature of the object is ascertained, what is the use of ascertaining the other, the universal?

original: gal te me la sogs pa de dag gdon mi za bar me las tha dad pa gzhan dang 'dres pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba nyid du rtogs par bya ba yin na 'o na 'di dag gis med ba las tha dad pa dang ma 'dres ba
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa de dag gdon mi za bar me las tha dad pa gzhan dang 'dres pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba nyid du rtogs par bya ba yin na 'o na 'di dag gis med ba las tha dad pa dang ma 'dres ba
translated: If it is necessary to understand that fire and so on are definitely separate from other things and not mixed with other things, then it would be necessary to understand that they are separate from non-fire and not mixed with non-fire.

original: de nyid go bar bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de nyid go bar bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: That is all that is necessary to understand.

original: gal te me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa rtogs na /
translated: If the exclusion of non-fire is understood,

original: me ma rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: me ma rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then fire itself would not be understood.

original: bshad pa / gzhan rnam par bcad ba rtogs pa de tsam gyis mngon bar 'dod pa'i yul nges pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan rnam par bcad ba rtogs pa de tsam gyis mngon bar 'dod pa'i yul nges pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: Because the mere exclusion of other is understood, the result of ascertaining the object that is intended is complete, that is, established.

original: 'dir me nges par bya ba yin no /
analyzed: 'dir me nges par bya ba yin no /
translated: Here, fire is ascertained.

original: me ma yin pa ni me rnam par bcad pa yin la /🔽me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa yang me yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me ma yin pa ni me rnam par bcad pa yin la / me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa yang me yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Non-fire is the exclusion of fire.🔽And because the exclusion of non-fire is fire,

original: me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa nges nas me nyid nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa nges nas me nyid nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: when the exclusion of non-fire is ascertained, fire itself is ascertained,

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other mode.

original: des na me la sogs pa de dag gi me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa tsam go bar bya ba ma yin zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: des na me la sogs pa de dag gi me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa tsam go bar bya ba ma yin zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that fire and so on are not understood as the mere exclusion of non-fire?

original: gal te de lta na 'on yu bu cag khyad ci yod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'on yu bu cag khyad ci yod /
translated: If that is so, then what is the difference between us?

original: khyod kyis @113a * //
analyzed: khyod kyis @113a * //
translated: You say,

original: kyang me ma yin pa na rnam par bcad pa zhes bya ba me de go bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: kyang me ma yin pa na rnam par bcad pa zhes bya ba me de go bar bya ba yin la /
translated: “The so-called exclusion of non-fire is understood as fire.

original: ngas kyang de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ngas kyang de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is that itself.”

original: khyod kyis ni me bsgrubs nas de'i shugs kyis shes ba gzhan gyis me ma yin ba rnam par gcod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni me bsgrubs nas de'i shugs kyis shes ba gzhan gyis me ma yin ba rnam par gcod par bya ba yin la /
translated: You establish fire and by the force of that, the exclusion of non-fire is understood by another cognition.

original: ngas ni 'jug pa gcig gi me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa'i me nyid go bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ngas ni 'jug pa gcig gi me ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa'i me nyid go bar bya ba yin te /
translated: But I understand fire itself, the exclusion of non-fire, by a single engagement.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan ma yin pas khyad par che'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan ma yin pas khyad par che'o //
translated: Since the absence of a discordant side is nothing other than the probandum, there is a great difference.

original: 'on kyang khyod kyis kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gcod pa gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa de tsam la brten nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod kyis kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gcod pa gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa de tsam la brten nas /
