translated: However, you have said that it is only in dependence on the mere fact that the elimination of the discordant side must be done without fail

original: gzhan rnam par gcod pa de nyid go bar bya ba yin mod ces de skad du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par gcod pa de nyid go bar bya ba yin mod ces de skad du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: that the elimination of the other is understood.

original: khyed kyi lta ba de ltar ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa nyid du bya mi nus te /
analyzed: khyed kyi lta ba de ltar ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa nyid du bya mi nus te /
translated: But in your view, it is not possible to eliminate the other.

original: 'di ltar ci srid gzhan rnam par ma bcad pa de srid du ni sgrub pa de nyid mi mthun pa dang bral ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci srid gzhan rnam par ma bcad pa de srid du ni sgrub pa de nyid mi mthun pa dang bral ba ma yin la /
translated: For as long as the other is not eliminated, for that long the probandum is not free from the discordant side.

original: ci srid du sgrub pa med pa de srid du yang gzhan rnam par gcod pa med pa de'i phyir 'di tsam zhig brjod do //
analyzed: ci srid du sgrub pa med pa de srid du yang gzhan rnam par gcod pa med pa de'i phyir 'di tsam zhig brjod do //
translated: And for as long as the probandum is not established, for that long the other is not eliminated. Therefore, we say this much:

original: gal te khyod kyis gzhan rnam bar bcad pa gdon mi za bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis gzhan rnam bar bcad pa gdon mi za bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If you must eliminate the other,

original: de nyid kyi me la sogs pa rtogs la rag mod /
analyzed: de nyid kyi me la sogs pa rtogs la rag mod /
translated: It is indeed the case that the fire and so on are realized.🔽But what need is there to realize some other universal that abides in the middle between the exclusions and the exclusions?

original: bar du rnam par gcod pa dang / rnam par bcad pa dag gi dbus na gnas pa'i spyi gzhan rtogs pa ci zhig bya sgrib byed lta bu'i spyi de ni tshogs kyi bar na gnas pa'i bar gcod lta bu yin pa'i phyir des cung zad kyang byar med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi
analyzed: bar du rnam par gcod pa dang / rnam par bcad pa dag gi dbus na gnas pa'i spyi gzhan rtogs pa ci zhig bya sgrib byed lta bu'i spyi de ni tshogs kyi bar na gnas pa'i bar gcod lta bu yin pa'i phyir des cung zad kyang byar med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi
translated: This is because that universal, like an obstruction, is like an obstruction that abides in the middle of the collection.

original: za bar bya ba'i ldog pa sgrub pas ston par byed do //🔽de'i phyir de ltar phyogs kyi chos dgu bstan pa'i zhar la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa de dag las gzhan pa'i go bar byed pa gzhan dag gis mthong nas 'o na zhes smras so //
analyzed: za bar bya ba'i ldog pa sgrub pas ston par byed do // de'i phyir de ltar phyogs kyi chos dgu bstan pa'i zhar la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa de dag las gzhan pa'i go bar byed pa gzhan dag gis mthong nas 'o na zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, this is definitely taught by the proof of the reverse of the object to be enacted.🔽Thus, in the course of teaching the nine properties of the subject, the three types of evidence that are known as nature, effect, and non-apprehension have been explained.🔽Having seen that there are other types of evidence besides these three, someone might ask, “Well then, how is the arising of an effect inferred?”

original: 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa gsum gyis nang du ci ltar 'dus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa gsum gyis nang du ci ltar 'dus te /
translated: How is that included within the three types of evidence that are nature, effect, and non-apprehension?

original: 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa ni gtan tshigs rnam par gsum gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa ni gtan tshigs rnam par gsum gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the inference of the arising of the effect is not based on the three kinds of logical reason.

original: nus pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa gang @113b yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa gang @113b yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the inference of the arising of the effect from a cause that is able to give rise to it?

original: 'dir nus pa'i rgyu ni ci snyed cig yul gang na gnas bas 'bras bu de skyed par mthong ba de dag rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i tshogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir nus pa'i rgyu ni ci snyed cig yul gang na gnas bas 'bras bu de skyed par mthong ba de dag rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i tshogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the cause that is able to give rise to it is the collection of causes that are present in a suitable place, to the extent that the effect is seen to arise from them.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i tshogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i tshogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the collection that is in the final stage,

original: der ni rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sngon rol nyid du 'bras bu mngon du gyur pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu mngon sum yin na yang tha ma'i gnas skabs nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der ni rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sngon rol nyid du 'bras bu mngon du gyur pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu mngon sum yin na yang tha ma'i gnas skabs nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that case, the effect would be manifest prior to the inference of the reason, and even if the effect were manifest, it would not be suitable to ascertain the final stage.

original: 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par brjod do //
translated: This inference of the arising of the effect is said to be an inference based on the nature of things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it does not depend on another thing.

original: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is related to that alone.

original: ci ltar 'bras bu skye ba gzhan la mi ltos te /
analyzed: ci ltar 'bras bu skye ba gzhan la mi ltos te /
translated: How is it that the effect does not depend on another arising?

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma tha ma la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma tha ma la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it depends on the final moment,

original: 'di yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes smos te /
translated: then the response is: “This also.”

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
translated: It generates the effect.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni ci 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni ci 'dra ba ste /
translated: How? means what kind.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa ci 'dra ba zhig nye ba'i nye ba de 'dra ba las don gzhan la mi ltos pas na /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa ci 'dra ba zhig nye ba'i nye ba de 'dra ba las don gzhan la mi ltos pas na /
translated: Since the collection of causes is not related to another thing,

original: ngo bo'i de 'dra ba tsam dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo'i de 'dra ba tsam dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: it is a nature that is related to that mere similarity of essence.

original: 'dir skad cig la brten pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir skad cig la brten pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Here, it does not depend on a moment.

original: rgyu ni de tsam nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir ltos ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu ni de tsam nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir ltos ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause generates that alone, and therefore it is said to be independent.

original: mi ltos kyang 'bras bu skye ba don gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi ltos kyang 'bras bu skye ba don gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is independent, since the arising of the effect is another thing,

original: ci ltar tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: how is it the nature of the collection?

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa de la ni rgyu tshogs par rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par rung ba nyid 'ga' zhig rjes su dpog par byed la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa de la ni rgyu tshogs par rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par rung ba nyid 'ga' zhig rjes su dpog par byed la /
translated: Because one infers the arising of an effect, one infers that the assemblage of causes that is fit to exist in a suitable place generates an effect that is fit to arise.

original: rung bde yang tshogs pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: rung bde yang tshogs pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: And that fitness is related to the mere assemblage.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because that is so, it is only the nature of that.

original: 'o na gal te 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba can yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba can yin na /
translated: If the capacity to generate an effect is related to that mere assemblage,

original: 'o na 'bras bu skyed par nges pa'i phyir de ci ltar 'bras bu kho na nges par rjes su dpog par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu skyed par nges pa'i phyir de ci ltar 'bras bu kho na nges par rjes su dpog par mi byed ce na /
translated: then since it is certain that the effect will be generated, why don’t you infer only the effect?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir rgyu'i rdzas rnams tshogs pa dag kho nas te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir rgyu'i rdzas rnams tshogs pa dag kho nas te /
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: tshogs pa nyid tsam las rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid tsam las rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere assemblage of causal substances does not generate its own effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu skye ba ni tshogs pa las skye ba'i nus pa gang yin pa de rnams @114a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba ni tshogs pa las skye ba'i nus pa gang yin pa de rnams @114a * //
translated: The arising of the effect is the potential to arise from the assembly of causes and conditions.🔽

original: kyi 'gyur ba phyi ma khyad par du 'byung ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi 'gyur ba phyi ma khyad par du 'byung ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of the effect is dependent on the transformation of those potentialities which are the causes of the arising from the assemblage.

original: phyi ma phyi ma khyad par du 'gyur ba la ltos kyang ci'i phyir 'bras bu rjes su mi dpog ce na /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma khyad par du 'gyur ba la ltos kyang ci'i phyir 'bras bu rjes su mi dpog ce na /
translated: Even though the subsequent effects are dependent on the transformation of the prior causes, why is the effect not inferred?

original: bshad pa / bar 'dir te nus pa yongs su 'gyur ba skye ba'i bar du gags byed ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / bar 'dir te nus pa yongs su 'gyur ba skye ba'i bar du gags byed ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is possible that there is an obstruction to the arising of the transformation of the potentialities.

original: gal te 'bras bu skye ba la gegs byed pa srid na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skye ba la gegs byed pa srid na /
translated: If it is possible that there is an obstruction to the arising of the effect,

original: 'o na rung pa nyid kyang gcig tu nges par rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rung pa nyid kyang gcig tu nges par rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the ascertainment of the possibility of the effect is not inferred.

original: bshad pa / rung ba ni rdzas kyi tshogs nye ba las rdzas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bshad pa / rung ba ni rdzas kyi tshogs nye ba las rdzas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: We reply: There is no contradiction in the inference of the possibility, because the possibility is dependent on the proximity of the assemblage of causes, and not on another substance.

original: rjes su dpog pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference, he says:

original: rgyu tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The subject is “from the assemblage of causes.”

original: 'di nus pa'i phyi ma phyi ma 'gyur ba 'phul du byung ba gang yin pa de rgyur gyur pas 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nus pa'i phyi ma phyi ma 'gyur ba 'phul du byung ba gang yin pa de rgyur gyur pas 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement “it is able to generate an effect” is the thesis.

original: nus pa 'gyur ba bogs 'byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ltos par bya ba gzhan de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nus pa 'gyur ba bogs 'byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ltos par bya ba gzhan de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The statement “because the other, the cooperative condition that is the transformation and enhancement of potency, is not present” is the reason.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir rgyu tshogs par dzas gzhan la mi ltos pa de'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu tshogs par dzas gzhan la mi ltos pa de'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par rung ba yin no //
translated: Because the collection of causes does not depend on another, it is suitable to generate an effect.

original: gal te mthong ba'i rgyu tshogs pa de ni rung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rgyu tshogs pa de ni rung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the collection of causes that is seen is not suitable,

original: gang gi phyir rung ba nyid de ni tshogs pa de ni rgyu mtshan can phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ci ltar de ltos pa ma med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rung ba nyid de ni tshogs pa de ni rgyu mtshan can phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ci ltar de ltos pa ma med pa yin zhe na /
translated: then why is it not suitable? Because that suitability depends on another condition, a later state.

original: nus pa skye ba ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: nus pa skye ba ni zhes smos te /
translated: The statement “the arising of potency” is the response to that question.

original: rang gi rigs kyang yin la /🔽snga ma yang yin pa de kho na 'am /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyang yin la / snga ma yang yin pa de kho na 'am /
translated: It is of its own kind,

original: de tsam gyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: and it is the antecedent of that, or it is the cause of that alone.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu can yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir tshogs pa'i nus pa gzhan la mi ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu can yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir tshogs pa'i nus pa gzhan la mi ltos pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the cause of that alone, the power of the assemblage does not depend on another.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'dir gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid kyis rung ba'i gnas skabs skye ba'i yul bsgrub par bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid kyis rung ba'i gnas skabs skye ba'i yul bsgrub par bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the establishment of the object of the arising of the state of readiness, by its independence from another,

original: rgyun la yin gyi skad cig ma la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun la yin gyi skad cig ma la ni ma yin no //
translated: is in regard to a continuum, not in regard to a moment.

original: tshogs pa'i rgyun de la ni rung ba nyid kyi yul la gzhan la mi ltos pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rgyun de la ni rung ba nyid kyi yul la gzhan la mi ltos pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: For, in regard to that continuum of the assemblage, there is the state of readiness, which is independent of another.

original: 'di ltar 'dir 'bras bu nges pa ma yin la rung ba'i gnas skabs gzhan yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir 'bras bu nges pa ma yin la rung ba'i gnas skabs gzhan yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, here there is no ascertainment of the effect, nor is there another state of readiness,

original: the tshom za ba'i yul rjes su dpog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i yul rjes su dpog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is there an inference of a doubtful object.

original: de'i phyir gang the tshom med pa des rjes su @114b dpog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang the tshom med pa des rjes su @114b dpog par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is without doubt is to be inferred.

original: de la gegs byed pa med na 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba ni rtags ba'i mtha' bzung ba'i 'bras bu yod bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gegs byed pa med na 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba ni rtags ba'i mtha' bzung ba'i 'bras bu yod bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: If there is no obstruction, then the effect is said to arise. This is the effect that is imagined by the Naiyāyika.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba yang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba yang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is also called “existence.”

original: des na rtag pa'i mtha' bzung gi rung ba'i dngos po'i yul nyid ni tshogs pa rnams la nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtag pa'i mtha' bzung gi rung ba'i dngos po'i yul nyid ni tshogs pa rnams la nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the object that is fit for the assemblage is ascertained.

original: gal te tshogs pa de dag rung ba'i gnas skabs skye ba brgyal ba'i yul gyi dngos por yang ma nges na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa de dag rung ba'i gnas skabs skye ba brgyal ba'i yul gyi dngos por yang ma nges na ni /
translated: If the existence of the object that is fit for the assemblage that is about to arise were not ascertained,

original: gegs byed pa med kyang gzhan bzhin du de dag las 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gegs byed pa med kyang gzhan bzhin du de dag las 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even if there were no obstruction, the effect would not arise from it, just as it does not from something else.

original: de'i phyir rung ba nyid brgyal ba'i bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i nges pa ni yul gyi dngos po nges pa yin la rjes su dpag par bya ba yang de yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rung ba nyid brgyal ba'i bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i nges pa ni yul gyi dngos po nges pa yin la rjes su dpag par bya ba yang de yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the object that is fit for the assemblage is ascertained, and that is what is to be inferred.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba srid par rjes su dpog pa la yang don gzhan la mi ltos pa 'di nyid du rtags yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba srid par rjes su dpog pa la yang don gzhan la mi ltos pa 'di nyid du rtags yin no //
translated: The omniscience and dispassion of the Buddha are inferred from the fact that he is a person who does not depend on another with regard to this matter.

original: gal te res 'ga' ba'i dngos po'i yul nyid rjes su dpag bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' ba'i dngos po'i yul nyid rjes su dpag bar bya ba yin no //
translated: If the object of the inference is a thing that is sometimes existent,

original: ci'i phyir tshogs pa nyid yin gyi re re ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshogs pa nyid yin gyi re re ma yin zhe na /
translated: why is the collection of causes the object of inference and not each individual cause?

original: ma tshogs pa la ni shin du nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshogs pa la ni shin du nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each individual cause is not capable of producing the effect by itself.

original: srid pa'i yul du gyur ba'i rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa kho nas rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: srid pa'i yul du gyur ba'i rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa kho nas rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: The capability of the collection of causes to produce the effect is inferred from the fact that the effect is produced when the collection of causes is present.

original: re re ni skyed par byed pa ma yin la rung ba'i gnas skabs skye ba'i yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: re re ni skyed par byed pa ma yin la rung ba'i gnas skabs skye ba'i yul yang ma yin te /
translated: Each individual cause is not capable of producing the effect, nor is the collection of causes in a state of non-production capable of producing the effect.

original: tshogs pa nyid rung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang gcig las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽des na shin du nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid rung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang gcig las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // des na shin du nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because the collection of causes is capable of producing the effect, and because the effect does not arise from a single cause.🔽Therefore, each individual cause is not capable of producing the effect.

original: de'i phyir gcig las 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig las 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not inferred from a single cause.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar brjod par 'dod de /
translated: When you want to say this,

original: ci ltar bum pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod kyang nus pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar sa bon ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar bum pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod kyang nus pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar sa bon ni ma yin te /
translated: you should say, “Just as a pot, even though its cooperative conditions are present, is not able to produce an effect, a seed is not like that.🔽When a seed is near its cooperative conditions, it is able to produce an effect.”

original: sa bon ni lhan cig byed ba'i rkyen nye na nus pa yin no zhes bya ba yin pa de lta na ni nus pa rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: sa bon ni lhan cig byed ba'i rkyen nye na nus pa yin no zhes bya ba yin pa de lta na ni nus pa rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: In that case, you would be inferring the seed’s ability.

original: de tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed bar rung ba skye ba'i yul rung ba nyid ni 'di kho nar yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes de 'dra bar rjes su dpag bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong yang lhag ma dang ldan @115a * //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed bar rung ba skye ba'i yul rung ba nyid ni 'di kho nar yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes de 'dra bar rjes su dpag bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong yang lhag ma dang ldan @115a * //
translated: But you are not inferring that the seed is able to produce an effect only in that place where the effect arises, and not in any other place.

original: pas rjes su dpog pa 'di ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas rjes su dpog pa 'di ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though you do not see the seed operating in a place where the effect does not occur, this inference is inconclusive because it is not certain that the seed does not exist in that place.

original: 'dir rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba la rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba la rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: In this case, the place where the effect does not occur is the object to be affirmed as not suitable for the production of the effect.

original: gal te mtshogs pa 'ga' gang rung pa yin pa la 'jug par ma mthong pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te mtshogs pa 'ga' gang rung pa yin pa la 'jug par ma mthong pa de lta na yang /
translated: If you do not see the application of the word “some” to any of the collections,

original: gang gi phyir de dngos su nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dngos su nus pa ma yin la /
translated: then because it is not directly capable of that,

original: 'bras bu de tsam gyi rigs dang 'brel pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de tsam gyi rigs dang 'brel pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and because it is not related to a class of effects, therefore the inference is incomplete.

original: dper brjod pa bstan pa ni lus dang dbang po dang blo de dag las 'dod chags la sogs ba rjes su dpog pa ni lhag ma dang ldan par blta ste /
analyzed: dper brjod pa bstan pa ni lus dang dbang po dang blo de dag las 'dod chags la sogs ba rjes su dpog pa ni lhag ma dang ldan par blta ste /
translated: The example is taught: “The inference of desire, etc. from those bodies, faculties, and cognitions is seen to be incomplete.”

original: gang gi phyir bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa rgyu yin pas so //
translated: Because the cause is the adherence to “I” and “mine.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / nga dang nga'i zhes ma mthong ba las rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / nga dang nga'i zhes ma mthong ba las rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: “Because there is no desire and anger in the absence of the view of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’”

original: yang ci'i phyir dar 'dzin pa med par de dag mi 'byung zhen tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dar 'dzin pa med par de dag mi 'byung zhen tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes smos so //
translated: Why is it that they do not occur in the absence of the view of the transitory collection?🔽The phrase “due to incorrect mental activity” is supplied.

original: tshul ni don gyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: tshul ni don gyi de kho na'o //
translated: The correct way is the reality of the object.

original: tshul dang tshul ci lta ba bzhin du yid la byed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshul dang tshul ci lta ba bzhin du yid la byed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Correct mental attention is mental attention that is in accordance with the way things are.

original: don gyi de kho na la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi de kho na la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the objective support for reality.

original: de las bzlog pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is incorrect mental attention.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four types:

original: mi brten pa la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'i rnam pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag gi rnam pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mi brten pa la brten pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'i rnam pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag gi rnam pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the aspect of non-reliance as reliance, the aspect of pleasure in regard to suffering, the aspect of self in regard to non-self, and the aspect of purity in regard to impurity.

original: de lta bu dag med par ni nyes pa rnams mi skye'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag med par ni nyes pa rnams mi skye'o //
translated: Faults do not arise in the absence of such.

original: brtan par phyin ci log pa dang / bde bar phyin ci log pa dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dag ni thams cad la rjes su 'brel te /
analyzed: brtan par phyin ci log pa dang / bde bar phyin ci log pa dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dag ni thams cad la rjes su 'brel te /
translated: The errors of permanence, pleasure, and purity are related to all.

original: bdag tu phyin ci log pa dang brten pa tsam gyis gnas pa ni thams cad la yod pa nyid de thos pas bskyed ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu phyin ci log pa dang brten pa tsam gyis gnas pa ni thams cad la yod pa nyid de thos pas bskyed ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The error of self is present in all, merely as a support, but it is not generated by listening.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin ba yid la byed pa med par nyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir dar 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin ba yid la byed pa med par nyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir dar 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Thus, since faults do not arise without such improper mental activity, the latter is the antecedent of the former.

original: de la lus dang dbang po ni re zhig rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de la lus dang dbang po ni re zhig rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The body and the sense faculties are not the cause of the faults,

original: blo ni res 'ga' yin no //
analyzed: blo ni res 'ga' yin no //
translated: because the mind is sometimes not in accord with them.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag la rgyu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag la rgyu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the cause of the faults.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rgyu nyid yin yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rgyu nyid yin yang ngo //
translated: Even if they were the cause in some way,

original: @115b lus rgyas pa dang lang tsho'i gnas skabs thob pa ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sad pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: @115b lus rgyas pa dang lang tsho'i gnas skabs thob pa ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sad pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: the growth of the body and the attainment of the stage of youth are the cause of the arousal of the attachment to “I” and “mine.”

original: brgyud nas 'dod chags kyi rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyud nas 'dod chags kyi rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also the indirect cause of passion.

original: de bzhin du dbang po brtas pa dag kyang sad pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ci lta bar ni rnam 'brel gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po brtas pa dag kyang sad pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ci lta bar ni rnam 'brel gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the development of the sense faculties is the cause of the arousal of passion.

original: lus dang dbang po dag dngos su rgyu ma yin no zhes ni nges pa de'i phyir brgyud bas rgyu nyid yin yang /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dag dngos su rgyu ma yin no zhes ni nges pa de'i phyir brgyud bas rgyu nyid yin yang /
translated: The body and the sense faculties are not the actual cause.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig pa rnams la nus pa med do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig pa rnams la nus pa med do //
translated: Therefore, even though they are the cause indirectly, they are not capable of producing the conception of “I” and “mine” in those who are free from the conception of “I” and “mine.”

original: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'jug pa ma mthong du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa'i rtags 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'jug pa ma mthong du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa'i rtags 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even though one does not see the entry of the conception of “I” and “mine” in those who are free from attachment, which is the opposite of attachment, this inference still has a remainder.

original: lhag ma dang ldan ba'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa ni 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan ba'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa ni 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: The statement that it has a remainder is mistaken.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa mi nges pa'i phyir 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa mi nges pa'i phyir 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: It is mistaken because the mere non-observation of the opposite is not a valid reason for the negation.

original: des na lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la rung ba nyid nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la rung ba nyid nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body, the sense faculties, and the mind are not ascertained to be the proper object of the conception of “I.”

original: ltos par bya ba nye bar len par gyur pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba nye bar len par gyur pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is another cause that is the object of the conception of “I.”

original: des na de dag las srid par rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag las srid par rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, form is not inferred from those.

original: 'o na rgyur ma gyur cing 'bras bur yang ma gyur pa dang / gzhan zhes bya ba rang bzhin ma yin pa khyad par can gyi ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa dper na mun khung na aa mra dang ma du lung ga'i ro myangs pa las de dang lhan cig pa'i gzugs kyi khyad par
analyzed: 'o na rgyur ma gyur cing 'bras bur yang ma gyur pa dang / gzhan zhes bya ba rang bzhin ma yin pa khyad par can gyi ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa dper na mun khung na aa mra dang ma du lung ga'i ro myangs pa las de dang lhan cig pa'i gzugs kyi khyad par
translated: If that is so, then the understanding of form and so on through the distinctive taste and so on that is not a cause and is not an effect and is not a different nature, for example, the understanding of the distinctive form that is experienced in the dark through the taste of mango and myrobalan fruit,

original: rtogs pa dang / me'i dri mnams pas de dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i gzugs rtogs pa de ci ltar rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / me'i dri mnams pas de dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i gzugs rtogs pa de ci ltar rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du /
translated: and the understanding of the form that is concomitant with smell through smelling the smell of fire, how could that be included in inference?

original: chad ma ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rtags gzhan du thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: chad ma ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rtags gzhan du thal lo zhe na /
translated: Since it is neither direct perception nor inference, it follows that there is a third type of valid knowledge.

original: bshad pa / de yang rol sogs pa dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ro la sogs pa'i go bar byed pas rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / de yang rol sogs pa dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ro la sogs pa'i go bar byed pas rtogs pa ni /
translated: In response to that, the understanding of form and so on that is dependent on the single collection of taste and so on that is concomitant with taste and so on is the cause of understanding form and so on.

original: rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa de ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa de ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “by inferring the property of the cause” means that the cognition of the effect is an inference of the property of the cause.

original: dper na du bas me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rjes su dpag pas /
analyzed: dper na du bas me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rjes su dpag pas /
translated: For example, the collection of fire, fuel, etc., is inferred from smoke.

original: thal ba dang sol ba la sogs pa bud shing gi 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pa de dang @116a * //
analyzed: thal ba dang sol ba la sogs pa bud shing gi 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pa de dang @116a * //
translated: The transformation of fuel into ash, etc., is inferred from that.

original: 'dra'o // gal te 'di rgyu las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra'o // gal te 'di rgyu las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the effect is inferred as something other than the cause,

original: rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then you are inferring the property of the cause.

original: rgyu las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpog ba der yang rgyu de lta bu kho na zhes bya ba gang rjes su dpag na 'bras bu gzhan yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba gzugs skyed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpog ba der yang rgyu de lta bu kho na zhes bya ba gang rjes su dpag na 'bras bu gzhan yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba gzugs skyed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the effect is inferred as something other than the cause, then you are inferring the very same cause, because you are inferring the capacity to produce form.

original: rgyu rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i rtogs pas 'bras bu gzhan rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i rtogs pas 'bras bu gzhan rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the effect is not an inference of something other than the cause, because it is not a separate cognition from the inference of the cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar ro'i rgyu gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu nus pa zhugs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de ro skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar ro'i rgyu gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu nus pa zhugs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de ro skyed par byed do //
translated: The cause of the taste is the form that is the cause of the appropriation of the taste, which is the condition that is the cause of the arising of the taste.

original: ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu la lhan cig byed pa nyid du ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu la lhan cig byed pa nyid du ltos pa yin no //
translated: The cause of the appropriation of the taste is the form that is the cause of the arising of its own effect, which is the cause of the appropriation of the taste.

original: bud shing gi 'gyur ba ni thal ba dang du ba dang sol ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bud shing gi 'gyur ba ni thal ba dang du ba dang sol ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The transformation of fuel is called ash, smoke, and charcoal.

original: de'i nye bar len ba ni bud shing yin la /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len ba ni bud shing yin la /
translated: The appropriation of that is fuel.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa ni me ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa ni me ste /
translated: Therefore, the co-arisen fire is the cause of the arising of ash, smoke, and charcoal.

original: de ci ltar du ba skyed pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar du ba skyed pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as it is the cause of the arising of smoke, so it is the cause of the arising of ash and charcoal.

original: gcig la du ma skyes par nges pa 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: gcig la du ma skyes par nges pa 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that many effects arise from one cause?

original: bshad pa / ro'i rang gi rgyu gang yin pa de 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rjes su mthun ba de med na ro'i nye bar len pa rang gi 'bras bu la mngon du phyogs pa de nyid gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin
analyzed: bshad pa / ro'i rang gi rgyu gang yin pa de 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rjes su mthun ba de med na ro'i nye bar len pa rang gi 'bras bu la mngon du phyogs pa de nyid gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The cause of the taste is suitable to generate its effect. If that does not exist, then the appropriation of the taste that is directed toward its own effect is the cause of the engagement of the causes of the appropriation of form.🔽The engagement of the cause of the appropriation of the taste that has the characteristic of being suitable to generate its effect is the engagement of the cause of the engagement of the causes of the appropriation of form.🔽That is said to be the engagement of the appropriation of the taste that has the cause of the engagement of the causes of the appropriation of form as its cooperative condition.

original: no // 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i 'jug pa de yang gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa gang la yong pa'i ro'i nye bar len pa 'jug pa de la de skad ces bya
analyzed: no // 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i 'jug pa de yang gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa gang la yong pa'i ro'i nye bar len pa 'jug pa de la de skad ces bya
translated: It is said that the engagement of the appropriation of form has the cooperative condition of the engagement of the causes of the appropriation of form.

original: ste / gzugs kyi nye bar len pa 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ste / gzugs kyi nye bar len pa 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the statement, “It has the cooperative condition of the engagement of the causes of the appropriation of form.”

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i nges par skyo ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i nges par skyo ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the definite arising of form and so on is established.

original: de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu la phyogs pa'i gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa ci lta bu las byung ba'i ros de lta bu 'di rjes su dpag par byed pa na gzugs rjes su dpag par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu la phyogs pa'i gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa ci lta bu las byung ba'i ros de lta bu 'di rjes su dpag par byed pa na gzugs rjes su dpag par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when one infers the form that is the cause of the form that is directed toward its own effect, and is endowed with its co-operating causes, from the taste that is like it, then form is inferred.

original: rgyu rjes su dpag pa las logs shig tu gzugs rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rjes su dpag pa las logs shig tu gzugs rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But form is not inferred separately from the inference of its cause.

original: rgyu rjes su dpog pa nyid de 'dra ba yin gyi gzhan @116b ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rjes su dpog pa nyid de 'dra ba yin gyi gzhan @116b ma yin no //
translated: The inference of the cause is just like that, not otherwise.

original: des na 'di ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na 'di ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that this is the inference of the property of the cause.

original: 'o na ni ro mthong ba las ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs rtogs ba ci ltar rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni ro mthong ba las ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs rtogs ba ci ltar rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how is the future form understood from seeing the taste? How is the property of the cause inferred?

original: bshad pa / ro la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa de la yang 'das pa rnams dang dus gcig pa rnams rtogs kyi ma 'ongs ba rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / ro la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa de la yang 'das pa rnams dang dus gcig pa rnams rtogs kyi ma 'ongs ba rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said: In that inference of form, etc. from taste, etc., past and present forms, etc. are understood, but not future ones.

original: ro la sogs pa snang ba gang zhig dngos sam brgyud pas gzugs kyi nye bar len pa las skyed par rtogs pa de ni ci ltar rigs par da ltar dang 'das ba'i gzugs la sogs pa go bar byed pa yin gyi ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin te
analyzed: ro la sogs pa snang ba gang zhig dngos sam brgyud pas gzugs kyi nye bar len pa las skyed par rtogs pa de ni ci ltar rigs par da ltar dang 'das ba'i gzugs la sogs pa go bar byed pa yin gyi ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin te
translated: Whatever appearance of taste, etc. is understood to be generated either directly or indirectly from the appropriation of form, that is understood as either present or past form, as is appropriate, but not as future,

original: / da ltar ba ma 'ongs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / da ltar ba ma 'ongs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present is confused with the future.

original: ma 'ongs ba ni rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pas gegs byed pa dang ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs ba ni rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pas gegs byed pa dang ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The future is not, because it is possible that it will be obstructed or incomplete due to the connection with another cause.

original: nub mo nyid ma 'char bar nges pa gang yin ba dang / rgyu skar mthong bas rgyu skar gzhan 'char bar nges pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nub mo nyid ma 'char bar nges pa gang yin ba dang / rgyu skar mthong bas rgyu skar gzhan 'char bar nges pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is ascertained not to rise before dawn or whatever is ascertained to rise due to seeing a constellation is not inference,

original: nges par byed pa med par nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par byed pa med par nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a nature that is ascertained without a means of ascertaining.

original: nges par byed pa med par yang 'char ba ma 'ongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par byed pa med par yang 'char ba ma 'ongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is future because it rises without a means of ascertaining.

original: de'i phyir ro la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of form, etc. from earth, etc. is also an inference from the effect as a reason.

original: ngo la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rjes su dpog ba 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes par brjod pa 'dis ni grog ma 'pho ba dang / nya 'phar ba dang / de lta bu gzhan las char pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa yang rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pas 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rjes su dpog ba 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes par brjod pa 'dis ni grog ma 'pho ba dang / nya 'phar ba dang / de lta bu gzhan las char pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa yang rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pas 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes par bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this statement that the inference of form, etc. from earth, etc. is born from the effect as a reason, the inference of rain, etc. from the movement of ants, the jumping of fish, and other such things is also explained as born from the effect as a reason, because the effect is inferred from the cause.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa / grog ma 'pho ba la sogs pa las char pa rjes su dpog pa de la yang 'byung ba rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na char pa dang grog ma 'pho ba dang nya 'phar ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / grog ma 'pho ba la sogs pa las char pa rjes su dpog pa de la yang 'byung ba rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na char pa dang grog ma 'pho ba dang nya 'phar ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is said: In the inference of rain from the movement of ants, etc., some particular condition of the elements is the cause of both the rain and the movement of ants and the jumping of fish.

original: de la nya 'phar ba dang grog ma 'khrug pa mthong nas rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa na 'das pa'i char pa rjes su dpag pa yin no //🔽sa phug na 'dug pa 'am gzhan du yang rung bar char ma mthong bar khyad par can gyi nya 'phar @117a * //
analyzed: de la nya 'phar ba dang grog ma 'khrug pa mthong nas rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa na 'das pa'i char pa rjes su dpag pa yin no // sa phug na 'dug pa 'am gzhan du yang rung bar char ma mthong bar khyad par can gyi nya 'phar @117a * //
translated: When one infers the cause of the fish jumping and the ants moving by seeing the rain, one infers the past rain.

original: ba dang grog ma 'khrug pa mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: ba dang grog ma 'khrug pa mthong ba yin na /
translated: When one sees the fish jumping and the ants moving in a special way without seeing the rain in the same place, whether in a cave or elsewhere,

original: da ltar ba yang rjes su dpog par byed do //🔽de la grog ma 'pho ba ni sgong dang bcas te 'gro ba'o //🔽nya 'phar ba ni rdzing bu spangs nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba yang rjes su dpog par byed do // de la grog ma 'pho ba ni sgong dang bcas te 'gro ba'o // nya 'phar ba ni rdzing bu spangs nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: one infers the present rain.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni 'khrul pa'i phyir rjes su mi dpog go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni 'khrul pa'i phyir rjes su mi dpog go //
translated: One does not infer the future rain because it is uncertain.

original: gzugs las reg pa rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs las reg pa rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The inference of contact from form is produced from a sign of effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / gzugs la sogs pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzugs la sogs pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because form and so on are based on the four great elements.

original: don byed ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: don byed ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The agent of the object is the collection itself, which possesses form and so on.

original: de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: And that collection is not different from the four great elements.

original: de'i phyir gzugs las reg pa lhan cig spyod pa'i rgyu nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs las reg pa lhan cig spyod pa'i rgyu nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, from form, one infers the simultaneous cause of contact.

original: reg pa la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa yin la /
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog pa yin la /
translated: The inference of form and so on from contact and so on is the inference of the property of the cause.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las reg pa rjes su dpog pa 'di ni rgyu nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las reg pa rjes su dpog pa 'di ni rgyu nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The inference of contact from form and so on is the inference of the cause itself. This is the difference.

original: 'jig rten na med na mi 'byung ba bzung ba las lkog tu gyur pa'i rjes su dpog pa yin pa dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa rnams kyang tshogs pa gcig gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las par nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na med na mi 'byung ba bzung ba las lkog tu gyur pa'i rjes su dpog pa yin pa dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa rnams kyang tshogs pa gcig gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las par nges pa nyid do //
translated: In the world, when one grasps the non-arising of the effect in the absence of the cause, one infers the hidden cause. And because form, taste, and so on are included in a single collection, they are definitely dependent on a single collection.

original: 'o na ba yang yin pa'i phyir gong bu 'di ni rva can yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa de'o //
analyzed: 'o na ba yang yin pa'i phyir gong bu 'di ni rva can yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa de'o //
translated: But then, since it is also a cow, this lump is a horned animal.

original: rtsig phugs nas lta bas gong bu'i phyogs gcig mthong nas /
analyzed: rtsig phugs nas lta bas gong bu'i phyogs gcig mthong nas /
translated: Having seen one part of the lump from a crevice in a wall,

original: ma mthong ba rva can gyi phyogs rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rva can gyi phyogs rtogs par byed do //
translated: one infers the unseen part, the horned part.

original: ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni rva dang ldan pa'i phyogs gcig po'i 'bras bu 'am rang bzhin ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i spyor ba yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni rva dang ldan pa'i phyogs gcig po'i 'bras bu 'am rang bzhin ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i spyor ba yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The so-called cow is not the effect or nature of just the one part that has horns. Nor is it the non-apprehension of the extension.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / de la yang ba lang zhes tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i yan lag tshogs pa can yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la yang ba lang zhes tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i yan lag tshogs pa can yin no //
translated: The cause of the suitability of the collection of parts to be designated as a cow is the collection of parts that are one part of the cow.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it the cause?

original: bshad pa / yan lag de dag med na tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / yan lag de dag med na tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if those parts did not exist, the collection would not be designated as a cow.

original: de'i phyir 'bras @117b bu ba lang nyid la rgyu rva can nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras @117b bu ba lang nyid la rgyu rva can nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the presence of the cause, the cow, is inferred from the presence of the effect, the horn.

original: ci ltar tshogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu tshogs pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu tshogs pa can yin zhe na /
translated: How is the cause of the arrangement of the collection a member of the collection?

original: gang gi phyir lko ga shal dang rva la sogs pa smos pas nog dang mjug ma dang rmig pa la sogs pa de dag gi tshogs pa ni ba lang zhes bya'o //🔽de'i phyir ba lang zhes tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni tshogs can cha shas dag la 'brel pa yin pas tshogs can de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lko ga shal dang rva la sogs pa smos pas nog dang mjug ma dang rmig pa la sogs pa de dag gi tshogs pa ni ba lang zhes bya'o // de'i phyir ba lang zhes tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni tshogs can cha shas dag la 'brel pa yin pas tshogs can de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the collection of hump, horn, and so on is called a “cow” when the dewlap, tail, hoof, and so on are mentioned.🔽Therefore, this arrangement of the collection called “cow” is related to the members of the collection, the parts.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed ba can 'ga' zhig la yod na rang gi rgyu mtshan nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed ba can 'ga' zhig la yod na rang gi rgyu mtshan nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: Since the members of the collection do not occur without the collection, the presence of the collection is indicated by the presence of the members of the collection, which follow the presence and absence of the collection.

original: de'i phyir ba lang nyid las rva can rtogs pa can gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang nyid las rva can rtogs pa can gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the horn-possessor from the presence of cow is produced from the evidence of the effect.

original: 'dir ba lang nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las mi 'khrul ba mthong ba'i cha phal che ba ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ba lang nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las mi 'khrul ba mthong ba'i cha phal che ba ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the part of the perception that is not mistaken with regard to the determination of cowness is the subject.

original: tshogs pa rnam par gzhag tu rung ba nyid ni de'i chos yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnam par gzhag tu rung ba nyid ni de'i chos yin no //
translated: The suitability of the determination of the collection is its property.

original: phyogs gcig pa rva can ni de'i rgyu yin no //🔽'di las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid ni mtshan nyid pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa rva can ni de'i rgyu yin no // 'di las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid ni mtshan nyid pa yin gyi /
translated: The one-sidedness of the horn is its cause.

original: dngos po pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is the characteristic of this, but it is not the real thing.🔽The horn, etc., are the parts.

original: rva la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams ba lang gi tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ba lang gi tha snyad du 'jug pa nyid ni rva la sogs pa rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: rva la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams ba lang gi tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ba lang gi tha snyad du 'jug pa nyid ni rva la sogs pa rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: The application of the term “cow” to the horn, etc., is the reason for the application of the term “cow.”

original: mthong ba'i chos can dang bsgrub bya rva ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos can dang bsgrub bya rva ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The perception and the probandum, the horn, are related because they depend on the same collection.

original: de la gang gi snang ba'i cha shas rnams la ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid sgrub na ni de'i tshe rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: de la gang gi snang ba'i cha shas rnams la ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid sgrub na ni de'i tshe rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: If the suitability of the application of the term “cow” to the parts that appear in the perception is established, then it is an inference based on the nature of things.

original: gang gi tshe ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid la mi 'khrul pa'i cha shas mthong nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid la mi 'khrul pa'i cha shas mthong nas /
translated: When one sees the part that is not mistaken with respect to the suitability of the convention “cow,”

original: ma mthong ba'i cha shas rva la sogs pa gzhan rjes su rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i cha shas rva la sogs pa gzhan rjes su rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: and then infers the other parts that are not seen, such as the dewlap, at that time it is an inference based on effect.

original: 'on te ci ltar gzugs mthong ba las reg pa rjes su dpog pa don dam pa yin pa de bzhin du ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba'i phyogs gcig mthong ba la tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i yan lag gzhan ci'i phyir rjes su dpog par
analyzed: 'on te ci ltar gzugs mthong ba las reg pa rjes su dpog pa don dam pa yin pa de bzhin du ba lang gi tha snyad du rung ba'i phyogs gcig mthong ba la tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i yan lag gzhan ci'i phyir rjes su dpog par
translated: But if, just as one infers a tactile object from seeing a visible form, then why does one not infer the other parts that are dependent on the same collection, from seeing one part that is suitable as the convention “cow”?

original: mi byed / 'on te yan lag de rva dang bral ba yang srid pas rjes su mi dpog na /🔽'o na ni ba lang nyid las kyang @118a * //
analyzed: mi byed / 'on te yan lag de rva dang bral ba yang srid pas rjes su mi dpog na / 'o na ni ba lang nyid las kyang @118a * //
translated: But if one does not infer it because it is possible that the part is without a dewlap,

original: rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then one would not infer it from cowness either.

original: de ste rva med kyang rva de skyed par rung ba la mi 'khrul ba ni yan lag thams cad la yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ste rva med kyang rva de skyed par rung ba la mi 'khrul ba ni yan lag thams cad la yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is not mistaken with respect to the suitability of producing that dewlap, even though it is without a dewlap, then that is present in all the parts.

original: gal te de lta na ni yan lag gzhan mthong ba las kyang rva rjes su dpag par rigs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni yan lag gzhan mthong ba las kyang rva rjes su dpag par rigs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it is proper to infer the horn from seeing the other part.

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'di lta bu'i rigs can don dam pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa nyid kyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'di lta bu'i rigs can don dam pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa nyid kyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then this kind of inference of the ultimate is set forth by the mere setting forth of form, etc.

original: tha snyad du rung ba nyid las rgyu rjes su dpog pa 'di ni dngos po ma yin pas logs shig tu nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad du rung ba nyid las rgyu rjes su dpog pa 'di ni dngos po ma yin pas logs shig tu nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: This inference of the cause from the mere possibility of conventional usage is not a thing, and so it is set forth separately.

original: phyogs 'di lta bu'i yang rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes de ltar bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di lta bu'i yang rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes de ltar bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is set forth in order to show that this kind of position should be followed.

original: 'khrul ba med par nges par gzhan yang ci skad brjod pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'khrul ba med par nges par gzhan yang ci skad brjod pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to show that the other kind of inference, which is certain without error, is included in the former kind of inference, it is said:

original: chu'i bdag nyid de 'dra ba g-yo ba med ba ni gzhi las mngon par grub pa yin pa'i phyir chu de ni gzhi de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: chu'i bdag nyid de 'dra ba g-yo ba med ba ni gzhi las mngon par grub pa yin pa'i phyir chu de ni gzhi de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The water, which is of that kind, is not moving, because it is established from the ground. Therefore, the water is the effect of that ground.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir chu brtan pa mi g-yo ba mthong nas de'i gting ma mthong yang gzhi yod par rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir chu brtan pa mi g-yo ba mthong nas de'i gting ma mthong yang gzhi yod par rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is so, therefore, when one sees water to be stable and unmoving, even though one does not see its bottom, one infers that there is a ground there. That is also born from a sign of effect.

original: gal te rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pas rgyun 'jug pa'i chu'i rgyun gzhi ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pas rgyun 'jug pa'i chu'i rgyun gzhi ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says: The stream of water that flows on in connection with another cause is not a ground.

original: rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gzhi ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gzhi ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the stream’s arising in continuity is not a ground.

original: 'on kyang rgyun gyi rang bzhin khyad par can gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyun gyi rang bzhin khyad par can gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: However, it is the cause of the stream’s special nature.

original: bdag nyid de 'dra ba mi g-yo ba ni gzhi de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid de 'dra ba mi g-yo ba ni gzhi de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unmoving, such as that nature, is established from that ground.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gang gi phyir gzhi de las phan pa nyams su myong ba med par ni de las gnas skabs kyi khyad par g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba de 'dra ba thob pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhi de las phan pa nyams su myong ba med par ni de las gnas skabs kyi khyad par g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba de 'dra ba thob pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, without experiencing benefit from that ground, it is not tenable to obtain such a thing as the unmoving state called a special condition from that.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid gyur pa'i phan pa thob pas chu de de las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid gyur pa'i phan pa thob pas chu de de las grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the water is established from that, since it obtains benefit that is its own nature.

original: phan pa chu las gzhan nyid yin bar khas len pa la brjod par bya ba yin pa de ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: phan pa chu las gzhan nyid yin bar khas len pa la brjod par bya ba yin pa de ni bshad zin te /
translated: It has been explained that the assertion that benefit is different from water is to be refuted,

original: de'i zhes 'brel pa mi 'grub pa dang / 'brel ba gzhan khas len na thug pa med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes 'brel pa mi 'grub pa dang / 'brel ba gzhan khas len na thug pa med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the connection with that is not established, and because if another connection is accepted, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i g-yo ba med pa'i gnas skabs phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid las @118b skyes pa'i phyir gzhi yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i g-yo ba med pa'i gnas skabs phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid las @118b skyes pa'i phyir gzhi yin gyi /
translated: The water is the basis because it is produced from the benefit that assists the state of its non-movement.

original: gzhi yin pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhi yin pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it is the basis.

original: gal te gzhi de las bdag nyid kyi khyad par skyes pa'i phyir chu de ltar zhes bya ba mi g-yo bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhi de las bdag nyid kyi khyad par skyes pa'i phyir chu de ltar zhes bya ba mi g-yo bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the water is not the basis because it is produced from a special nature of the basis, then the water that remains in a state of non-movement is not like that.

original: 'on kyang gzhi de dang ldan pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhi de dang ldan pa las yin no //
translated: But it is because it possesses that basis.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba gang las chu mi g-yo bar gyur pa 'brel par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yon tan gnyis la gnas pa bskyed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba gang las chu mi g-yo bar gyur pa 'brel par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yon tan gnyis la gnas pa bskyed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: “Possession” is the generation of the two qualities that are related to the water and cause it to be still.

original: gal te de lta ni ci ltar ldan pa de chu dang gzhi de dag gi 'brel pa yin par 'gyur /🔽ci ldan pa de dag las skyes pa'i phyir yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de lta ni ci ltar ldan pa de chu dang gzhi de dag gi 'brel pa yin par 'gyur / ci ldan pa de dag las skyes pa'i phyir yin nam /
translated: If that is so, how could possession be the connection between the water and the base?🔽Is it because possession arises from them?

original: 'on te de dag gi 'phrod pa 'du ba yin pa'i phyir yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi 'phrod pa 'du ba yin pa'i phyir yin grang /
translated: Or is it because they are the proper combination of those?

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another possibility is impossible.

original: de las 'phrod pa 'du ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gi 'brel pa yin na ldan pa de ci ltar gzhi la mi ltos par chu gcig nyid la 'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin /
analyzed: de las 'phrod pa 'du ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gi 'brel pa yin na ldan pa de ci ltar gzhi la mi ltos par chu gcig nyid la 'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin /
translated: If it is the connection between them because it is the proper combination of those, then how could possession not rely on the base? It is the proper combination of the water alone.

original: ci ste skyes pa'i phyir yin na ;
analyzed: ci ste skyes pa'i phyir yin na ;
translated: But if it is because it arises from them,

original: de lta na yang gang gis nam mkha' nas bskyur yang mi g-yo bar gnas par 'gyur ba gcig nyid kyis ci ste mi skyed /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang gis nam mkha' nas bskyur yang mi g-yo bar gnas par 'gyur ba gcig nyid kyis ci ste mi skyed /
translated: then why does it not arise from just that which causes the water to remain still when it is poured from space?

original: chu 'ba' zhig pa de la ldan pa skyed pa'am 'du ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chu 'ba' zhig pa de la ldan pa skyed pa'am 'du ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because water alone does not have the power to generate or combine with possession.

original: gal te de lta na skye ba 'am 'phrod pa 'du ba de la so sor nus pa med pa chu la sogs pa de ni tshogs kyang nus pa med par mthong ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na skye ba 'am 'phrod pa 'du ba de la so sor nus pa med pa chu la sogs pa de ni tshogs kyang nus pa med par mthong ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the power to generate or combine with possession is not separate from the arising or meeting itself. Just as water and so on are seen to be powerless even when combined, so too they are powerless when separate.

original: de'i phyir ldan pas ldan pa de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldan pas ldan pa de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, possession does not possess that possession.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not benefit.

original: gang gi phyir gang dang chu lhan cig par gyur pa de ni de la phan 'dogs par byed pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dang chu lhan cig par gyur pa de ni de la phan 'dogs par byed pa kho na ste /
translated: Because that which is combined with water only benefits it.

original: de'i phyir de yod kyang ldan pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yod kyang ldan pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if it exists, it does not possess possession.

original: gal te lhan cig pa la ni grogs des phan btags pa'i phyir nus par 'dod pa des na ci ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig pa la ni grogs des phan btags pa'i phyir nus par 'dod pa des na ci ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If you assert that it is powerful because it benefits its companion in combination, then why do you say it does not benefit?

original: bshad pa / chu dang gzhi la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rnams la gang las phan btags pa'i phyir nus par 'gyur ba'i phan pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / chu dang gzhi la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rnams la gang las phan btags pa'i phyir nus par 'gyur ba'i phan pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: For water, earth, and so on, which are not that which is to be generated and that which generates, there is nothing at all that is called benefit that would be the capacity for benefit.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni phan pa ma yin te /🔽rang gi @119a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni phan pa ma yin te / rang gi @119a * //
translated: That which is not an effect does not have a nature that is beneficial.

original: ngo bo ni grub zin pas byas ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo ni grub zin pas byas ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its nature is already established, it is not created.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it have the nature of another,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo byed pa yin na yang phan gdags par bya ba'i dngos po de phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo byed pa yin na yang phan gdags par bya ba'i dngos po de phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if another’s nature were created, that thing to be benefited would not be benefited.

original: gal te phan pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa de lta na yang nye ba nyid phan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phan pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa de lta na yang nye ba nyid phan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If benefit is neither the same nor different, then proximity is benefit.

original: gnyi ga ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar zhes smos so //
translated: The response is “Both are not tenable.”

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa byed pa po ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa byed pa po ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Neither the same nor different is not an agent, because it does not do anything at all, and it does not assist.

original: phan pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni sgra'i phan pa bsam par mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: phan pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni sgra'i phan pa bsam par mang du bshad zin to //
translated: It is not helpful in any way. This has been explained many times in the analysis of the usefulness of words.

original: gang gi phyir grub pa'i rang bzhin rnams la phan pa 'ga' yang med pa de'i phyir dngos po'i 'brel pa don dam pa'i 'brel pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir grub pa'i rang bzhin rnams la phan pa 'ga' yang med pa de'i phyir dngos po'i 'brel pa don dam pa'i 'brel pa /
translated: Since it is not helpful in any way to things that exist by intrinsic nature, therefore, the relation of things is not a relation of cause and effect.

original: dper na gzhi dang 'brel pa las chu gnas bar 'gyur ba ltar gang la brten nas don byed pa'i khyad par nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na gzhi dang 'brel pa las chu gnas bar 'gyur ba ltar gang la brten nas don byed pa'i khyad par nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: For example, just as water is related to its locus, whatever is related to something else is posited as the effect of that, and whatever is related to something else is posited as the cause of that. Whatever is related to something else is posited as the effect of that, and whatever is related to something else is posited as the cause of that.

original: 'o na ci ltar rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dang / gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos po dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes khyad par gyi tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dang / gsal bya gsal byed kyi dngos po dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes khyad par gyi tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can there be a difference in terms of the entities of the support and supported, the entities of the manifestor and manifested, and the entities of cause and effect?

original: bshad pa / skyed par byed pa'i bya ba'i khyad par gyi rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / skyed par byed pa'i bya ba'i khyad par gyi rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: Response: The difference is due to the distinction of the activity of producing.

original: tha dad pas gsal bya gsal byed la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //🔽des na gzhi'i dngos po 'di yang 'khar gzhong gi rgya shug dang sa gzhi'i chu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pas gsal bya gsal byed la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go // des na gzhi'i dngos po 'di yang 'khar gzhong gi rgya shug dang sa gzhi'i chu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid do //
translated: The manifestor and manifested and so on are posited due to being different.🔽Therefore this entity of the basis is the capacity to produce the jujube fruit in the pan and the water on the ground and so on.

original: gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid gzhi'i dngos po yin pa de'i phyir 'khar gzhong dang / rgya shug la sogs pa 'di dag la de'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid gzhi'i dngos po yin pa de'i phyir 'khar gzhong dang / rgya shug la sogs pa 'di dag la de'i bdag nyid de /
