translated: Because the entity of the basis is the capacity to produce, therefore these jujube fruits in the pan and so on have that nature.

original: rten dang brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha snyad dang / blo dang don byed pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po nyid kyis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha snyad dang / blo dang don byed pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po nyid kyis byas pa yin te /
translated: The conventions of the supported and support and the functioning of mind and objects are created by the entity of the produced and producer.

original: ldan pa med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ldan pa med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because they are not related or,

original: ldan pa yod kyang de dag skyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po de med na mi 'byung ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldan pa yod kyang de dag skyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po de med na mi 'byung ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: even though they are related, they are not produced by the entity of the produced and producer.

original: de dag ni bskyed bya skyed kyi dngos pos byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni bskyed bya skyed kyi dngos pos byas pa nyid do //
translated: They are created by the entity of the produced and producer.

original: gzhan yang bskyed @119b bya skyed byed kyi dngos po las ni phan pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang bskyed @119b bya skyed byed kyi dngos po las ni phan pa /
translated: Moreover, the entity of the produced and producer is created by the benefit

original: de las mi ldan pa /🔽de las rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las mi ldan pa / de las rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the nonpossession that arise from it.🔽The entity of the supported and support is created by the entity of the produced and producer.

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po nyid brgyud pas rten dang brten pa'i dngos por brtag par yin na /
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po nyid brgyud pas rten dang brten pa'i dngos por brtag par yin na /
translated: If the entity of the produced and producer is created by the entity of the supported and support, then the entity of the supported and support is created by the entity of the produced and producer.

original: brgyud pa rtog pa don med pa'i phyir yang tha snyad la sogs pa ni bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos por byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: brgyud pa rtog pa don med pa'i phyir yang tha snyad la sogs pa ni bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos por byas pa nyid do //
translated: Also, because the continuum is meaningless, convention, etc. are posited as things that are produced and producer.

original: yang lan smras pa ni grub zin pa gnas par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang lan smras pa ni grub zin pa gnas par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, the reply is: because it causes the persistence of what has been established,

original: gzhi yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhi yin gyi /
translated: it is a basis.

original: ma grub pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not because it causes the generation of what has not been established.

original: gal te de ltar na gnas par byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gnas par byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is so, if it causes persistence because it causes the persistence of what has been established,

original: gnas pa dang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa mi 'thad pa ni phan pa mi 'thad pa las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa mi 'thad pa ni phan pa mi 'thad pa las bshad pa yin no //
translated: the untenability of persistence and non-persistence has been explained in the context of the untenability of benefit.

original: ltung ba 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ltung ba 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It causes persistence because it prevents the fall of what is going.

original: gnas pa byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it causes persistence.

original: gegs kyang dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gegs kyang dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, because the obstruction is not a thing,

original: de nyid dam gzhan du brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan du brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it cannot be conceived as identical with or different from it.

original: gang gi byed pa po skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ba gegs zhes bya ba ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gang gi byed pa po skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ba gegs zhes bya ba ci zhig yin /
translated: What is called an obstruction is that which does not cause the generation of what has not been generated. What is it?

original: med pa ni dngos pos byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos pos byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Nonexistence is not produced by an entity.

original: gegs ni bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po yin la /
analyzed: gegs ni bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po yin la /
translated: Obstruction is an entity because it is an action.

original: de byed pa yang ltung ba'i skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de byed pa yang ltung ba'i skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: And its producer is the producer of the falling.

original: gang gi phyir gnas par byed pa pos ltung ba de'i ltung ba'i gegs byas pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba de de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas par byed pa pos ltung ba de'i ltung ba'i gegs byas pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba de de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid byas pa yin no //
translated: Because the one who causes to abide makes the obstruction of the falling, that obstruction of the falling is just that falling itself.🔽Because if it were different, the one who causes to abide would be applied to that entity called the obstruction of the falling.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan nyid yin na ni ltung ba'i gegs zhes bya ba'i dngos po de nyid la gnas par byed pa po nye bar sbyor ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan nyid yin na ni ltung ba'i gegs zhes bya ba'i dngos po de nyid la gnas par byed pa po nye bar sbyor ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'gas kyang ltung ba'i gegs ma byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gas kyang ltung ba'i gegs ma byas par 'gyur te /
translated: no one would make the obstruction of the falling,

original: 'gro ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the falling would be immutable.

original: gnas par byed pa pos byas pa'i gegs de las ltung bar khas len pa la yang brgal zhing brtags par mtshungs so //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa pos byas pa'i gegs de las ltung bar khas len pa la yang brgal zhing brtags par mtshungs so //
translated: And the objection and examination are the same for the one who accepts the falling from the obstruction produced by the one who causes to abide.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of falling?

original: byas su zin kyang gang gi phyir 'gro ba'i chos can de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par nyams pa dang skyes pa med pa'i phyir /🔽de go ci ste mi ltung zhes bya ba 'di 'dra ba'i brgal zhing brtags pa'o //🔽rang bzhin gang gis sdar ltung bar 'gyur @120a * //
analyzed: byas su zin kyang gang gi phyir 'gro ba'i chos can de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par nyams pa dang skyes pa med pa'i phyir / de go ci ste mi ltung zhes bya ba 'di 'dra ba'i brgal zhing brtags pa'o // rang bzhin gang gis sdar ltung bar 'gyur @120a * //
translated: If it did, then why would it not fall?

original: ba de nyid da ltar yang yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mi ltung /
analyzed: ba de nyid da ltar yang yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mi ltung /
translated: Because the nature of that which has the property of falling has not changed.

original: 'on te gegs zhes bya ba'i dngos po las ltung ba'i dngos po la khyad par grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gegs zhes bya ba'i dngos po las ltung ba'i dngos po la khyad par grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the property of falling is established as different from the property of being obstructed,

original: de lta na 'o na gegs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /🔽khyad par de yang bdag nyid gzhan yin ba'i phyir dngos po ni ltung ba ldog pa med pa de'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gegs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de / khyad par de yang bdag nyid gzhan yin ba'i phyir dngos po ni ltung ba ldog pa med pa de'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
translated: then the property of being obstructed is not the only thing,🔽but that difference also has another nature, and so the property of falling is not stopped from having that very nature.

original: khyad par tha dad par byas kyang ltung ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid de gnas skabs de nyid yin pa'i phyir ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par tha dad par byas kyang ltung ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid de gnas skabs de nyid yin pa'i phyir ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you make a difference, it would still fall, because it would have the nature of falling.

original: 'on te gegs kyis byas pa'i khyad par gyis kyang khyad par gzhan byed na de lta na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gegs kyis byas pa'i khyad par gyis kyang khyad par gzhan byed na de lta na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say that a difference is also made by the difference of the obstruction, then in that case there is an infinite regress.

original: 'o na ltung ba'i chos can gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gegs byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ltung ba'i chos can gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gegs byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the obstruction is made by the nature of the thing that is to fall,

original: bshad pa / gzhan dag mi ltung ba'i chos de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid byas pa las ni gegs su khas mi len te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan dag mi ltung ba'i chos de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid byas pa las ni gegs su khas mi len te /
translated: we reply: We do not accept that the obstruction is made by the nature of the thing that is not to fall.

original: mi ltung ba byed na skyed byed du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ltung ba byed na skyed byed du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not to fall, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a producer.

original: de'i phyir ltung ba log pa gegs yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba log pa gegs yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the reversal of falling is the obstruction,

original: de ni 'ba' zhig gis byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'ba' zhig gis byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: it cannot be done by that alone.

original: des na med pa byed pa'i gang gis kyang dngos po'i byed pa ma yin pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na med pa byed pa'i gang gis kyang dngos po'i byed pa ma yin pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that nothing can be done by a nonentity.

original: gang gi phyir med pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig ni yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig ni yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Because there is no such thing as what is called a “nonentity.”

original: de'i phyir ltung ba med pa byed do zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di dngos po'i byed pa 'gog pa'i don nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba med pa byed do zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di dngos po'i byed pa 'gog pa'i don nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this statement “I will not commit a downfall” has the meaning of the cessation of the activity of an entity.

original: ci ltar med pa'i dngos po'i bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar med pa'i dngos po'i bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not the activity of a nonexistent entity?

original: de rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said “in some way.”

original: tha dad pa 'am tha dad pa ma yin par bya ba yin na dngos po med pa ma yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'am tha dad pa ma yin par bya ba yin na dngos po med pa ma yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is an activity that is different or not different, it is not tenable that it is a nonexistent entity.

original: byed pa ni yod pas khyab pa yin la dngos po med pa la yang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni yod pas khyab pa yin la dngos po med pa la yang byed pa yin no //
translated: Activity is necessarily an existent entity, and it is also activity with respect to a nonexistent entity.

original: des ni dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: des ni dngos po nyid do //
translated: By that, it is an entity.

original: dngos po yang de nyid kyi ngo bo byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yang de nyid kyi ngo bo byed pa yin no //
translated: An entity is also activity that has the nature of that.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni ltung ba 'am thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes snga ma bzhin du thal ba'i phyir yang dngos po med pa zhes bya ba bya ba 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni ltung ba 'am thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes snga ma bzhin du thal ba'i phyir yang dngos po med pa zhes bya ba bya ba 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were different, there would be the fault of an infinite regress of downfalls, and because of the consequence that is similar to the previous one, a nonexistent entity does not have any activity whatsoever.

original: dngos po'i bya ba bkag pa de ni dngos po mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i bya ba bkag pa de ni dngos po mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of “the activity of an entity is refuted” is expressed as “an entity does not perform activity.”

original: des na gnas par byed pa'i rgyu de ltung bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gnas par byed pa'i rgyu de ltung bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the cause of endurance does not cause falling because falling does not have the power to fall.

original: ltung ba la nus pa yod @120b pa ma yin no zhes de ltar gsal bar brjod par bya bar 'gyur la de yang 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ltung ba la nus pa yod @120b pa ma yin no zhes de ltar gsal bar brjod par bya bar 'gyur la de yang 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Thus it is clearly expressed that way, and that is also asserted.

original: gang gi phyir ltung ba de'i ltung ba gnas par byed pa des byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltung ba de'i ltung ba gnas par byed pa des byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because falling does not cause the falling of that which is falling,

original: ltung ba'i chos can yin pas rang bzhin ltung ba'i phyis te /
analyzed: ltung ba'i chos can yin pas rang bzhin ltung ba'i phyis te /
translated: that which has the property of falling falls by its own nature.

original: dper na gnam du 'phangs pa'i bong ba dpung shugs kyi dbang gis steng du song yang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ltung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnam du 'phangs pa'i bong ba dpung shugs kyi dbang gis steng du song yang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ltung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a stone thrown into the air that rises due to the force of the throw but falls due to its own nature.

original: de ltar yin dang gnas par byed par mngon par 'dong pa'i dngos po cung zad mi byed pa de ci ltar rgya shug la sogs pa de'i gnas par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang gnas par byed par mngon par 'dong pa'i dngos po cung zad mi byed pa de ci ltar rgya shug la sogs pa de'i gnas par byed pa yin /
translated: If that is so, since the entity that is the cause of endurance does not perform any function, how could jujubes, etc., be its cause of endurance?

original: gang gi phyir gnas par byed pa med pa de'i phyir rgya shug la sogs pa 'di dngos po gzhan gang gis kyang ltung ba'i gegs byas pa med pa de'i phyir nam yang gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas par byed pa med pa de'i phyir rgya shug la sogs pa 'di dngos po gzhan gang gis kyang ltung ba'i gegs byas pa med pa de'i phyir nam yang gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: this thing is never enduring, because it is not obstructed from falling by any other thing.

original: gnam du 'phangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnam du 'phangs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like something thrown into the air.🔽Sometimes it endures,

original: res 'ga' gnas par yang yin la /
analyzed: res 'ga' gnas par yang yin la /
translated: and sometimes it does not endure.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par yang gnas par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gegs zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis kyang gnas par bya ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang lhan cig yul mtshungs par skye ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par yang gnas par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gegs zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis kyang gnas par bya ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang lhan cig yul mtshungs par skye ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it endures without a difference in its nature, therefore, the word “obstruction” also expresses that which is the cause of the appropriation of endurance, and it arises in the same place as that.

original: nye bar len pa'i yul du skye ba gang yin pa de nyid gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i yul du skye ba gang yin pa de nyid gnas pa yin la /
translated: That which arises in the place appropriated by it is endurance.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa'i yul du skye ba yang dngos po'i skad cig ma rnams kho na la srid kyi /
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa'i yul du skye ba yang dngos po'i skad cig ma rnams kho na la srid kyi /
translated: The arising in the place appropriated by itself is possible only for momentary things.

original: bstan pa gcig bu'i rang bzhin dag la ni mi srid do //
analyzed: bstan pa gcig bu'i rang bzhin dag la ni mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible for those whose nature is only taught.

original: de'i phyir chu'i de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma'i mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu'i de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma'i mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “like that of water” is the conclusion of the main point.

original: ci ste gang las de rjes su dpog pa chu skyar chu'i yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gang las de rjes su dpog pa chu skyar chu'i yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it is asked, “From what is the inference of that water?”

original: bshad pa / chu skyar yang chu de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / chu skyar yang chu de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: It is said: The crane is the effect of that water.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: From what?

original: chu skyar gyi gnas pa sdod pa ni chu la zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu skyar gyi gnas pa sdod pa ni chu la zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the crane’s dwelling is dependent on water.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni gang gi phyir chu skyar gyi gnas pa ni chu la brten pa yin ba de'i phyir chu de la lus gnas pa thob pas de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'brel pa'i phyir chu rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni gang gi phyir chu skyar gyi gnas pa ni chu la brten pa yin ba de'i phyir chu de la lus gnas pa thob pas de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'brel pa'i phyir chu rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is explained: Because the crane’s dwelling is dependent on water, therefore, the crane is inferred from that water, because it is related to the nature of its effect, having obtained its body in that water.

original: yul la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la ltos nas go bar byed pa yin pa'i khyad par dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la ltos nas go bar byed pa yin pa'i khyad par dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the crane is not related to the particularities of the place and so on, in dependence on which it is understood.

original: dpyid kyi dus dang / dpag tshad du mar yongs su @121a * //
analyzed: dpyid kyi dus dang / dpag tshad du mar yongs su @121a * //
translated: The place is the spring season, and the extent is many yojanas.

original: chad pa chu med pa mya ngan gyi mtha'i yul gyi khyad par dang / chu skyar gyi lus rang dbang dang nyams pa med par gnas ba gnas skabs kyi khyad bar yin te /
analyzed: chad pa chu med pa mya ngan gyi mtha'i yul gyi khyad par dang / chu skyar gyi lus rang dbang dang nyams pa med par gnas ba gnas skabs kyi khyad bar yin te /
translated: The difference in the place, the shore of a river, is the difference in the ultimate, the end of sorrow. The difference in the state, the heron remaining without loss of control over its body, is the difference in the immediate, the state of being alive.

original: dbyar gyi dus ni chu mdo pa'i phyir thams cad du gnas la /🔽chu yod pa'i mtha' dang 'ga' zhig gis bzhag pa 'chi 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: dbyar gyi dus ni chu mdo pa'i phyir thams cad du gnas la / chu yod pa'i mtha' dang 'ga' zhig gis bzhag pa 'chi 'dod pa 'am /
translated: In the summer season, the heron remains everywhere because of the abundance of water.

original: gzhan dbang du gnas pa ni chu med kyang gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dbang du gnas pa ni chu med kyang gnas pa yin no //
translated: But on the shore of a river where there is no water, or in a place set aside by some person, or where the heron is dead, or where it is under the control of another, it does not remain even though there is water.

original: des na khyad par dang bcas pa rtags yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par dang bcas pa rtags yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is qualified.

original: ci ste chu skyar las chu rjes su dpag pa la chos can gang yin /
analyzed: ci ste chu skyar las chu rjes su dpag pa la chos can gang yin /
translated: But if one infers water from the heron, what is the subject?

original: chu skyar nyid do //
analyzed: chu skyar nyid do //
translated: The heron itself.

original: chu skyar 'di ni chu dang 'brel pa yin te ;
analyzed: chu skyar 'di ni chu dang 'brel pa yin te ;
translated: This heron is related to water,

original: chu skyar yin pa'i phyir zhes khyad par chos can yin zhing spyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: chu skyar yin pa'i phyir zhes khyad par chos can yin zhing spyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: because it is a heron. The subject is qualified, and the universal is the reason.

original: 'di ltar du ba las me rjes su dpog pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba las me rjes su dpog pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /
translated: In the same way, the method is the same in inferring fire from smoke.

original: yul phyogs 'di ni me dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yul phyogs 'di ni me dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: This region is endowed with fire.🔽

original: du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //🔽'di ni rang bzhin nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma yin no // 'di ni rang bzhin nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is not like the case of the syllogism, “This place has fire because it has smoke.”

original: rgyu rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //🔽dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro // dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the reason is stated to be the effect of the property to be proven, because the cause is inferred.🔽For example, in the syllogism, “The visual consciousness is sometimes absent because of the absence of its cause,” the reason is stated to be the effect of the property to be proven, because the cause is inferred.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos par rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin yang rgyu rjes su dpog pa'i phyir 'di 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de bzhin du 'bras bu gtan tshigs thams cad la yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos par rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin yang rgyu rjes su dpog pa'i phyir 'di 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de bzhin du 'bras bu gtan tshigs thams cad la yin no //
translated: This is the case with all reasons that are stated to be the effect of the property to be proven.

original: de ltar ma yin te yul phyogs chos can du 'dod na /🔽gang du du ba mthong ba de ni me dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te yul phyogs chos can du 'dod na / gang du du ba mthong ba de ni me dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: If that were not so, and if the place were asserted to be the subject,🔽then, since the place where smoke is seen does not have fire, and the place that has fire does not have smoke, the reason would have a different basis.

original: me dang ldan pa gang yin pa de na yang du ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi tha dad pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: me dang ldan pa gang yin pa de na yang du ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi tha dad pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
translated: This is the opinion of some.

original: 'o na ni tshad mas yul du ma byas pa'i chu dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs la don du gnyer ba na chu skyar la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni tshad mas yul du ma byas pa'i chu dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs la don du gnyer ba na chu skyar la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then when one is in need of water, one would not go to a place where there is water, if one had not previously perceived water there.

original: yul du ma byas pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can one perceive a place without perceiving water?

original: mthong ba dang rjes su dpag pa'i chu skyar dang chu dag las phyogs gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang rjes su dpag pa'i chu skyar dang chu dag las phyogs gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the place is different from the water that is seen or inferred.

original: gzhi med pa'i chu mi rung ba'i phyir yul phyogs chu'i khongs su 'dus so zhe na 'dus mod /🔽'on kyang ci ltar phyugs rdzi'i snod kyi du ba dang / ri sul dag tu nges pa med pa'i rma bya'i sgra dmigs nas gzhi nges ba med par @121b yod par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i chu mi rung ba'i phyir yul phyogs chu'i khongs su 'dus so zhe na 'dus mod / 'on kyang ci ltar phyugs rdzi'i snod kyi du ba dang / ri sul dag tu nges pa med pa'i rma bya'i sgra dmigs nas gzhi nges ba med par @121b yod par gyur pa 'am /
translated: But if the place is not perceived, then water cannot be perceived, because water cannot exist without a place.🔽But even though the place is not perceived, one can infer the existence of water there, just as one infers the existence of smoke on a mountain, even though one does not see it, or the existence of a peacock in a forest, even though one does not see it.

original: yod par me dang rma bya rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rtogs na yul nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod par me dang rma bya rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rtogs na yul nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as one infers the existence of fire and a peacock, so too one can infer the existence of water in a place, even though one does not perceive it.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa las rjes su dpag pa'i mig ni yul nges pa ma yin yang yul gyi khyad par tshad ma gzhan kho na las yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa las rjes su dpag pa'i mig ni yul nges pa ma yin yang yul gyi khyad par tshad ma gzhan kho na las yin no //
translated: The eye that is inferred from eye-consciousness is not a definite object, but the particular object is only from another valid cognition.

original: gtan tshigs tha dad par gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs tha dad par gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason different.

original: gang gi phyir du ba dang 'brel ba'i snang ba'i phyogs nyid ni chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ba dang 'brel ba'i snang ba'i phyogs nyid ni chos can ma yin no //
translated: Because the side of appearance connected with smoke is not the subject.

original: 'o na gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhe na /
translated: Then what is it?

original: snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi steng mthong zhing 'og rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las yod par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi steng mthong zhing 'og rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las yod par rtogs pa'am /
translated: It is the upper part that is seen as having the nature of appearance, and the lower part is understood to exist from some reason,

original: sngar mthong ba dran par gyur pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba dran par gyur pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: or it is the recollection of what was seen before.

original: rnam pa thams cad du tshad mas yul du byas pa'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du tshad mas yul du byas pa'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: In every way, it is the collection that is the object of valid cognition.

original: phyogs gcig mthong ba dang cha gzhan rjes su dpag pa'i tshogs pa chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs gcig mthong ba dang cha gzhan rjes su dpag pa'i tshogs pa chos can yin gyi /
translated: The subject is the collection of the seen part and the inferred other part.

original: mthong ba gcig pu'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba gcig pu'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of mere seeing.

original: 'di ltar mun khung kun nas bskor cing g-yogs par sgron ma'i 'bras bu snang ba ma dmigs pa dag khang pa'i nang thams cad du sgron ma gnas pa med pa shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar mun khung kun nas bskor cing g-yogs par sgron ma'i 'bras bu snang ba ma dmigs pa dag khang pa'i nang thams cad du sgron ma gnas pa med pa shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this way, when the effect of the lamp is not perceived in the house that is completely surrounded and covered in darkness, one understands that the lamp is not present in the entire house.

original: shes pa la yang sgron ma'i 'bras bus dben par rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa la yang sgron ma'i 'bras bus dben par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the cognition also knows that it is devoid of the effect of the lamp.

original: sngar mthong ba dang ba'am reg pas nyams su myong bzhin pa'i shes pa dang nye bar gnas pa'i khyim gyi nang mtha' dag ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba dang ba'am reg pas nyams su myong bzhin pa'i shes pa dang nye bar gnas pa'i khyim gyi nang mtha' dag ni chos can yin no //
translated: The entire house that is present to the cognition that previously saw or touched it is the subject.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu ma dmigs pa las sgra med par nges pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu ma dmigs pa las sgra med par nges pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the ascertainment of sound's absence from the non-perception of its effect.

original: tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos can nges pa de la yang du ba las phyogs gcig me dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos can nges pa de la yang du ba las phyogs gcig me dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: In that ascertainment of the subject that has the nature of a collection, it is to be established that smoke is partially endowed with fire.

original: phyogs gcig med dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gang yin pa de yang me dngos nyid dang du ba'i dngos dang brgyud pas rgyu yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag gzhi gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig med dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gang yin pa de yang me dngos nyid dang du ba'i dngos dang brgyud pas rgyu yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag gzhi gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The subject that is to be established as either possessing or not possessing one part is also the basis of the probandum and the proof, because it is the direct cause of fire and the indirect cause of smoke.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba rgyu las gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba rgyu las gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
translated: There is no basis that is different from the cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir du ba dang 'brel pa'i yul phyogs dang lhan cig pa'i me dang ldan pa'i yul ni chos can nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir du ba dang 'brel pa'i yul phyogs dang lhan cig pa'i me dang ldan pa'i yul ni chos can nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the place that is connected with smoke and the place that is concomitant with fire are the subject,

original: gnyi gas du ba'i rgyun gcig la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dpyad par slob @122a * //
analyzed: gnyi gas du ba'i rgyun gcig la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro // 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dpyad par slob @122a * //
translated: because both of them assist the single continuum of smoke.🔽The master has analyzed the inference of effect, but the other logicians have not understood the treatise that explains the subject, the place, and smoke as being the relation of cause and effect.

original: dpon gyis yul phyogs de yang du ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis chos can yul phyogs dang du ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nyid yin par bshad pa gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa'i phyir ngan pa rang brgyud pa yin no //
analyzed: dpon gyis yul phyogs de yang du ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis chos can yul phyogs dang du ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nyid yin par bshad pa gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa'i phyir ngan pa rang brgyud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a bad autonomous argument.

original: de ltar cung zad mthong ba khyad par byed pa'i snang ba rjes su song ba 'og gi cha dang ldan pa'i yul ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar cung zad mthong ba khyad par byed pa'i snang ba rjes su song ba 'og gi cha dang ldan pa'i yul ni chos can yin no //
translated: Thus, the object that is the locus of the appearance that is the effect of the special slight seeing is the subject.

original: de'i phyogs gcig chu dang ldan pa yang brgyud nas chu skyar gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig chu dang ldan pa yang brgyud nas chu skyar gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: And the part of it that is associated with water is the common locus of the reason and the property to be established because it is indirectly the cause of the inference of the presence of water.

original: du ba dang chu skyar la sogs pa'i yul mthong ba dang chos nyid du gzhag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: du ba dang chu skyar la sogs pa'i yul mthong ba dang chos nyid du gzhag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The object that is seen, such as smoke and the presence of water, is to be posited as the property of the subject.

original: de lta ma yin na me dang ldan par nges pa'i yul mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na me dang ldan par nges pa'i yul mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not know the object that is ascertained as associated with fire.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa'i chos can du gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa'i chos can du gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the collection is to be taken as the subject.

original: gzhi rjes su dpog par ni chu chos can yin la ro la sogs pa dpog par ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: gzhi rjes su dpog par ni chu chos can yin la ro la sogs pa dpog par ni gzugs yin no //
translated: In the inference of the basis, the subject is water, and in the inference of taste and so on, the subject is form.

original: de dag gi bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi dang rgyu'i khyad par dang 'brel ba yang rang gi ngo bo kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi dang rgyu'i khyad par dang 'brel ba yang rang gi ngo bo kho na yin no //
translated: The basis that is to be established and the specific cause that is related to it are only its own nature.

original: ci ltar mig bzhin du 'dir ni yul ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar mig bzhin du 'dir ni yul ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the object is not ascertained here, as it is with the eye.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nyid las ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nyid las ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: The occasional nature of visual consciousness is dependent on another cause.

original: yul nges pa ni tshad ma gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: yul nges pa ni tshad ma gzhan las yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the object is from another means of valid cognition.

original: de ltar go bar byed pa nyid rab tu grags pa tha dad par dogs pa rnams khongs su 'du bar bsgrubs nas gzhan dag la yang bsgre ba'i phyogs 'dis zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ltar go bar byed pa nyid rab tu grags pa tha dad par dogs pa rnams khongs su 'du bar bsgrubs nas gzhan dag la yang bsgre ba'i phyogs 'dis zhes smos so //
translated: Having thus established the inclusion of doubts about the difference of the well-known nature of the probans, he says by this method in order to extend it to others.

original: yang ci'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhan med ce na de dang ma 'brel pa ni de med na mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir gzhan pa'i go bar byed pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhan med ce na de dang ma 'brel pa ni de med na mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir gzhan pa'i go bar byed pa med pa yin no //
translated: Again, why is there no other probans? Because that which is not related to it is not ascertained to be invariably concomitant with its absence, there is no other probans.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin spros pa dang bcas te bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin spros pa dang bcas te bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the nature of the probans with elaboration,

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba bshad par 'dod pas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba mtha' dag gis go bar byed pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba bshad par 'dod pas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba mtha' dag gis go bar byed pa ma yin pa /
translated: he, desiring to explain the fallacious probans, says the fallacious probans is not the probans in every case.

original: thun mong du bshad pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽shes bya yan lag rgyu mtshan tshul gsum ma grub pa gang yin pa de la shes byed nus pa yod min phyir te /
analyzed: thun mong du bshad pa'i phyir bshad pa / shes bya yan lag rgyu mtshan tshul gsum ma grub pa gang yin pa de la shes byed nus pa yod min phyir te /
translated: The common explanation is as follows.🔽Because that which is not established as the trimodal condition of the object of knowledge, the property, and the reason does not have the ability to prove,

original: shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum ma grub pa'am the @122b tshom za na rtogs pa po'i sgrub par byed pa'i rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum ma grub pa'am the @122b tshom za na rtogs pa po'i sgrub par byed pa'i rtags ma yin no //
translated: if the trimodal condition is not established or is doubted, then it is not a correct reason for the proponent.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir shes par byed pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir shes par byed pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “because it is not a proof.”

original: rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of causes:

original: sa bon la sogs pa byed pa po dang shes par byed pa po rtags so //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa byed pa po dang shes par byed pa po rtags so //
translated: the causal condition, such as the seed, and the condition of proof.

original: de la byed pa po'i rgyu ni rung ba nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir shes pa la mi ltos so //
analyzed: de la byed pa po'i rgyu ni rung ba nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir shes pa la mi ltos so //
translated: The causal condition is not dependent on consciousness because it produces the effect by being suitable.

original: shes par byed pa'i rgyu ni sgron ma bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i rgyu ni sgron ma bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The condition of proof is not like a lamp, which produces consciousness by being suitable.

original: 'on kyang 'brel pa nges pa chos can 'ga' zhig la mthong ba'i bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung bar dran pa gang yin pa 'di nyid lkog tu gyur pa'i don nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel pa nges pa chos can 'ga' zhig la mthong ba'i bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung bar dran pa gang yin pa 'di nyid lkog tu gyur pa'i don nges pa yin no //
translated: However, this very memory of the invariable concomitance of the reason with the property to be established, which is seen in some subjects, is the ascertainment of the hidden object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos su lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir shes par byed pa rgyu yin gyi byed pa po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos su lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir shes par byed pa rgyu yin gyi byed pa po ni ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, since the cognition of the hidden object is not the agent, the cause is the instrument of cognition, but not the agent.

original: du ba dngos su dran pa la nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin no //🔽tshul gsum gyi bdag nyid gang gis shes par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i tshul gsum po de ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: du ba dngos su dran pa la nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin no // tshul gsum gyi bdag nyid gang gis shes par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i tshul gsum po de ma grub pa ste /
translated: The memory of smoke is not directly applied.🔽The reason that is the cause of cognition by the nature of the three modes is not established,

original: log par nges pa'am the tshom zan shes par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: log par nges pa'am the tshom zan shes par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: if the three modes are ascertained as false or doubted, it is not the cause of cognition.

original: rung ba nyid kyis shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyis shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to be the cause of cognition.

original: sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the word cow.

original: sgra ni rung ba nyid kyi don go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni rung ba nyid kyi don go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The word does not convey the meaning of suitability.

original: 'on kyang yi ge'i go rims can gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig gis don dang med na mi 'byung ba nyid du brda byas pa'i rang bzhin de dang / don dang 'brel pa brtags pa de ma grub pa 'am the tshom zan sgra go bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rtags kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang yi ge'i go rims can gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig gis don dang med na mi 'byung ba nyid du brda byas pa'i rang bzhin de dang / don dang 'brel pa brtags pa de ma grub pa 'am the tshom zan sgra go bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rtags kyang ngo //
translated: However, the nature of a sound that is a convention for a meaning that is not a mere sequence of letters, and the relation of that to the meaning, are not understood or doubted when the sound is not produced or is produced indistinctly.

original: de la ci ltar go rims can gyi rang bzhin nam don dang 'brel pa brtags pa ma grub pa 'am the tshom zan sgra go byed ma yin pa de bzhin du rtags kyang yin no //
analyzed: de la ci ltar go rims can gyi rang bzhin nam don dang 'brel pa brtags pa ma grub pa 'am the tshom zan sgra go byed ma yin pa de bzhin du rtags kyang yin no //
translated: In the same way, a reason is also like that.

original: tshul gsum gyis go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: tshul gsum gyis go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: How is it that the trimodal condition is the means of understanding?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang lhan cig ma 'brel ba las mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang lhan cig ma 'brel ba las mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not understood from what is not related to the subject that is the predicate of the probandum.

original: dper na tshang bang du mthong ba'i du ba las rgya mtshor me mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshang bang du mthong ba'i du ba las rgya mtshor me mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as fire is not understood from smoke seen in a kitchen, fire is not understood from smoke seen on a mountain.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos kyi nye bar sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos kyi nye bar sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the application of the property of the position.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de las kyang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de las kyang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no understanding from that which is unrelated to the probandum.

original: @123a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @123a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thams cad las zhes smos te /
analyzed: thams cad las zhes smos te /
translated: Because of the statement “from everything.”

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ldog gi nye bar sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ldog gi nye bar sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the application of positive and negative concomitance.

original: gal te 'brel ba med pa go bar byed pa yin na gang gis thams cad go bar byed par mi 'gyur ba'i khyad par gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te 'brel ba med pa go bar byed pa yin na gang gis thams cad go bar byed par mi 'gyur ba'i khyad par gang zhig yin /
translated: If something unrelated could be an indicator, then what would be the difference between it and everything else, since everything would be an indicator?

original: thams cad las thams cad rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that everything indicates everything.

original: des na 'brel ba nyid nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel ba nyid nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation itself is what determines.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: And that is characterized by positive and negative concomitance, so it is the reason that is related to the three modes.

original: de'i phyir chos can dang 'brel ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang / rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba dag la ma grub pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can dang 'brel ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang / rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba dag la ma grub pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, it is not established for the proponent, the opponent, or both that the reason is related to the subject, or that it is concomitant with the similar class and is absent from the dissimilar class.

original: the tshom za ba'i chos gang la yod pa de dag ni gtan tshigs 'dra bar mngon pas na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i chos gang la yod pa de dag ni gtan tshigs 'dra bar mngon pas na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, any property that is not established or is doubtful for the proponent, the opponent, or both, with regard to the subject, the relation, the forward pervasion, the counter pervasion, or the example, is a pseudo-reason, because it appears to be a reason.

original: gtan tshigs nyid ni ma yin no //🔽tshul gsum po de la phyogs kyi tshul gcig rab tu ma grub ste bzlog pa grub pa 'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ni ma yin no // tshul gsum po de la phyogs kyi tshul gcig rab tu ma grub ste bzlog pa grub pa 'am /
translated: It is not a real reason.

original: the tshom zan ma grub pa ste /🔽ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa gcig rab tu ma grub pa 'am the tshom du gyur na 'khrul pa can ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom zan ma grub pa ste / ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro // de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa gcig rab tu ma grub pa 'am the tshom du gyur na 'khrul pa can ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one of the three modes is not established for the subject, or if it is the opposite of what is intended, or if it is doubtful, then it is a pseudo-reason that is not established.🔽If one of the three modes is not established for the dissimilar class, or if it is doubtful, then it is a pseudo-reason that is contradictory.

original: gnyis ma grub ste phyin ci log tu grub na 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ma grub ste phyin ci log tu grub na 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
translated: If two of the three modes are not established, or if they are the opposite of what is intended, then it is a pseudo-reason that is incompatible.

original: bam gyi don ni rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bam gyi don ni rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of “heap” will be explained below.

original: the tshom za na zhes bya ba ni gnyis zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: the tshom za na zhes bya ba ni gnyis zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: “ If there is doubt” is to be supplied with “about the two.”

original: gnyis the tshom du gyur na 'khrul pa can ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis the tshom du gyur na 'khrul pa can ma nges pa yin no //
translated: If there is doubt about the two, then the reason is inconclusive.

original: dper brjod pa ni rang nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper brjod pa ni rang nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The example will be shown below.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa ni tshul re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa ni tshul re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is “each of the three modes.”

original: ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i ming ngo //
translated: “ Unestablished” is the name of an unestablished reason.

original: ma nges pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pas so //
translated: “ Inconclusive” is because it is the cause of doubt.

original: gcig po gang zhig ma grub na ma grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gcig po gang zhig ma grub na ma grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one of the three is unestablished, which one is it?

original: bshad pa ; chos can dang 'brel pa ma grub na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa ; chos can dang 'brel pa ma grub na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: The explanation is: If the relation to the subject is unestablished, then the reason is a pseudo-reason.

original: dper brjod pa ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dper brjod pa ston par byed pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the example is:

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, sound is impermanent.

original: mig gis gzung ba ni chos can sgra dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir gnyi ga la ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs @123b ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba ni chos can sgra dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir gnyi ga la ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs @123b ltar snang ba'o //
translated: The eye is not the subject, because it is not established as being related to sound. Therefore, this is a fallacious reason that is not established in both positions.

original: sems pa can sems dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya ste /
analyzed: sems pa can sems dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya ste /
translated: The thesis is that “the sentient being, which is the possessor of mind, is the same as the mind.”

original: shun pa thams cad bshus nas 'chi ba'i phyir skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: shun pa thams cad bshus nas 'chi ba'i phyir skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: The example is “like a person,” because when all the bark is removed, the tree dies.

original: 'chi ba ni 'dir skam pa la bsams nas /
analyzed: 'chi ba ni 'dir skam pa la bsams nas /
translated: Here, death is considered to be drying up.

original: shing la sogs pa la gson po nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa la gson po nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that a tree, etc., is alive,

original: rgol ba phyogs kyi gos can gyis gtan tshigs 'di bkod la /
analyzed: rgol ba phyogs kyi gos can gyis gtan tshigs 'di bkod la /
translated: the opponent, who is clothed in the position, sets forth this reason.

original: phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas pas ni khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas pas ni khas ma blangs so //
translated: The opponent, the Buddhist, does not accept it.

original: yang ci'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i 'chi ba khas mi len zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i 'chi ba khas mi len zhe na /
translated: Why does he not accept the well-known death?

original: bshad pa / rnam par shes ba dang dbang po dang tshe ni srog ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / rnam par shes ba dang dbang po dang tshe ni srog ste /
translated: It is explained: Life is consciousness, the sense faculties, and heat.

original: rnam par shes pa la mi 'khrul ba'i drod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la mi 'khrul ba'i drod do //
translated: Heat is not confused with consciousness.

original: de dag 'gags pa de ni 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid yin par sangs rgyas pa la grags so //
analyzed: de dag 'gags pa de ni 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid yin par sangs rgyas pa la grags so //
translated: The cessation of these is the characteristic of death, as is well known to the Buddhists.

original: 'dir ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang po dang tshe brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang po dang tshe brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here, the nature of the faculties and life is described in terms of what is well known in the world.

original: bstan bcos la grags pa ni rigs pa'i lam du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos la grags pa ni rigs pa'i lam du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because what is well known in the treatises does not enter the path of reasoning.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'chi ba sangs rgyas pa khas len na sems can du ji ltar khas mi len /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'chi ba sangs rgyas pa khas len na sems can du ji ltar khas mi len /
translated: If one accepts such a death as is well known to the Buddhists, how can one not accept sentient beings?

original: gang la yod pa mngon du 'gro ba can gang gi 'gog pa 'jog pa yod pa de la de ci ltar yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang la yod pa mngon du 'gro ba can gang gi 'gog pa 'jog pa yod pa de la de ci ltar yod pa ma yin /
translated: How can that which has the nature of manifest existence, the cessation of which is posited, not exist?

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba grub na rnam par shes pa yang bsgrub bya ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba grub na rnam par shes pa yang bsgrub bya ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if death is established, consciousness is also not to be established.

original: de ma grub na yang gang las sems pa can yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ma grub na yang gang las sems pa can yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If that is not established, then what is the basis for thinking that there is a mental factor?

original: 'di snyam du shing dag la yang sangs rgyas pa 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du shing dag la yang sangs rgyas pa 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug par byed pa nyid do //
translated: In this regard, the Buddhists apply the term death to trees.

original: des na 'chi ba'i sgra'i rjes su 'brangs pa las /
analyzed: des na 'chi ba'i sgra'i rjes su 'brangs pa las /
translated: Therefore, the word “death” is used.🔽🔽

original: rjes su rtogs pa rab tu grags pa de ni brjod bya nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa rab tu grags pa de ni brjod bya nyid do snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it is thought that the object of expression is the well-known subsequent cognition that arises from the sound of death.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir sgra ni 'dod pas 'jug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa la mi 'khrul ba 'chi ba'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir sgra ni 'dod pas 'jug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa la mi 'khrul ba 'chi ba'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Because sound is not used intentionally, the cognition that arises from it is not a reliable indicator of the state of death.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be accomplished.

original: gang gi phyir srog chags kyi 'chi ba shing dag la ma grub pa de'i phyir 'jig rten 'di shing rnams la skam pas 'chi bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog chags kyi 'chi ba shing dag la ma grub pa de'i phyir 'jig rten 'di shing rnams la skam pas 'chi bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because the death of living beings is not established in trees, people say that trees die when they dry up.

original: 'o na skam pa nyid srog dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skam pa nyid srog dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that drying up is the reason that trees have life,

original: srog chags kyi 'chi ba ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi 'chi ba ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: then the death of living beings is not like that.

original: skam pa de srog chags nyid dang 'brel par ma mthong @124a * //🔽ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skam pa de srog chags nyid dang 'brel par ma mthong @124a * //🔽ba'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not see that drying up is related to living beings.

original: de'i phyir shing dag la skam pa grub kyang srog dang ldan pa nyid ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir shing dag la skam pa grub kyang srog dang ldan pa nyid ni mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, although the drying up of trees is established, the possession of life is not established.

original: gal te re zhig 'chi ba tsam spyir grub pa yin la /🔽de yang srog dang ldan pa nyid dang 'brel par mthong ba de'i phyir srog dang ldan pa nyid du grub pas bskams pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te re zhig 'chi ba tsam spyir grub pa yin la / de yang srog dang ldan pa nyid dang 'brel par mthong ba de'i phyir srog dang ldan pa nyid du grub pas bskams pa 'am /
translated: If, on the one hand, death is generally established,

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par bsams pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par bsams pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: and that is seen to be related to the possession of life, then because the possession of life is established, what is the point of considering the distinction, “the drying up of trees” or “the cessation of consciousness”?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po la mi ltos pa'i sgra tsam yod pa'i phyir dngos pos rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po la mi ltos pa'i sgra tsam yod pa'i phyir dngos pos rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is engaged through mere assertion, and because mere words that do not rely on things exist, whatever thing is to be understood by things is not established.

original: de'i phyir skam pa las srog dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir skam pa las srog dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the possession of life is not established from the drying up of trees.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'dir 'chi ba'i sgra tsam nyid thun mong yin gyi 'chi pa'i dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'chi ba'i sgra tsam nyid thun mong yin gyi 'chi pa'i dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: Here the mere word death is common, but the thing that is death is not.

original: skam pa dang dbang po la sogs pa 'gags pa shin tu chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skam pa dang dbang po la sogs pa 'gags pa shin tu chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation of the body, the sense faculties, and so on are utterly dissimilar.

original: sgra las don rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra las don rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the meaning understood from the sound,

original: des na sgra'i rang bzhin gyi spyis ni grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra'i rang bzhin gyi spyis ni grub pa ma yin no //
translated: and therefore the meaning is not established by the universal of the nature of sound.

original: rnam par shes pa la mi 'khrul pa'i 'chi ba khyad par can shing dag lam grub par bshad pa 'di ni grangs can gyis bkod pa blo sems pa med par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / bye brag pas nye bar bkod pa lugs dang byed pa dang gnas la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo'i rgyu can grub par byed pa dbyibs kyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la mi 'khrul pa'i 'chi ba khyad par can shing dag lam grub par bshad pa 'di ni grangs can gyis bkod pa blo sems pa med par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / bye brag pas nye bar bkod pa lugs dang byed pa dang gnas la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo'i rgyu can grub par byed pa dbyibs kyi khyad par dang /
translated: This explanation of the establishment of the path by the special consciousness that is nonerroneous in regard to death is a refutation of the Sāṃkhya’s assertion that the cause of consciousness is the permanent self and the Vaiśeṣika’s assertion that the cause of consciousness is the special shape of the elements.

original: de dag la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: This is so because the cause of consciousness is not established.

original: blo dang gnas la sogs pa'i chos can dang 'brel ba'i bsgrub bya sems pa med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi sgrub par byed pa dag ma grub par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: blo dang gnas la sogs pa'i chos can dang 'brel ba'i bsgrub bya sems pa med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi sgrub par byed pa dag ma grub par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The cause of consciousness is not established because the cause of consciousness, which is related to the subject, such as the mind, the body, and so on, and the probandum, such as the absence of sentience, and so on, are not established.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the reason “because it is engaged from the beginning.”

original: ci ltar de dag kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: ci ltar de dag kyang ma grub ste /
translated: How are these reasons unestablished?

original: 'di ltar blo mi rtag pa nyid dang / gnas la sogs pa rnams dbyibs kyi khyad par can du ni grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo mi rtag pa nyid dang / gnas la sogs pa rnams dbyibs kyi khyad par can du ni grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The cognition is impermanent, and the place, etc., are established as having a particular shape.

original: gang gi phyir blo dang gnas la sogs pa der yang sgra 'ba' zhig grub kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo dang gnas la sogs pa der yang sgra 'ba' zhig grub kyi /
translated: Because the cognition and the place, etc., are established as mere sound.

original: grangs can gyis ci 'dra ba zhig brjod par bya ba'i don ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: grangs can gyis ci 'dra ba zhig brjod par bya ba'i don ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: The object that the Sāṃkhya wants to express is not established.

original: blo sngon du 'gro ba can la mi @124b 'khrul pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par yang ma grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro ba can la mi @124b 'khrul pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par yang ma grub pa kho na'o //
translated: And the particular shape that is not mistaken in relation to the cognition that precedes it is not established at all.

original: re zhig grangs can pa'i blo sems pa med par bsgrub pa la ci ltar sgra tsam zhig grub kyi don ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig grangs can pa'i blo sems pa med par bsgrub pa la ci ltar sgra tsam zhig grub kyi don ma yin zhe na /
translated: First, in the proof that the Sāṃkhya’s cognition is not conscious, how is it that mere sound is established but not the meaning?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan bde bar gshegs pa dag nyams pa med pa'i rang bzhin nye bar zhi ba mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid la mi rtag pa nyid du ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan bde bar gshegs pa dag nyams pa med pa'i rang bzhin nye bar zhi ba mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid la mi rtag pa nyid du ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Because the other, the Sugata, is not accepted as impermanent in the nature of non-seeing, which is the nature of non-degeneration.

original: gang zhig mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma mthong ba'i rang bzhin las ma nyams pa'i dngos po ni mi mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma mthong ba'i rang bzhin las ma nyams pa'i dngos po ni mi mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not seen as impermanent does not degenerate from the nature of non-seeing.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid du ldog par khas len to //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid du ldog par khas len to //
translated: Therefore, non-pervasion is accepted.

original: des na sgra thun mong du gnyi ga la grub kyi don ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra thun mong du gnyi ga la grub kyi don ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the word is established for both as common, but not for any meaning.

original: 'dir bdag nyid nyams pa dang mi mngon pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i mi mthong ba nyid dang don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba mi rung ba nyid mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med
analyzed: 'dir bdag nyid nyams pa dang mi mngon pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i mi mthong ba nyid dang don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba mi rung ba nyid mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med
translated: Here, non-seeing itself, which is not intended to express the difference of the nature of degeneration and non-manifestation, is not suitable for application to the meaning of non-existence and the performance of function. The word impermanent expresses non-pervasion.

original: par nyams pa dang / mi mngon par gyur pa dag la khyad par med do //
analyzed: par nyams pa dang / mi mngon par gyur pa dag la khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between a damaged or lost object and an object that is not manifest.

original: de nyid ni khyad par brten pa med pa spyi grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid ni khyad par brten pa med pa spyi grub pa yin la /
translated: That is the establishment of the universal that does not depend on the particular.

original: de grub pa min na nye bar zhi ba phyir rgol ba la ma grub po zhes khyad par rtog pa'i sgo nas ma grub par rtsod pa ni ltag chod du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de grub pa min na nye bar zhi ba phyir rgol ba la ma grub po zhes khyad par rtog pa'i sgo nas ma grub par rtsod pa ni ltag chod du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is not established, then the opponent’s claim that the universal is not established because it is pacified is a reductio ad absurdum.

original: slob dpon gyis 'di ltag chod yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir ltag chod kyi yul ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di ltag chod yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir ltag chod kyi yul ston par byed pa ni /
translated: The master Buddhapālita, in order to reverse the opponent’s reductio, presents the object of the reductio:

original: gal te byas pa nyid la sogs pa ltar mi rtag pa'i sgra 'dis gang zhig brjod par bya ba dngos po cung zad cig ces bya ba dngos por yod pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid la sogs pa ltar mi rtag pa'i sgra 'dis gang zhig brjod par bya ba dngos po cung zad cig ces bya ba dngos por yod pa'i spyi'o //
translated: If, like the word “impermanent,” the word “product” expresses some existent thing,

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas kyang spyir 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas kyang spyir 'dod pa yin te /
translated: then both the proponent and the opponent would accept that the universal of that thing exists.

original: gnyi ga la grub pa yin na lan log par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grub pa yin na lan log par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If both parties accept that it exists, then the opponent’s response is incorrect.

original: byas pa nyid ni thun mong du dngos por grub pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni thun mong du dngos por grub pa yin no //
translated: The universal of product is established as a thing.

original: bum pa 'am sgra ni byas pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa 'am sgra ni byas pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: A pot or sound is not the object of expression by the term “produced.”

original: 'on kyang rgyus bskyed pa'i dngos po tsam brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyus bskyed pa'i dngos po tsam brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: However, it is merely an entity generated by a cause that is the object of expression.

original: de ni gnyi ga la yang grub bo //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga la yang grub bo //
translated: That is established for both of us.

original: gal te de tsam la bsgrub byas khyab ba ma yin na ni sgra med kyang shugs kyis khyad par 'phen pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de tsam la bsgrub byas khyab ba ma yin na ni sgra med kyang shugs kyis khyad par 'phen pa yin na /
translated: If that alone is not pervaded by the predicate, then even if sound does not exist, the qualifier is implied by force.

original: de tsam nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
translated: That alone is pervaded by impermanence.

original: des na sgras brjod par bya ba bsgrub byas khyab pa nyid kyi mi 'grub pa yin na bsgrub par bya ba'i shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: des na sgras brjod par bya ba bsgrub byas khyab pa nyid kyi mi 'grub pa yin na bsgrub par bya ba'i shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, if the object of expression by the term is not established as pervaded by the predicate, then the predicate is implied by force of the probandum.

original: sgras kyang ma zin pa'i khyad @125a * //
analyzed: sgras kyang ma zin pa'i khyad @125a * //
translated: And the qualifier that is not grasped by the term

original: par rtog pa ni ltag chod du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: par rtog pa ni ltag chod du 'gyur gyi /
translated: is a reductio.

original: 'dir ni mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya bar don gcig la grub pa gang yin pa de gzhan la ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya bar don gcig la grub pa gang yin pa de gzhan la ma yin pas /
translated: But here, whatever is established as the object of expression by the term “impermanent” is not so for another.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba 'ba' zhig khyad par med par yod kyi don ni shin du tha dad do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba 'ba' zhig khyad par med par yod kyi don ni shin du tha dad do //
translated: The word “impermanent” refers to the mere fact of existence, without distinction, but the meaning is quite different.

original: des na 'dir khyad par rtog pa'i ltag chod ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir khyad par rtog pa'i ltag chod ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a mere quibble about distinctions.

original: gal te 'dir yang mi mngon pa zhes bya ba mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid dang / don byed pa la sbyor bar mi rung ba yu bu cag la thun mong du yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang mi mngon pa zhes bya ba mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid dang / don byed pa la sbyor bar mi rung ba yu bu cag la thun mong du yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t the so-called “nonmanifest” the very nature of non-apprehension, and isn’t it not suitable to apply it to the performance of function? And isn’t it something we have in common?

original: gnas pa'i don mi mngon pa de la ni gzhan sangs rgyas pa dag mi rtag pa nyid du mi brjod do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i don mi mngon pa de la ni gzhan sangs rgyas pa dag mi rtag pa nyid du mi brjod do //
translated: The nonmanifest, which is the meaning of “enduring,” is not called “impermanent” by other Buddhists.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa'i 'jig pa la mi rtag pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa'i 'jig pa la mi rtag pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: It is called “impermanent” in the sense of destruction, which is the absence of subsequent connection.

original: yang spyi bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te zhes smos so //🔽zhig pa dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa'o //
analyzed: yang spyi bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te zhes smos so // zhig pa dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa'o //
translated: Again, in order to prove the universal, he says “if.”🔽“Destruction” is the absence of subsequent connection.

original: mi mngon par gyur pa ni bum pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi mngon par gyur pa ni bum pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: “Nonmanifest” is the nature of the pot that endures.

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang mi gsal ba mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid dang / don byed pa la nye bar sbyor bar mi rung ba mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba thun mong du yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang mi gsal ba mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid dang / don byed pa la nye bar sbyor bar mi rung ba mi rtag pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba thun mong du yod pa nyid do //
translated: Both the proponent and the opponent agree that the word “impermanent” refers to something that is unclear and unfit to perform a function.

original: dper na rgyus bskyed pa zhes bya ba byas pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rgyus bskyed pa zhes bya ba byas pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, the word “produced” refers to something that is impermanent.

original: gal te srid pa yin na mi gsal ba thun mong du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa yin na mi gsal ba thun mong du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were possible, then something unclear would be common to both.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin la ni mi gsal ba nyid mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir ci ste zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin la ni mi gsal ba nyid mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir ci ste zhes smos so //
translated: But it has been shown that it is impossible for something that is immutable by nature to be unclear.🔽“ If” means “if it were possible.

original: mtshan nyid 'dis zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba ni mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin la de yang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dis zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba ni mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin la de yang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ” “ By this characteristic” means that something unclear has the nature of not being seen, and that is impermanent.

original: gtso bo ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso bo ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The “primal substance” is the nature that is the nature of the three qualities.

original: skyes bu sems kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu sems kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The “soul” is the nature of the mind.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that the self would be impermanent in the sense of having a nature that is not seen in a certain state.

original: ci ste mi mthong ba'i gnas skabs la sngar chos gzhan yin pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste mi mthong ba'i gnas skabs la sngar chos gzhan yin pa ste /
translated: If you say that the self is a different thing in the state of being seen than it is in the state of not being seen,

original: mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin ba mi gsal te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin ba mi gsal te /
translated: then the nature of the self that is seen is not clear.

original: mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid ni mi rtag pa yin gyi mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid ni mi rtag pa yin gyi mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The nature of the self that is not seen is impermanent, but the mere nature of the self that is not seen is not.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i mi gsal ba yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i mi gsal ba yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if you say that this is a kind of unclear state,

original: sngar chos gzhan yang yin la nyams pa @125b med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir re re zhing yang khyed kyis legs par tha snyad byas so //
analyzed: sngar chos gzhan yang yin la nyams pa @125b med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir re re zhing yang khyed kyis legs par tha snyad byas so //
translated: you have not made a good case for the position that the self is a different thing in the past and that it has a nature that does not deteriorate.

original: gal te nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin na mthong ba nyid kyi chos ci ltar ldog /
analyzed: gal te nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin na mthong ba nyid kyi chos ci ltar ldog /
translated: If the self has a nature that does not deteriorate, how can the self that is seen be reversed?

original: de'i phyir mi 'pho ba'i bdag nyid la ni 'di 'dra ba'i mi gsal ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'pho ba'i bdag nyid la ni 'di 'dra ba'i mi gsal ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for a self that does not change to be unclear. This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos snga ma ldog pa brjod pa 'dis ni snga ma'i gnas skabs ldog pa yang mi 'thad par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos snga ma ldog pa brjod pa 'dis ni snga ma'i gnas skabs ldog pa yang mi 'thad par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This statement that the prior state of the self is not tenable refutes the assertion that the self is impermanent.
