original: bshad pa / de nyid ston pa ni gang zhig gnas skabs ldog pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa mi gsal ba dang 'dra ba mi rtag pa'i sgra'i yul yin par smra'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / de nyid ston pa ni gang zhig gnas skabs ldog pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa mi gsal ba dang 'dra ba mi rtag pa'i sgra'i yul yin par smra'o //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The teacher of that is one who, like a dim light, does not clearly illuminate the impermanent object of the term, which is the reversal of a state that is associated with a continuum.

original: mngon par gsal bar smra ba'i grangs can kha cig dngos po thams cad ni nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pas mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar smra ba'i grangs can kha cig dngos po thams cad ni nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pas mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Some Sāṃkhyas who propound the theory of manifestation say: All things exist in the nature of potential and are to be manifested.

original: gzhan gnas skabs gzhan du smra ba ni dngos po thams cad ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis gtso bo'i khug ma na rnam par gnas pas mi mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gnas skabs gzhan du smra ba ni dngos po thams cad ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis gtso bo'i khug ma na rnam par gnas pas mi mthong ba yin la /
translated: Some who propound the theory of transformation say: All things exist in the womb of the primal substance in their entirety, but they are not seen.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis ni khug ma nas phyung ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis ni khug ma nas phyung ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the power of conditions, like something drawn from a womb, they are seen.

original: des na gsal ba ldog pa dang nus pa rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gsal ba ldog pa dang nus pa rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the manifestation does not cease and the potency does not endure.

original: 'on kyang gnas skabs gzhan thob pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas skabs gzhan thob pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe'o //
translated: Rather, it is only that another state is obtained.

original: de la grangs can dang po gsal ba smra ba bsal zin to //
analyzed: de la grangs can dang po gsal ba smra ba bsal zin to //
translated: The first Sāṃkhya, who advocates manifestation, has already been refuted.

original: da lta ni gnas skabs smra ba rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: da lta ni gnas skabs smra ba rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: Now the one who advocates a state is to be refuted.

original: de ltar yang de lta yin dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams tha dad par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o zhes thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang de lta yin dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams tha dad par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o zhes thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is explained that until the consequence that “there is no doubt that pleasure and so on would become different” is completed,

original: 'di gsal bas bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di gsal bas bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: this is the position of the Vaibhāṣikas, who advocate manifestation.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas ni gzhung 'di 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas ni gzhung 'di 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: This treatise does not engage from that perspective.

original: grangs can de la yang gang gis mi mthong bar 'gyur ba gnas skabs de nyid ldog pa yang yin la ;
analyzed: grangs can de la yang gang gis mi mthong bar 'gyur ba gnas skabs de nyid ldog pa yang yin la ;
translated: Also, for the Sāṃkhya, that very state that is not seen ceases,

original: gtso bo'i khug ma na gnas pa'i phyir nyams pa med pa yang yin /
analyzed: gtso bo'i khug ma na gnas pa'i phyir nyams pa med pa yang yin /
translated: and because it abides in the womb of the primal substance, it is not lost.

original: bum pa de'i gnas skabs mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul snam bu bsgribs pa ltar ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa de'i gnas skabs mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul snam bu bsgribs pa ltar ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: The state of the pot is the object of the eye consciousness, just as a patch is the object of the eye consciousness when it covers the pot.

original: gnas skabs can gyi mthong ba'i dngos po ni gnas nyid do zhe na /🔽gnas skabs can dang gnas @126a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs can gyi mthong ba'i dngos po ni gnas nyid do zhe na / gnas skabs can dang gnas @126a * //
translated: But the thing that is seen, which has a state, is the state itself.

original: skabs tha dad par thal ba mi bzod pas gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig zhes smos so //
analyzed: skabs tha dad par thal ba mi bzod pas gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig zhes smos so //
translated: Since it is unacceptable that the thing that has a state and the state are different, he says, “What is this so-called state?”

original: gzhan ni gang log ba mi rtag pa yin pa gnas skabs dang don med par mthong bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni gang log ba mi rtag pa yin pa gnas skabs dang don med par mthong bar ston par byed do //
translated: He shows that the other, which is impermanent because it is destroyed, is seen to be meaningless in relation to the state.

original: chu 'dzin pa dang len pa la sogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chu 'dzin pa dang len pa la sogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The accomplishment of the act of holding water, etc.” is the application called “accomplishment.”

original: de 'dra ba de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: bshad pa / 'jig rten 'di mngon sum du zhes bya ba mngon sum dag tu ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'jig rten 'di mngon sum du zhes bya ba mngon sum dag tu ste /
translated: He says, “This world is seen directly,” that is, in direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi lhag par zhen pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi lhag par zhen pa 'di yin no //
translated: This is the superimposition that has the characteristics of direct perception as its cause.

original: ci ltar zhen ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhen ce na /
translated: How is it superimposed?

original: 'di bum ba'o zhes brjod par byed pa dang 'dres par ro //
analyzed: 'di bum ba'o zhes brjod par byed pa dang 'dres par ro //
translated: It is like saying, “This is a pot.”

original: de'i phyir de ltar don byed pa dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang tha snyad kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don byed pa dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang tha snyad kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the occasion of the object’s causal capacity, direct perception, and conventional designation is established.

original: yang ci ltar den byed pa la sogs pa de dag gnas skabs kyi rgyu mtshan can yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar den byed pa la sogs pa de dag gnas skabs kyi rgyu mtshan can yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how are these causal capacities, etc., characterized by the occasion?

original: gnas skabs de log na gnas skabs can gzhan ma log kyang don byed pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs de log na gnas skabs can gzhan ma log kyang don byed pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because when that occasion ceases, all these causal capacities, etc., are nonexistent, even though the occasion-possessor does not cease.

original: don byed pa la sogs pa gnas skabs kyi rgyu mtshan can yin gyi /
analyzed: don byed pa la sogs pa gnas skabs kyi rgyu mtshan can yin gyi /
translated: Causal capacities, etc., are characterized by the occasion,

original: gnas skabs can gyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs can gyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but they are not characterized by the occasion-possessor.

original: gal te de lta na ni 'o na tha snyad la sogs pa'i yul gnas skabs de nyid bum pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni 'o na tha snyad la sogs pa'i yul gnas skabs de nyid bum pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then that occasion, the object of conventional designation, etc., is the pot.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bshad pa / bum pa gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du bstan pa dang / don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba dang / lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba ci skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid de rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / bum pa gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du bstan pa dang / don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba dang / lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba ci skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid de rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That which is a pot is characterized by being conventionally indicated, being suitable to perform a function, and being an object of attachment, as explained.

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid can de yang log pa de'i phyir gnas skabs can gzhan ma log par yod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid can de yang log pa de'i phyir gnas skabs can gzhan ma log par yod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Since it has that nature, its state also has that nature. Therefore, since that state is false, whatever exists as a state that is not false

original: 'di ci ltar don byed pa dang tshad ma med par yod pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ci ltar don byed pa dang tshad ma med par yod pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: should be investigated: How can it exist without performing a function and without being a valid object of knowledge?

original: yod pa yin du chug kyang de bum pa dngos po pa don dam par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa yin du chug kyang de bum pa dngos po pa don dam par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it does exist, it will not be a real pot ultimately.

original: gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pas na brtags pa par ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pas na brtags pa par ni 'gyur te /
translated: It will be a nominal pot because the basis of imputation exists.

original: dper na lteng ka'i chu la rkang nang du brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lteng ka'i chu la rkang nang du brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like calling the water in a mirage “water.”

original: ci ltar bum pa dngos po par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar bum pa dngos po par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How will it not be a real pot?

original: gnas skabs can de la de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs can de la de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is a state does not have the characteristic of that.

original: khyad par can gyi don byed pa la @126b sbyor ba dang / khyad par can gyi rnam pa dang ldan par mthong ba'i don ni bum pa yin la /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi don byed pa la @126b sbyor ba dang / khyad par can gyi rnam pa dang ldan par mthong ba'i don ni bum pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the qualified is the object that is engaged in the performance of a function and is seen to possess a qualified aspect, and that is a pot.

original: gnas skabs can de ni de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs can de ni de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo med pa yin no //
translated: Because that which is a state is not like that, it does not have the nature of that.

original: ci ltar de'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: ci ltar de'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: How does it not have the characteristic of that?

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i dngos po ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i dngos po ni gcig yin no //
translated: Because the seen and unseen things are one.

original: des na bum pa log kyang rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni bum pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na bum pa log kyang rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni bum pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, even when the pot is overturned, that which remains is the nature of the pot.

original: tha dad par mthong ba ga las she na /
analyzed: tha dad par mthong ba ga las she na /
translated: How is it seen to be different?

original: gnas skabs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i phyir tha dad par mngon pa yin gyi dngos po la ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i phyir tha dad par mngon pa yin gyi dngos po la ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is connected to another state, it appears to be different, but there is no difference in the thing itself.

original: gal te gnas skabs tha dad par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs tha dad par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the states are different,

original: 'o na gnas skabs tha dad pa de nyid dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid du ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'o na gnas skabs tha dad pa de nyid dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid du ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: But why not accept that the very difference in states is the characteristic of the difference of things?

original: de lta yin dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug rnams phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug rnams phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then there is no doubt that pleasure, pain, and delusion would be mutually different.

original: gal te gnas skabs tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po tha dad par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po tha dad par 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the difference in states is the difference in things,

original: bde ba tshim pa'i don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba dang / rnam pa khyad par can gyi gnas skabs ci 'dra ba de sdug bsngal la ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba tshim pa'i don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba dang / rnam pa khyad par can gyi gnas skabs ci 'dra ba de sdug bsngal la ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: then because the state of a particular kind is not seen in pain, it is applied to the object that is the cause of the satisfaction of pleasure.

original: de gnyis dngos po la tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis dngos po la tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those two are different things.

original: gal te gnas skabs tha dad kyang dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur na ni bde ba la sogs pa yang tha dad pa med par thal lo //
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs tha dad kyang dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur na ni bde ba la sogs pa yang tha dad pa med par thal lo //
translated: If, although there is a difference in states, there is no difference in things, then it follows that pleasure and so on are not different.

original: grangs can gyis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can gyis smras pa /
translated: The Sāṃkhya says,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rjes su byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rjes su byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it follows the nature of something, such as pleasure.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gnas skabs tha dad par gyur kyang dngos po thams cad tha mi dad de bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gnas skabs tha dad par gyur kyang dngos po thams cad tha mi dad de bdag nyid do //
translated: Therefore, although they are different in time, all things are not different in substance.

original: slob dpon gyis rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug rnams la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug rnams la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: The master says: Is it not the same for pleasure, pain, and confusion?

original: 'di ltar byed pa po nyid dang yongs su 'gyur ba can nyid ni gsum ka la yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa po nyid dang yongs su 'gyur ba can nyid ni gsum ka la yang yod pa yin no //
translated: For all three, there is the state of being an agent and the state of being a transformer.

original: skyes bu rnams la yang longs spyod pa po nyid dang / byed pa po ma yin pa nyid dang / yongs su 'gyur ba can ma yin pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gcig rjes su byed par mtshungs te /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams la yang longs spyod pa po nyid dang / byed pa po ma yin pa nyid dang / yongs su 'gyur ba can ma yin pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gcig rjes su byed par mtshungs te /
translated: And it is the same for men, for they are similar in that they are the nature of a single substance, in that they are not agents, and in that they are not transformers.

original: grangs can ba'i des na bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / skyes @127a * //🔽bu rnams kyang gcig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs can ba'i des na bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / skyes @127a * //🔽bu rnams kyang gcig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that pleasure, etc., and men are the same.

original: tha dad na dngos po rnams rim gyis mngon par gsal ba 'gal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gcig yin no //
analyzed: tha dad na dngos po rnams rim gyis mngon par gsal ba 'gal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gcig yin no //
translated: If they were different, the manifestation of things would be contradictory. Therefore, they are one.

original: phan tshun rag las pa med pa rnams ni cig car mngon par gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan tshun rag las pa med pa rnams ni cig car mngon par gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those that are not mutually dependent are manifested simultaneously,

original: dper na skyes bu dang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu dang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a person and his pleasure, etc.

original: tha dad pa med na ni cung zhig ltar yongs su 'gyur ba yin pa las phyir yang gzhan du yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir rim gyis mngon par gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med na ni cung zhig ltar yongs su 'gyur ba yin pa las phyir yang gzhan du yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir rim gyis mngon par gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If they are not different, then they would be completely transformed in some way, and then again transformed in another way. Therefore, they are manifested gradually.

original: 'o na ni rim gyis mngon bar gsal ba 'gal ba de'i phyir ci bum pa dang zho la sogs pa du mar 'gyur ram /🔽tha mi dad pa'i phyir rim gyis mngon bar gsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ni rim gyis mngon bar gsal ba 'gal ba de'i phyir ci bum pa dang zho la sogs pa du mar 'gyur ram / tha mi dad pa'i phyir rim gyis mngon bar gsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then because the manifestation of things gradually is contradictory, therefore, are many things such as a pot and curds, etc.,🔽manifested gradually because they are not different?

original: tha dad ba la ni rim ma yin par mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad ba la ni rim ma yin par mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If they were different, they would be manifested not gradually.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang rim gyis mngon bar gsal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang rim gyis mngon bar gsal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and pleasure, etc. are also gradually manifested, therefore they are not different.

original: ci ste tha mi dad ba tsam gyis rim gyis mngon par gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste tha mi dad ba tsam gyis rim gyis mngon par gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: But if they are not gradually manifested because they are merely not different,

original: tha dad pa tsam las kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: tha dad pa tsam las kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: and they are not different from mere difference,

original: de lta na ni 'o na rim gyis mngon bar gsal ba la tha mi dad pas khyab pa ma grub pa yin na 'gal ba yang ci yod /🔽rim gyis mngon bar gsal ba dang tha dad pa las ni lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba med la /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rim gyis mngon bar gsal ba la tha mi dad pas khyab pa ma grub pa yin na 'gal ba yang ci yod / rim gyis mngon bar gsal ba dang tha dad pa las ni lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba med la /
translated: then in that case, since the pervasion of gradual manifestation by nondifference is not established, what contradiction is there?

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bdag nyid gcig par 'gal ba yang med do //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bdag nyid gcig par 'gal ba yang med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in gradual manifestation and difference, and there is no contradiction in identity, which is characterized by the mutual exclusion of things.

original: des na gal te tha dad pa dang 'gal ba tha mi dad pas rim gyis mngon par gsal ba la khyab ba grub na ;
analyzed: des na gal te tha dad pa dang 'gal ba tha mi dad pas rim gyis mngon par gsal ba la khyab ba grub na ;
translated: Therefore, if the pervasion of gradual manifestation by nondifference, which is the contradiction of difference, is established,

original: de lta na 'gal bas khyab pas na tha dad pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na tha mi dad pas khyab pa ni med do //
analyzed: de lta na 'gal bas khyab pas na tha dad pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na tha mi dad pas khyab pa ni med do //
translated: Thus, since there is a contradiction, there would be a contradiction with difference, but there is no contradiction with non-difference.

original: rim pa snga ma yang ma yin ba'i phyir 'gal ba ga la yod //
analyzed: rim pa snga ma yang ma yin ba'i phyir 'gal ba ga la yod //
translated: And since there is no prior order, how can there be a contradiction?

original: 'o na ni tha dad pa la yang rim pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni tha dad pa la yang rim pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But if there is difference, how can there be a prior order?

original: gang gi mjug thogs su gang 'byung ba de snga ma de'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: gang gi mjug thogs su gang 'byung ba de snga ma de'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: That which arises immediately after something is the effect of the former.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de ma grub par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de ma grub par mi 'grub bo //
translated: And because it is the effect of that, it does not occur without the former.

original: mi grub pa'i phyir ni rim par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi grub pa'i phyir ni rim par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And because it does not occur, there is a prior order.

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na khyad par du rim pa med par thal ba yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na khyad par du rim pa med par thal ba yin te /
translated: If there is no difference, it follows that there is no prior order,

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa gcig gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa med pas rim @127b med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa gcig gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa med pas rim @127b med pa bzhin no //
translated: just as there is no prior order in pleasure, etc., because there is no difference in their nature.

original: rim gyis mthong ba'i phyir ni tha dad par rtogs so //
analyzed: rim gyis mthong ba'i phyir ni tha dad par rtogs so //
translated: But difference is understood from the observation of a prior order.

original: gang gi phyir zho ni'o ma'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zho ni'o ma'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Because curd is the effect of milk,

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir te de las tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir te de las tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is the effect of that, it is not different from it.

original: gal te de'i 'bras bu nyid tha dad pa med par 'brel ba grub na tha dad pa med pa 'di rigs pa yin no ;
analyzed: gal te de'i 'bras bu nyid tha dad pa med par 'brel ba grub na tha dad pa med pa 'di rigs pa yin no ;
translated: If the effect itself is established as related to it without being different, then this nondifference is reasonable.

original: 'brel ba grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'brel ba grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is the relation established?

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni tha dad pa yin la /
translated: In this way, the dissimilar class is different.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa ni pha rol po la tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa ni pha rol po la tha dad pa yin no //
translated: And a pot, a cloth, etc. are different for the opponent.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid de las log pas tha dad pa dang 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid de las log pas tha dad pa dang 'brel ba yin no //
translated: The effect itself is related to it as different, because it is the opposite of that.

original: tha mi dad pa pha rol bos khas blangs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa pha rol bos khas blangs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ni med do zhe na /
translated: Since the nondifference is accepted by the opponent, there is no pervasion.

original: bshad pa / 'brel pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa gang yin pa de la mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'brel pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa gang yin pa de la mi 'grub ste /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: That relation which is not a pervasion is not established in that.

original: log pa yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes log pa bsam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: log pa yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes log pa bsam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Because the opposite is also doubtful, the opposite should be considered.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad par ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad par ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that something is not different because it is the effect of that.

original: rim gyis mngon par gsal ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rim gyis mngon par gsal ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not because of the gradual manifestation of the object;

original: rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: not because of the identity of the nature of the object.

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnas skabs tha dad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnas skabs tha dad pa nyid yin te /
translated: The characteristic of a different thing is the difference of the states.

original: de log na dngos po ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: de log na dngos po ldog pa yin la /
translated: When that is stopped, the thing is stopped.

original: dngos po ma log na ni gnas skabs mi ldog cing mi gsal ba ma yin no //🔽ci ltar ldog pa gcig la brten pa 'brel pa'i khyad par spangs pa dngos po rnams kyi rgyu las skyes pa la tha dad pa med par byas pa'i sgras brjod pa ltar gang la mi rtog pa'i sgra 'dis brjod par 'gyur ba 'brel pa'i khyad par du rtogs
analyzed: dngos po ma log na ni gnas skabs mi ldog cing mi gsal ba ma yin no // ci ltar ldog pa gcig la brten pa 'brel pa'i khyad par spangs pa dngos po rnams kyi rgyu las skyes pa la tha dad pa med par byas pa'i sgras brjod pa ltar gang la mi rtog pa'i sgra 'dis brjod par 'gyur ba 'brel pa'i khyad par du rtogs
translated: When the thing is not stopped, the state is not stopped, and it is not manifested.

original: pa spangs te btang yang mi mthong ba nyid dam gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: pa spangs te btang yang mi mthong ba nyid dam gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Just as the difference of the states of a thing is not imagined in the case of the expression of a thing as produced from a cause, because of the abandonment of the difference of the relation that is based on the difference of the states, in the same way, in the case of the expression of a thing as the object of a cognition, because of the abandonment of the difference of the relation that is imagined in the object of a cognition, the thing is not seen as different, whether it is the same as the cognition or different from it.

original: gcig gi chos ni ci ltar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi chos ni ci ltar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The property of one is never present in any other way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs ldog pa'am ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs ldog pa'am ma yin /
translated: In every way means that the difference of the states is not stopped.

original: gsal ba'i sgo nas ldog pa gcig la brten pa'i chos brtag kyang ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba'i sgo nas ldog pa gcig la brten pa'i chos brtag kyang ngo //
translated: The examination of the dharma that is based on the same negation by way of manifestation is also like this.

original: ci ltar zhig pa dang cig shos dag la thun mong gi chos gcig med pa ltar ni skyes bu dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar zhig pa dang cig shos dag la thun mong gi chos gcig med pa ltar ni skyes bu dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the dharma that is common to both the one who is ceasing and the other is not one, so it is with the persons.

original: skyes bu shi'o //
analyzed: skyes bu shi'o //
translated: The person dies.

original: shing shi'o zhes sgra'i tha snyad tsam yod kyang dngos po la ni 'chi ba'i spyi ci 'dra ba sems can gyis khyab pa de 'dra ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: shing shi'o zhes sgra'i tha snyad tsam yod kyang dngos po la ni 'chi ba'i spyi ci 'dra ba sems can gyis khyab pa de 'dra ba med pa yin no //
translated: The tree dies. Although there is just the verbal convention of death, in reality there is no universal of death that pervades sentient beings.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig yin @128a * //
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig yin @128a * //
translated: What is it like?

original: zhe na / rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu dbugs dang drod dang g-yo ba dag dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can shi ba gang zhig mthong bas so //
analyzed: zhe na / rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu dbugs dang drod dang g-yo ba dag dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can shi ba gang zhig mthong bas so //
translated: It is the death that is characterized by the absence of the effects of consciousness, namely, breath, heat, and movement.

original: srog chags gzhan zhes bya ba 'chi ba gcig la shi ba mthong bas de las gzhan pa'i srog chags 'chi ba la yang srog chags 'chi ba de ni 'di yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: srog chags gzhan zhes bya ba 'chi ba gcig la shi ba mthong bas de las gzhan pa'i srog chags 'chi ba la yang srog chags 'chi ba de ni 'di yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When one sees the death of one living being, one knows that the death of another living being is also like that.

original: 'di ni gang gi phyir dbugs dang drod dang khrag dang rnag dngos po rnam par shes pa la rag las pa ldog pas de la gnas pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang ldog par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi phyir dbugs dang drod dang khrag dang rnag dngos po rnam par shes pa la rag las pa ldog pas de la gnas pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang ldog par nges pa yin no //
translated: This is because, since the cessation of the consciousness is certain, the cessation of the elements, such as breath, heat, and blood, is certain, because they are dependent on consciousness.

original: des na thun mong du sems pas khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na thun mong du sems pas khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the common nature of the pervasion by mind is established by perception.

original: de gal te shing dag la grub na ni sems pa can du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gal te shing dag la grub na ni sems pa can du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is established in trees, then it is understood that they have mind.

original: gal te shing la sogs pa de la skam pas nye bar mtshon pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na bden te /
analyzed: gal te shing la sogs pa de la skam pas nye bar mtshon pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na bden te /
translated: But isn’t it the case that trees, etc., are characterized by dryness? It is true, but

original: 'o na kyang gal te skam pa la sogs pa nyid 'chi ba'i sgras phyogs kyi gos can brjod na /
analyzed: 'o na kyang gal te skam pa la sogs pa nyid 'chi ba'i sgras phyogs kyi gos can brjod na /
translated: if dryness, etc., are what is meant by the term death,

original: de'i tshe 'di la yang 'brel ba nges pa ltar brtags pa gang las 'chi bas sems pa can grub par 'gyur ba sems pa can dang 'brel par nges par brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di la yang 'brel ba nges pa ltar brtags pa gang las 'chi bas sems pa can grub par 'gyur ba sems pa can dang 'brel par nges par brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: then, in that case, the relation between dryness, etc., and mind must be ascertained, because it is from that relation that the existence of mind in trees, etc., is established.

original: de'i phyir phyogs kyi gos can gyis nye bar bkod pa'i gtan tshigs la yang sgra tsam thun mong du grub kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs kyi gos can gyis nye bar bkod pa'i gtan tshigs la yang sgra tsam thun mong du grub kyi /
translated: Therefore, the reason stated by the partisan of the cloak is established as a mere sound.

original: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i 'chi ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don ni grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i 'chi ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don ni grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But the meaning expressed by the word “death” which is pervaded by the probandum is not established.

original: de bzhin du bye brag pas nye bar bkod pa yang bsgrub byas khyab pa'i don ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bye brag pas nye bar bkod pa yang bsgrub byas khyab pa'i don ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes smos te /
translated: Similarly, the Vaiśeṣika’s statement is also stated to show that the meaning pervaded by the probandum is not established.

original: dbyibs kyang gal te ci 'dra ba zhig blo sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba khang bzangs dang ra ba la sogs pa la rjes su 'jug pa can te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang gal te ci 'dra ba zhig blo sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba khang bzangs dang ra ba la sogs pa la rjes su 'jug pa can te /
translated: As for shape, if it is seen to be preceded by cognition, it is something that is applied to a mansion, a fence, and so on.

original: 'dis ni dbyibs thun mong gi ngo bor bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbyibs thun mong gi ngo bor bstan to //
translated: This shows that shape is a common entity.

original: blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dbyibs de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dbyibs de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the shape that is preceded by cognition?

original: bshad pa / dbyibs gang zhig mthong bas khang bzangs la sogs pa byed pa ma mthong ba can gyi byed pa mthong ba de la yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / dbyibs gang zhig mthong bas khang bzangs la sogs pa byed pa ma mthong ba can gyi byed pa mthong ba de la yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: When you see a shape, you see the activity of a house, and so on, even though you do not see the activity. Therefore, you think that it is created.

original: 'dir khang bzangs la sogs pa'i rjes su song ba 'di dbyibs kyi khyad par ni byas zin @128b pa mthong ba la yang byas pa'i blo'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir khang bzangs la sogs pa'i rjes su song ba 'di dbyibs kyi khyad par ni byas zin @128b pa mthong ba la yang byas pa'i blo'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the shape that is the basis of the house, and so on, is a particular shape. Even when you see it after it has been created, it is the cause of the thought that it is created.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i dbyibs kyi spyi byas par nges pa'i rgyu mtshan mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni blo sngon du 'gro ba can du 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i dbyibs kyi spyi byas par nges pa'i rgyu mtshan mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni blo sngon du 'gro ba can du 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason that ascertains the generality of such a shape to be created is a direct perception. It is well known in the world that it precedes the thought.

original: gal te lus dang byed pa dang gnas rnams de 'dra ba yin na de'i tshe dbyibs kyi khyad par gyi phyir dang / bsdad nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad de ltar zhes bya ba go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lus dang byed pa dang gnas rnams de 'dra ba yin na de'i tshe dbyibs kyi khyad par gyi phyir dang / bsdad nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad de ltar zhes bya ba go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body, the activity, and the place are like that, then the reason “because of the particular shape” and “because of the activity of standing” and so on would be established by that.

original: blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyis khyab pa'i dbyibs gang yin pa de ni lus dang byed pa dang gnas rnams la ma grub po //
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyis khyab pa'i dbyibs gang yin pa de ni lus dang byed pa dang gnas rnams la ma grub po //
translated: The shape that is pervaded by the prior cognition is not established in the body, the action, or the location.

original: don 'di nyid lhag dang bcas te tshigs su bcad par brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid lhag dang bcas te tshigs su bcad par brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This very point is stated in the verse beginning with “Moreover,” along with the remainder.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa ci 'dra ba zhig go //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa ci 'dra ba zhig go //
translated: What kind of shape, etc.?

original: sogs pa smos pas bsdad na 'jug pa la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas bsdad na 'jug pa la sogs ba'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the action, the location, and the prior cognition.

original: byin gyis rlob pa po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug pa can du grub pa de 'dra ba de las blo sngon du 'gro ba can nyid rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug pa can du grub pa de 'dra ba de las blo sngon du 'gro ba can nyid rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The establishment of the shape, etc. as following the existence and nonexistence of the possessor of the shape, etc. is such that the inference of the pervasion of the prior cognition is itself reasonable.

original: dngos tha dad la zhes bya bas ni byas pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir khang bzangs la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni dngos po gzhan yin la rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir gnas la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyang dngos po gzhan nyid yin par mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin
analyzed: dngos tha dad la zhes bya bas ni byas pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir khang bzangs la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni dngos po gzhan yin la rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir gnas la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyang dngos po gzhan nyid yin par mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin
translated: The phrase “distinct entities” indicates that the shape of a mansion, etc., is a distinct entity because it is the cause of the cognition of something that is made. The shape of the parts, etc., is also a distinct entity because it is not the cause of that cognition.

original: no // de la khang bzangs la sogs pa'i dbyibs dngos po tha dad pa las rab tu grub pa'i blo sngon du 'gro ba can nyid ni dbyibs kyi sgra tsam mtshungs pas tha dad pa med par brtags pa'i dbyibs gang yin pa de las rjes su dpog par rigs pa🔽ma yin no //🔽du ba skya bo'i rdzas gang yang rung ba las me rjes su dpog par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: no // de la khang bzangs la sogs pa'i dbyibs dngos po tha dad pa las rab tu grub pa'i blo sngon du 'gro ba can nyid ni dbyibs kyi sgra tsam mtshungs pas tha dad pa med par brtags pa'i dbyibs gang yin pa de las rjes su dpog par rigs pa ma yin no // du ba skya bo'i rdzas gang yang rung ba las me rjes su dpog par ni mi rigs so //
translated: The shape of a mansion, etc., is established by direct perception as a distinct entity. The cognition of that shape is preceded by the cognition of the distinct entities that constitute the shape. It is not reasonable to infer that shape from a shape that is imagined to be undifferentiated because of the mere similarity of the word “shape.”🔽It is not reasonable to infer fire from any substance that is a pale-colored smoke.

original: skya bo'i rdzas tsam las rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skya bo'i rdzas tsam las rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not the case that fire is inferred from pale-colored substance alone.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i rdzas ni nges pa yin pa'i pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i rdzas ni nges pa yin pa'i pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The substance that is produced is definite.

original: dbyibs kyi cha shas ni rdzas rnams la thun mong yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi cha shas ni rdzas rnams la thun mong yin no zhe na /
translated: But the shape of the parts is common to the substances.

original: bshad pa / de ltar min par khas len na rdza mkhan gyis bum pa la sogs pa 'jim pa'i rnam 'gyur 'ga' zhig byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ltar min par khas len na rdza mkhan gyis bum pa la sogs pa 'jim pa'i rnam 'gyur 'ga' zhig byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains: If you accept that is not so, then because the potter creates some transformation of clay, such as a pot,

original: grog mkhar yang rdza mkhan des byas par grub par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: grog mkhar yang rdza mkhan des byas par grub par 'gyur ro//
translated: it would be established that the potter also creates an anthill.

original: @129a * // 'jim pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rdza mkhan gyis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: @129a * // 'jim pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rdza mkhan gyis byas pa yin te /
translated: Whatever transformation of clay there is, that is created by the potter,

original: dbyibs tsam du khyad bar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam du khyad bar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in shape alone.

original: 'di snyam du spyi grub par byed pa la sgrub pa la khyad par rtog pa ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du spyi grub par byed pa la sgrub pa la khyad par rtog pa ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: If you think that the argument is a consequence that is similar to the conclusion, then the proof of the establishment of the universal is a consequence.

original: ltag chod kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ltag chod kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the object of the consequence, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bsgrub byas rjes 'gro ste bsgrub byas khyab pa'i phyir 'bras bu byas pa nyid thun mong ba sgrub par byed pa yin par grub na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub byas rjes 'gro ste bsgrub byas khyab pa'i phyir 'bras bu byas pa nyid thun mong ba sgrub par byed pa yin par grub na'o //
translated: If it is established that the common effect, being a product, is the proof, then the probandum follows because the probandum is pervaded by the proof.

original: byas pa nyid ni khyad par la brten pa med par thun mong sgrub par byed pa yin te sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni khyad par la brten pa med par thun mong sgrub par byed pa yin te sgra bzhin no //
translated: The reason “because of being produced” is a common reason that does not depend on a specific attribute, as the words themselves indicate.

original: de yang bsgrub byas khyab pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsgrub byas khyab pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the probandum is established by the pervasion.

original: des na don gyis 'phangs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na don gyis 'phangs pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not implied by the meaning,

original: sgras kyang ma zin pa'i 'brel pa can sgra dang bum pa tha dad pa'i phyir byas pa nyid la de tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi skyon brjod pa ste /
analyzed: sgras kyang ma zin pa'i 'brel pa can sgra dang bum pa tha dad pa'i phyir byas pa nyid la de tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi skyon brjod pa ste /
translated: and the reason is not grasped by the words. The reason is related to the probandum, but because sound and pot are different, the fault is stated that the reason “because of being produced” has a reason that is different from the probandum.

original: bum pa'i byas pa nyid ni sgra la ma grub la /
analyzed: bum pa'i byas pa nyid ni sgra la ma grub la /
translated: The production of a pot is not established in sound.

original: sgra'i byas pa nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod du 'dod /
analyzed: sgra'i byas pa nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod du 'dod /
translated: The production of sound is not concomitant with the probandum. This is asserted to be a reductio that is similar to the effect.

original: 'dir ni bsgrub byas khyab pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni ma grub la /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgrub byas khyab pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni ma grub la /
translated: Here, whatever shape, etc., is pervaded by the probandum is not established.

original: grub pa gang yin pa ni bsgrub byas ma khyab pa'i phyir gdon mi za ba nyid du go bar byed pa nges par brtag dgos so //
analyzed: grub pa gang yin pa ni bsgrub byas ma khyab pa'i phyir gdon mi za ba nyid du go bar byed pa nges par brtag dgos so //
translated: Whatever is established is not pervaded by the probandum. Therefore it is necessary to ascertain that it is a reason that is necessarily concomitant.

original: gang gi tshe khyab par bya ba'i chos nges par mi rtogs na ni de'i tshe don ci srid la sgra gcig yod pa de cig gtan tshigs su 'gyur bas der phyogs gcig la mthong ba'i chos sgra tsam las thams cad du rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyab par bya ba'i chos nges par mi rtogs na ni de'i tshe don ci srid la sgra gcig yod pa de cig gtan tshigs su 'gyur bas der phyogs gcig la mthong ba'i chos sgra tsam las thams cad du rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: When the pervader is not ascertained, then at that time, how could the mere existence of a single sound be a logical reason? Therefore, in that case, one would see the mere sound in one part and then infer it everywhere.

original: brjod pa ni rigs gzhan la ni ste rigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dbyibs byas pa'i blo nges pa'i rgyu mtshan la rab tu grub pa ni sgra'i spyi sgra thun mong ba de mthong ba de mthong ba las sgrub par byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: brjod pa ni rigs gzhan la ni ste rigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dbyibs byas pa'i blo nges pa'i rgyu mtshan la rab tu grub pa ni sgra'i spyi sgra thun mong ba de mthong ba de mthong ba las sgrub par byed par mi rigs te /
translated: This is said to be in another class, because the reason for the ascertainment of the shape of a pot in another class is not established by seeing the common sound-universal of the word pot.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽dper na ngag la sogs pa rnams go nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na rva can yin par rjes su dpag par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / dper na ngag la sogs pa rnams go nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na rva can yin par rjes su dpag par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: How is that?🔽For example, just as one cannot infer that a cow is horned because it is denoted by the word go,

original: rva can ni go'i sgras brjod par bya ba rigs gzhan la rab tu grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rva can ni go'i sgras brjod par bya ba rigs gzhan la rab tu grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because being denoted by the word go is established in another class, that of horned animals.

original: yang ci'i phyir dngos pos 'grub kyi sgras ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos pos 'grub kyi sgras ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it established by the thing, but not by the word?

original: bshad pa / brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir sgra rnams ni thams cad la yod pa nyid @129b do ;
analyzed: bshad pa / brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir sgra rnams ni thams cad la yod pa nyid @129b do ;
translated: It is said: Because it is related to what is desired to be expressed, words exist in all things.

original: / de yod pa 'brel pa med pa'i don yod par grub par khas len na thams cad kyi dngos po thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de yod pa 'brel pa med pa'i don yod par grub par khas len na thams cad kyi dngos po thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the existence of that which is unrelated to existence is established, then all things would be established by all things.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub byas ma khyab pa'i gtan tshigs rnam par rtog pa ni ltag chod ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub byas ma khyab pa'i gtan tshigs rnam par rtog pa ni ltag chod ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a reason that is not pervaded by the probandum is not a fallacy,

original: sgra tsam gtan tshigs su thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra tsam gtan tshigs su thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that mere words are reasons.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po'i bdag nyid can gyi gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po'i bdag nyid can gyi gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: A reason that has the nature of a thing and the nature of an entity is not established.

original: bsgrub byas khyab ba can ma mthong na mi grub pa nyid kyi tshul 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub byas khyab ba can ma mthong na mi grub pa nyid kyi tshul 'di yin no //
translated: This is the method of non-establishment when the pervader of the probandum is not seen.

original: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs grub na sgras nye bar ma zin pa'i khyad par rnam par brtags pa gnod pa byed pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs grub na sgras nye bar ma zin pa'i khyad par rnam par brtags pa gnod pa byed pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: When a reason that pervades the probandum is established, the distinctions that are not directly expressed by words are not negated by imagination.

original: de ma grub kyang khyad par nye bar gzung na yang sgrub par byed pa la skyon sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub kyang khyad par nye bar gzung na yang sgrub par byed pa la skyon sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if that is not established, if a particular is taken as the predicate, then the fault of proving what is already established does not arise.

original: dper na byas ba nyid kyi khyad par sgra'i nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma grub kyang byas pa nyid la gnod pa med pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na byas ba nyid kyi khyad par sgra'i nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma grub kyang byas pa nyid la gnod pa med pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, although the particular of being produced is not established as a quality of space, it does not undermine being produced.

original: sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Sound is impermanent.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan dang don gcig la 'du ba'i byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan dang don gcig la 'du ba'i byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is produced, which is synonymous with being a quality of space.

original: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: In this way, that which possesses pervasion is the reason.

original: sgra tsam la gnas pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan med kyang byas pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra tsam la gnas pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan med kyang byas pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Although the quality of space that resides in mere sound does not exist, being produced possesses pervasion.

original: des na 'di ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang bral ba nyid 'dod pa yin no /
analyzed: des na 'di ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang bral ba nyid 'dod pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, this is asserted to be free from the quality of space.

original: zhes de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin la de yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin la de yang grub pa yin no //
translated: That is what is to be established, and that is also established.

original: de lta ma grub par brjod pa ni ltag chod nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma grub par brjod pa ni ltag chod nyid do //
translated: To say that it is not established is mere sophistry.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa'i dngos po ma grub na sgras brjod par bya ba'i dngos tsam grub kyang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa'i dngos po ma grub na sgras brjod par bya ba'i dngos tsam grub kyang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the thing that is pervaded by the proof is not established, then even if the mere thing that is expressed by the word is established, it is not the thing that is to be proven.

original: da ni khyad par can sgras brjod par bya ba ma grub kyang dngos po grub na go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: da ni khyad par can sgras brjod par bya ba ma grub kyang dngos po grub na go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Now, in order to show that even if the thing that is qualified by the word is not established, if the thing is established, it is a reason that causes understanding.

original: rjod par byed pa'i sgra ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po grub na bsgrub bya grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i sgra ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po grub na bsgrub bya grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the expressing word is not established, if the thing that is to be expressed is established, the probandum will be established.

original: dper na 'ug pa bye brag pa la sangs rgyas pas lus can la sogs pa sgrub byed du bshad pa go bar byed pa nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ug pa bye brag pa la sangs rgyas pas lus can la sogs pa sgrub byed du bshad pa go bar byed pa nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the Buddhist explains to the Vaiśeṣika that the body, etc. are the proof, it is a cause of understanding.

original: 'ug pa'i lus can ni rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i tshad yin gyi reg bya ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ug pa'i lus can ni rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i tshad yin gyi reg bya ni ma yin no //
translated: The body of the owl is a measure that does not pervade all substances, but it is not a tangible object.

original: lus can gyi sgra yang reg par bya ba nyid la sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: lus can gyi sgra yang reg par bya ba nyid la sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The word “body” is also applied to tangibility.

original: des na bye brag pa la @130a * //
analyzed: des na bye brag pa la @130a * //
translated: Therefore, for the Vaiśeṣika,

original: sgra ma grub kyi don ni grub pa nyid pas des na gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra ma grub kyi don ni grub pa nyid pas des na gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the meaning of the term is established, but the sound is not established. Therefore, it becomes a reason.

original: des na 'di ltar bsgrub byas khyab pa'i don gang yin pa de tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar bsgrub byas khyab pa'i don gang yin pa de tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the meaning pervaded by the probandum is not established by valid cognition, it is not established for either party.

original: bstan bcos las gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa gang yin pa ni'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa gang yin pa ni'o //
translated: In the treatise, it is said that the reason is not established for either party.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of reason is not established for either party?

original: bshad pa / dper na mngon par gsal bar smra ba dpyod pa'am brda sprod pa pa la bye brag pas nye bar bkod pa'i byas pa nyid gang yin pa de ma grub po ;
analyzed: bshad pa / dper na mngon par gsal bar smra ba dpyod pa'am brda sprod pa pa la bye brag pas nye bar bkod pa'i byas pa nyid gang yin pa de ma grub po ;
translated: It is explained: For example, for the grammarian or phonetician who asserts manifestation, the Vaiśeṣika posits the reason of being produced. That is not established.

original: sgra gsal bar bya ba yin gyi byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: sgra gsal bar bya ba yin gyi byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
translated: Sound is manifested, but it is not produced. This is the treatise.

original: brda sprod pa pa ni mi rtag pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: brda sprod pa pa ni mi rtag pa yin yang ngo //
translated: The phonetician is impermanent.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad la ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad la ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is said to be unestablished for either of the two is not so for all inferences,

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa la yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it so for those that are based on the power of things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshad mas mthong ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa la khas blangs pa lung gi rang bzhin gyis brtsad pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / dngos po la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir bstan bcos skabs ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa la khas blangs pa lung gi rang bzhin gyis brtsad pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / dngos po la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir bstan bcos skabs ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa thams cad ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not tenable to dispute the reason that is seen by valid cognition through the nature of a statement of assertion, and because the treatise is not the occasion for a reason that is not to be relied on in an inference based on things, it is not the case that all inferences are so.

original: ci ste byas pa ni tshad ma nyid kyis gnod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste byas pa ni tshad ma nyid kyis gnod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the reason is undermined by valid cognition itself,

original: 'o na ni mngon bar gsal bar smra ba yongs su gzung bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'o na ni mngon bar gsal bar smra ba yongs su gzung bas ci zhig bya /
translated: then what is the point of accepting the theory of manifestation?

original: 'o na te mngon par gsal ba de'i ngo bo sgra la tshad ma ma rtogs na ;
analyzed: 'o na te mngon par gsal ba de'i ngo bo sgra la tshad ma ma rtogs na ;
translated: But if you think that if the nature of manifestation is not realized by valid cognition in sound,🔽then it is not manifested.

original: de lta na yang tshad ma can ma yin pa'i mngon bar gsal bar smra bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma can ma yin pa'i mngon bar gsal bar smra bas ci zhig bya /
translated: But what is the use of this, since the opponent is not a valid person?

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir bstan bcos la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa bstan bcos dang 'brel ba'i tshul gsum pa gang la yod pa de la bstan bcos kyi sgo nas brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir bstan bcos la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa bstan bcos dang 'brel ba'i tshul gsum pa gang la yod pa de la bstan bcos kyi sgo nas brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, an inference based on a treatise is one that has the three modes based on a treatise.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan ni ma shes pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan ni ma shes pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Any other inference is said to be unestablished for one or the other because it is not understood.

original: 'chi ba dang dbyibs kyi khyad par ni tshad ma nyid kyis gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang dbyibs kyi khyad par ni tshad ma nyid kyis gsal ba yin la /
translated: Death and the specific shape are established by valid cognition.

original: rgol bas ni gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas phyir rgol @130b ba la ma grub par brjod do //
analyzed: rgol bas ni gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas phyir rgol @130b ba la ma grub par brjod do //
translated: The opponent, not fully understanding the nature of the reason, says it is unestablished for the other party.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rgol ba grangs can la ma grub ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rgol ba grangs can la ma grub ste /
translated: Impermanence is not established for the Sāṃkhya opponent.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid rgol ba la ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid rgol ba la ma grub po //
translated: Therefore impermanence is not established for the opponent.

original: des na mthong ba la gtan tshigs kyis rang gi ngo bo gtan lam phebs pa'i phyir dang / ma mthong ba ni tshad mas gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mthong ba la gtan tshigs kyis rang gi ngo bo gtan lam phebs pa'i phyir dang / ma mthong ba ni tshad mas gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that either the reason is not established, because the nature of the reason is not ascertained by perception, or the example is not established, because the subject is not ascertained by valid cognition.

original: des na dper brjod pa ma smras so //
analyzed: des na dper brjod pa ma smras so //
translated: Therefore, the master has not stated an example.

original: ci ltar slob dpon gyis byas pa mngon par gsal ba smra ba la ma grub pa'i dper brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar slob dpon gyis byas pa mngon par gsal ba smra ba la ma grub pa'i dper brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that the master has stated an example that is not established for the proponent of manifestation through production?

original: slob dpon gyis ni dper brjod pa'i phyogs cam zhig bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni dper brjod pa'i phyogs cam zhig bshad do //
translated: The master has explained only a part of the example.

original: ci ltar bstan bcos la grags pa'i dngos po cig shos bstan bcos de dang ldan pa ma yin pa la ma grub pa de bzhin du tshad mas rab tu grub pa'i dngos po gang zhig gang na med par rgol bas khas blangs pa des der phyir rgol ba
analyzed: ci ltar bstan bcos la grags pa'i dngos po cig shos bstan bcos de dang ldan pa ma yin pa la ma grub pa de bzhin du tshad mas rab tu grub pa'i dngos po gang zhig gang na med par rgol bas khas blangs pa des der phyir rgol ba
translated: Just as the other thing known in the treatise is not established for one who does not possess that treatise, similarly, whatever thing is established by valid cognition, if it is accepted by the opponent as not existing in a certain place, then the reason is not established for the opponent.

original: la ma grub pa yin la phyir rgol ba la tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de yang rgol ba tshad ma ma shes pa'i phyir na rgol ba la ma grub pa brjod kyi /
analyzed: la ma grub pa yin la phyir rgol ba la tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de yang rgol ba tshad ma ma shes pa'i phyir na rgol ba la ma grub pa brjod kyi /
translated: And whatever is established by a valid cognition for the opponent is not stated to be not established for the proponent, because the proponent does not understand the valid cognition.

original: bstan bcos la brten pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not based on the treatise.

original: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma grub par mi sems pa de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma grub par mi sems pa de la bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the one who does not think that one part of the meaning of the thesis is not established is as follows:

original: gang yang dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig chos sam chos can ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig chos sam chos can ma grub pa'o //
translated: The one part of the meaning of the thesis that is not established is either the property or the subject.

original: chos can ni re zhig dper na sgra mi rtag ste /
analyzed: chos can ni re zhig dper na sgra mi rtag ste /
translated: The subject is, for example, like in the statement, “Sound is impermanent,

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it is sound.”

original: gal te spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Isn’t the subject called ‘sound,’ which is one part of the general, established?”

original: de yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes smos te /
translated: The response is “That is also not established.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of affirmation and the means of affirmation are different.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not maintained that the probandum itself is the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can rang nyid bsgrub pa la ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can rang nyid bsgrub pa la ste /
translated: The probandum is the subject itself, which is to be proven.

original: grub par bya ba la grub par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir chos can de bdag sgrub pa la gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub par brjod do //
analyzed: grub par bya ba la grub par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir chos can de bdag sgrub pa la gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub par brjod do //
translated: Since that which is the proof of the probandum is not itself established, it is said that the subject is not established as the reason for proving itself.

original: 'di skad du sgra gtan ma grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du sgra gtan ma grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In other words, it is not that the sound is not established at all.

original: bdag nyid mi rtag par sgrub pa la go byed nyid du ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi rtag par sgrub pa la go byed nyid du ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is not established as the indicator of the probandum, that it itself is impermanent.

original: 'di ltar de nyid bdag gi sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid bdag gi sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not the proof of itself.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?
It is because

original: ngo bo tsam dang zhes bya ba sgra tsam dang bsgrub bya rjes su 'brel ba yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo tsam dang zhes bya ba sgra tsam dang bsgrub bya rjes su 'brel ba yin na /
translated: if the mere entity of that sound, that is, the mere sound, were related to the probandum,

original: dam bca' ba bstan pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba bstan pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir /
translated: then the probandum would be established by the mere statement of the thesis.

original: yang sgra de bstan pa don med pa'i phyir de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sgra de bstan pa don med pa'i phyir de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, that sound is meaningless because it is itself the proof.

original: 'di snyam du sngar ni bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du bstan la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sngar ni bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du bstan la /
translated: If you think, “Previously, it is taught as the nature of the probandum,

original: phyis ni sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin du yin pa nges na don med par ga la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ni sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin du yin pa nges na don med par ga la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and later, it is taught as the nature of the proof. How could it be meaningless?”🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid de la phyis sgrub byed nyid du ston pa na ma bstan pa'i don gyi cha ni ci yang bstan pa med do //
analyzed: bshad pa / bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid de la phyis sgrub byed nyid du ston pa na ma bstan pa'i don gyi cha ni ci yang bstan pa med do //
translated: When that which is taught as the nature of the probandum is later taught as the nature of the proof, there is nothing at all of the meaning that is not taught.

original: gnyi gar yang sgra ma yin pa las ldog pa nyid bstan par zad do //🔽sgra ni bsgrub bya bstan pa gcig tu ni rnam pa gzhan du yin la /
analyzed: gnyi gar yang sgra ma yin pa las ldog pa nyid bstan par zad do // sgra ni bsgrub bya bstan pa gcig tu ni rnam pa gzhan du yin la /
translated: In both cases, it is simply taught as the opposite of what is not sound.

original: sgrub byed du bstan par yang rnam pa gzhan yin no //🔽sgra tha dad pas ni don tha dad par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: sgrub byed du bstan par yang rnam pa gzhan yin no // sgra tha dad pas ni don tha dad par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Sound is taught as the probandum in one way, and it is taught as the proof in another way.

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is not established as a different object because of being different.🔽That would lead to the absurd consequence that sound would be established as a different object.

original: de'i phyir sgra de gtan tshigs ston pa'i dus su sgra nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra de gtan tshigs ston pa'i dus su sgra nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, when the reason is stated, the sound itself would be impermanent.

original: phyogs bstan pa'i dus nyid na de lta bu grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs bstan pa'i dus nyid na de lta bu grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And at the time of stating the thesis, it would be established in that way.

original: phyis gtan tshigs ston pa'i dus su yang rang nyid kho nas te /
analyzed: phyis gtan tshigs ston pa'i dus su yang rang nyid kho nas te /
translated: And at the time of stating the reason, it would be established by itself alone.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas de ltar zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas de ltar zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be established as impermanent in that way by its own nature alone.

original: bsgrub bya ston pa'i dus na rang gi ngo bo kho nas grub pa yang med de /
analyzed: bsgrub bya ston pa'i dus na rang gi ngo bo kho nas grub pa yang med de /
translated: And at the time of stating the probandum, it would not be established by its own nature.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs su ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs su ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is not established as a reason by itself alone.

original: cig shos kyis sgra tsam grub par mthong nas sgra ci ltar ma grub ce na zhes smras so //
analyzed: cig shos kyis sgra tsam grub par mthong nas sgra ci ltar ma grub ce na zhes smras so //
translated: The other person sees that mere sound is established and says, “How is sound not established?”

original: de ni grub mod kyi 'o na kyang de bdag nyid mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pas ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni grub mod kyi 'o na kyang de bdag nyid mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pas ma grub pa yin no //
translated: That is established, but still, because it is not established as a reason that proves impermanence by its own nature, it is not established.

original: de ni phyogs su byas pa gang zhig bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba phyogs su byas pa de las sgra gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs su byas pa gang zhig bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba phyogs su byas pa de las sgra gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is, the reason is a property of the subject, but the subject is not a property of the reason.

original: de nyid gtan tshigs yin na ni chos can bstan pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir yang ston pa don med do /
analyzed: de nyid gtan tshigs yin na ni chos can bstan pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir yang ston pa don med do /
translated: If that were the reason, then it would be pointless to state the subject, because the thesis would be established by the statement of the reason alone.

original: zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: zhes brjod zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: mi rtag pa nyid sgra tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin na 'ga' zhig rtsod par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid sgra tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin na 'ga' zhig rtsod par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: If impermanence were merely related to sound, then it would not be tenable that there is a dispute about it.

original: sgra rtag tu grub pa'i phyir de zhes bya ba mi rtag pa'i ngo bor grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rtag tu grub pa'i phyir de zhes bya ba mi rtag pa'i ngo bor grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sound is established as permanent, that is, because impermanence is established as the nature of sound.

original: 'di snyam du sgra la mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'gro bar ma mthong la rjes su 'gro bar ma mthong @131b ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sgra la mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'gro bar ma mthong la rjes su 'gro bar ma mthong @131b ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ma grub po //
translated: If you think that impermanence is not seen to be related to sound, and that impermanence is not established because it is not seen to be related,

original: des na rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa 'god do snyam na /
analyzed: des na rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa 'god do snyam na /
translated: and that therefore there is a dispute about it, and that for that reason you set forth a proof,

original: gal te de ltar rjes su 'gro ba la ltos nas sgra rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rjes su 'gro ba la ltos nas sgra rtag pa yin na /
translated: If sound is permanent because it is a subsequent state,

original: yin la rag na de ci chos can chos can gzhan la rjes su 'gro 'am /
analyzed: yin la rag na de ci chos can chos can gzhan la rjes su 'gro 'am /
translated: then, if it is permanent, what is the point of saying that it is a subsequent state in another subject?

original: 'di ni mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is impossible.

original: des na gal te sgra go bar byed pa yin na rang gi ngo bo tsam las go bar byed par 'dod pa yin ba'i phyir rtsod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te sgra go bar byed pa yin na rang gi ngo bo tsam las go bar byed par 'dod pa yin ba'i phyir rtsod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if sound is that which causes understanding, then there is no dispute because it is accepted that it causes understanding by its own nature alone.

original: 'di snyam du khyed kyis kyang chos can yin yang bdag nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag tu ma grub pa ci brjod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du khyed kyis kyang chos can yin yang bdag nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag tu ma grub pa ci brjod de /
translated: In this regard, you may say, “Even though it is a subject, why is it not established as a part of the understanding of itself?

original: gang gi phyir sgron ma la sogs pa bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa yang mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgron ma la sogs pa bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa yang mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because we see that a lamp and so on is that which illuminates itself.”

original: bshad pa / sgron ma la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo rung ba nyid kyis bdag nyid rnam par shes pa skyed pa na shes pa'i yul nyid du gsal bas bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bshad pa / sgron ma la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo rung ba nyid kyis bdag nyid rnam par shes pa skyed pa na shes pa'i yul nyid du gsal bas bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In response to that, we say: A lamp and so on is said to illuminate itself because it is a clear object of consciousness when it generates consciousness of itself through its own suitable nature.

original: rtags dang rtags can ni de ltar ma yin te ;
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can ni de ltar ma yin te ;
translated: The reason and the one who possesses the reason are not like that.

original: bdag nyid gcig pa'i phyir bdag nyid gsal bar byed par shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pa'i phyir bdag nyid gsal bar byed par shes par mi nus so //
translated: Because they are the same, it is not possible to know that the reason makes itself known.

original: rtags dang rtags can de'i dngos po ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can de'i dngos po ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason and the one who possesses the reason have a different basis.

original: ci ltar tha dad pa rten ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar tha dad pa rten ce na /
translated: How can they be different?

original: gang gi phyir rtags rang nyid rnam par shes pa yul du gyur pa nyid kyis ni rtags can rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtags rang nyid rnam par shes pa yul du gyur pa nyid kyis ni rtags can rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: Because the reason itself does not become the object of consciousness, the one who possesses the reason is not understood.

original: gang gis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po tha dad pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po tha dad pa med par 'gyur /
