translated: By what means would the reason and the one who possesses the reason not be different?

original: gang rtogs pa na gang ma rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i rtags ni de yin te /
analyzed: gang rtogs pa na gang ma rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i rtags ni de yin te /
translated: That which is the reason when one does not understand something is understood.

original: dper na du ba rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa'i me'i du ba yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa'i me'i du ba yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when smoke is understood, the fire that is not understood is smoke.

original: gang rtogs pa nyid na gang rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i rtags ni de ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rtogs pa nyid na gang rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i rtags ni de ma yin te /
translated: That which is the reason when one understands something is not understood.

original: dper na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs rtogs pa nyid na med pa rtogs pa'i phyir bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs med pa'i rtogs ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs rtogs pa nyid na med pa rtogs pa'i phyir bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs med pa'i rtogs ma yin no //
translated: For example, when one realizes a place that is empty of a pot, one realizes the non-existence of the pot. Therefore, the place that is empty of a pot is not the realization of non-existence.

original: de'i phyir gang des na gang ma nges pa de dag ni nges pa dang ma nges pa dag gis tha dad phan rjes su 'gro ba shes pa la ltos te nges par gyur pa ni cig shos kyi rtags yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang des na gang ma nges pa de dag ni nges pa dang ma nges pa dag gis tha dad phan rjes su 'gro ba shes pa la ltos te nges par gyur pa ni cig shos kyi rtags yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, those who are uncertain about something, in order to ascertain it, rely on the knowledge of the connection between the two, the ascertained and the unascertained. The other is the reason.

original: sgron ma bzhin du bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma bzhin du bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like a lamp, which illuminates itself.

original: chos can yang tha dad pa nyid kyis rtags su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos can yang tha dad pa nyid kyis rtags su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the property possessor were different, it would be the reason.

original: bshad pa / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sgrub par byed par @132a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sgrub par byed par @132a * //
translated: In response, if one accepts that the nature of the property possessor is established,

original: khas len na ni bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa'i thal ba 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: khas len na ni bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa'i thal ba 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: then this consequence of self-illumination would follow.

original: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection here.

original: rang gi ngo bos nges pa yin na chos can bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos nges pa yin na chos can bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were ascertained by its own nature, then impermanence, which is the nature of the subject, would be made evident.

original: sgron ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgron ma bzhin no //
translated: It would be like a lamp.

original: de lta yin dang sgra rang gi ngo bos rtag tu grub pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyang grub pas rtsod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgra rang gi ngo bos rtag tu grub pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyang grub pas rtsod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then because sound would be established as permanent by its own nature, impermanence would also be established, and there would be no dispute.

original: 'di snyam du gal te gtan tshigs dang bsgrub pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can rang nyid la gtan tshigs su ma grub pa brjod na /🔽'o na dngos po thams cad la chos dang chos can nam /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te gtan tshigs dang bsgrub pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can rang nyid la gtan tshigs su ma grub pa brjod na / 'o na dngos po thams cad la chos dang chos can nam /
translated: If you think that because the reason and the probandum are different, the reason is not established with respect to the subject, the probandum,🔽then the distinction between the property and the subject, or between the probandum and the proof, is not established with respect to all things.

original: bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi chos kyi dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba'i skyon 'di rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs thams cad la mtshungs so //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi chos kyi dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba'i skyon 'di rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs thams cad la mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, this fault that one part of the meaning of the thesis becomes the reason is similar for all reasons based on the nature of things.

original: byas pa nyid ni sgra dang tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni sgra dang tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Being produced is not different from sound.

original: des na byas pa yang dam bca'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na byas pa yang dam bca'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the fact that it is produced is one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: rtsod pa 'di la brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bsam pa nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di la brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bsam pa nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: The answer to this dispute is the very same one that was explained in the context of the argument from essence:

original: de dang de las log pa'i dngos po rnams kyi ldog pa la brten pas nges pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin tha snyad tha dad pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag tha dad de /
analyzed: de dang de las log pa'i dngos po rnams kyi ldog pa la brten pas nges pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin tha snyad tha dad pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag tha dad de /
translated: Since the objects of the ascertainment that is based on the exclusion of this and that thing are different in terms of their conventional designations, the thesis and the reason are different.

original: gcig las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma grub pa bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gcig las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma grub pa bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The reason that is based on the exclusion of one thing is not established as the nature of the thesis.

original: gzhan las bzlog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin grub pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan las bzlog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin grub pa yin no zhes so //
translated: The reason that is based on the exclusion of another thing is established as the nature of the proof.

original: gal te don dam par chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad la /
analyzed: gal te don dam par chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad la /
translated: If, ultimately, the property and the basis of the property are not different,

original: brtags pa tha dad pa yin na de ci ltar gzhan du de nyid du dang gzhan nyid 'gog ce na /
analyzed: brtags pa tha dad pa yin na de ci ltar gzhan du de nyid du dang gzhan nyid 'gog ce na /
translated: and if they are different only in terms of conceptual imputations, then how can you refute their sameness and difference?

original: bshad pa / de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pa'i skabs su ni chos dang chos can gyi rang bzhin de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa / de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pa'i skabs su ni chos dang chos can gyi rang bzhin de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: In the context of analyzing the nature that is reality, the nature of phenomena and the nature of the basis of those phenomena are not established as causes.

original: kun rdzob pa'i chos dang chos can gyi don rnams la de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i chos dang chos can gyi don rnams la de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in terms of the objects of conventional phenomena and the basis of those phenomena, we refute their sameness and difference.

original: 'di ltar gal te chos can dang chos rnams kyang phan tshun yang tha dad pa yin na gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te chos can dang chos rnams kyang phan tshun yang tha dad pa yin na gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, if phenomena and the basis of those phenomena are different from each other, they cannot be a common basis.

original: lha sbyin dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i sgra rnams ni gzhi @132b mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i sgra rnams ni gzhi @132b mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: The words “Devadatta” and “Yakṣa” and so on are not a common basis.

original: 'on te chos can las dang phan tshun yang tha mi dad pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te chos can las dang phan tshun yang tha mi dad pa yin na ni /
translated: But if phenomena and the basis of those phenomena are not different from each other,

original: de lta na ni 'o na chos dang chos can brjod pa'i sgra rnams rnam grangs par thal la /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na chos dang chos can brjod pa'i sgra rnams rnam grangs par thal la /
translated: then it follows that the words that express phenomena and the basis of those phenomena are synonymous.

original: sgra'i byas pa nyid ces tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can drug par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i byas pa nyid ces tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can drug par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “product” would not have a different reason for being sixth.

original: de'i phyir sgra rnams kyi don 'di lta bu ni don dam pa rnam par dpyad na chos can dang chos rnams kyang don dam pa la ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra rnams kyi don 'di lta bu ni don dam pa rnam par dpyad na chos can dang chos rnams kyang don dam pa la ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, when ultimate reality is analyzed, the meaning of words such as “reality” and “subject” is not ultimate,

original: de nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan yang ma yin no zhes dgag pa yin no //🔽'o na rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad don dam pa'i yul can /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan yang ma yin no zhes dgag pa yin no // 'o na rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad don dam pa'i yul can /
translated: because it is neither the same nor different.🔽Well, then, how can the conventions of inference and the inferred, which have ultimate reality as their object,

original: ci ltar don dam par de nyid gang gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i chos dang chos can tha dad pa la brten nas 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar don dam par de nyid gang gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i chos dang chos can tha dad pa la brten nas 'jug ce na /
translated: engage in the ultimate, which is neither the same nor different, in dependence on a different subject and property?

original: rjes su dpag pa dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “inference and the inferred.”

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad ni go bya go byed kyi dngos po yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad ni go bya go byed kyi dngos po yin la /
translated: The conventions of inference and the inferred are the things that are understood and the understanding of them.

original: go bya go byed kyi dngos po yang nges pa'i yul rang bzhin la 'thad kyi /
analyzed: go bya go byed kyi dngos po yang nges pa'i yul rang bzhin la 'thad kyi /
translated: The things that are understood and the understanding of them are tenable in relation to a determined object, but

original: nges pa la mi gnas pa'i dngos po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa la mi gnas pa'i dngos po la ni ma yin no //
translated: not in relation to a thing that does not abide in determination.

original: nges pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin de la yang ldog pa tha dad pa brtags pa'i tha dad pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: nges pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin de la yang ldog pa tha dad pa brtags pa'i tha dad pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: And in that nature which is the basis of ascertainment, there is a difference of conceptual difference.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'thad pa nyid do ;
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'thad pa nyid do ;
translated: Therefore, the convention of inference and the inferred is tenable.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mthar thug par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag pas nges pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ldog pas phyi rol gyi bdag nyid du zhen par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mthar thug par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na / gang gi phyir kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag pas nges pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ldog pas phyi rol gyi bdag nyid du zhen par byas pa yin la /
translated: But how can inference be the ultimate of its own characteristic?🔽Because that which is ascertained by inference as the imagined nature is not its nature, but is a determination of an external nature by way of a negation of non-nature.

original: 'dis ci ltar nges pa de 'dra ba yang phyi rol na yod pa'i phyir 'jug pa la mi bslu bas rjes su dpag pa phyi rol gyi don gyi mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ci ltar nges pa de 'dra ba yang phyi rol na yod pa'i phyir 'jug pa la mi bslu bas rjes su dpag pa phyi rol gyi don gyi mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: And because it is not deceptive in engaging in the way it is ascertained, inference is the ultimate of external objects.

original: 'o na 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: But in order to teach just this by way of verses, he says,

original: shes pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa gzhan las rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa gzhan las rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Any cognition that is analyzed as being different from itself.

original: tha dad pa de'i mthar thug pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa de'i mthar thug pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cognition that is the final, complete analysis of that difference.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni bsgrub pa'i tshul la reg par mi nus pas gzhan la log pa 'ba' zhig gis bdag nyid kyang snang ba la phyi rol nyid du lhag par zhen pa yin no//
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni bsgrub pa'i tshul la reg par mi nus pas gzhan la log pa 'ba' zhig gis bdag nyid kyang snang ba la phyi rol nyid du lhag par zhen pa yin no//
translated: Because they are unable to touch the mode of proof, they are only mistaken with respect to others. They also conceive of themselves as appearing externally.

original: @133a * // de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos par tha dad pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i shes pa de dag la tha dad par chos dang chos can snang ba yin la /
analyzed: @133a * // de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos par tha dad pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i shes pa de dag la tha dad par chos dang chos can snang ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, in those cognitions that are the final analysis of mere difference without depending on external objects, the subject and object appear as different.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad kyang tha dad pa de la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad kyang tha dad pa de la brten pa yin no //
translated: The conventions of inference and the inferred are also based on that difference.

original: chos can sgrub par byed pa 'dir ni tha snyad rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas bzhag pa /
analyzed: chos can sgrub par byed pa 'dir ni tha snyad rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas bzhag pa /
translated: Here, the proof of the subject is established by a conceptual cognition.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can gang yin pa de nyid sgrub byed du bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can gang yin pa de nyid sgrub byed du bzhag pa yin no //
translated: The very subject that is to be established is posited as the proof.

original: ci ltar de nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar de nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that very thing?

original: chos can gang yin tha dad pa gzhan gyi blo gang yin pa de la ma reg pa 'brel pa med pa can de la de skad brjod do //
analyzed: chos can gang yin tha dad pa gzhan gyi blo gang yin pa de la ma reg pa 'brel pa med pa can de la de skad brjod do //
translated: It is said that the cognition of the difference of the subject from another is not in contact with it, is not related to it.

original: chos can de ni ldog pa gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi blos gtan tshigs kyi dngos por ma bzung ste /
analyzed: chos can de ni ldog pa gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi blos gtan tshigs kyi dngos por ma bzung ste /
translated: That subject is not taken as the entity of the reason by a cognition that has as its reason the exclusion of another.

original: sgra ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang zhig bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin bstan pa de nyid sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos can du bstan pa de ni gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub bo //
analyzed: sgra ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang zhig bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin bstan pa de nyid sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos can du bstan pa de ni gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub bo //
translated: That which is different from non-sound, which is taught to be the nature of the probandum, is the nature of the proof. Therefore, that which is taught to be the subject is not established as the reason.

original: chos can ma grub par brjod pa 'dis ni chos kyang ma grub par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can ma grub par brjod pa 'dis ni chos kyang ma grub par bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this statement of the non-establishment of the subject, the non-establishment of the predicate is explained.

original: de yang bdag nyid sgrub pa la gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid sgrub pa la gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, it is only the non-establishment of the reason in the proof of itself.

original: der yang gal te bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin de nyid las 'grub pa yin na de ni snga ma kho nar bsgrub bya'i dus su bstan pa'i phyir des 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / 'gar yang rtsod pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: der yang gal te bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin de nyid las 'grub pa yin na de ni snga ma kho nar bsgrub bya'i dus su bstan pa'i phyir des 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / 'gar yang rtsod pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the nature of the probandum is established from itself, then it is just as previously explained that it is established at the time of the probandum, and there would never be any dispute.

original: mi rtag pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa thal ba snga ma ci ltar rigs pa brjod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa thal ba snga ma ci ltar rigs pa brjod do //
translated: For example, it would follow that “sound is impermanent because it is seen.”

original: ci ste yang mi rtag pa nyid bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir de tsam gyis sgra mi rtag pa nyid du mi nges so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang mi rtag pa nyid bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir de tsam gyis sgra mi rtag pa nyid du mi nges so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that sound is not ascertained as impermanent just because of that, since the impermanence does not itself follow,

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma grub par brjod pa de la yang 'brel ba med pa de nyid 'ongs te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma grub par brjod pa de la yang 'brel ba med pa de nyid 'ongs te /
translated: then the same problem of irrelevance arises for you, who say that it does not follow.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos de nyid ci ltar bdag nyid la rjes su 'gro zhes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos de nyid ci ltar bdag nyid la rjes su 'gro zhes so //
translated: How could that very phenomenon characterized as impermanence itself follow from itself?

original: gal te de la chos de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de la chos de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: If you say that very phenomenon establishes it,

original: rang gi ngo bo mthong ba tsam gyis don nges par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mthong ba tsam gyis don nges par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere seeing of its nature would bring about the ascertainment of the object.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nam chos la ma grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nam chos la ma grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that the subject or property to be established is not established,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs nyid du dgod par byed pa gang yin pa de yang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs nyid du dgod par byed pa gang yin pa de yang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: now, in order to show that the reason, “because it is not the discordant class,” is also not established, the text says:

original: 'o na gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa gtan @133b tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa gtan @133b tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe ci ltar zhe na /
translated: “But when the absence of the discordant class is stated as the reason, then what?”

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las tha dad pa gtan tshigs su brjod pa de la yang /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las tha dad pa gtan tshigs su brjod pa de la yang /
translated: In the case of stating the reason as “different from the discordant class,”

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba med par mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba med par mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de bas na /
translated: because the absence of the property to be established is the discordant class,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub bya'i chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub bya'i chos nyid yin la /
translated: then whatever is different from that discordant class is the property to be established.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos kyang ma grub bo //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos kyang ma grub bo //
translated: But the property to be established is not established.

original: cig shos kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams tha dad pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams tha dad pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan yin no //
translated: The other is the property of the subject, because the property of the subject and the example are not different, since the similar and dissimilar instances are different.

original: de bas na bsgrub bya'i chos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub bya'i chos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not just the property of the thesis,

original: 'on kyang shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag nyid kyang yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid phyogs la yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag nyid kyang yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid phyogs la yod pa nyid do //
translated: but also the particular that is desired to be known. Thus, the property of the subject is not the dissimilar instance, because it exists in the similar instance.

original: des na ma grub pa zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na ma grub pa zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be called unestablished?

original: cig shos kyis ma grub pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyogs gang yin zhes dri par byed do //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ma grub pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyogs gang yin zhes dri par byed do //
translated: In order to show that it is unestablished for the other, he asks, “What is the property of the subject?”

original: gzhan gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid smras pa ni gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid smras pa ni gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The definition of the property of the subject and the similar instance is stated by “that which exists in the subject and the similar instances.”

original: 'o na ni phyogs de'i 'dod pas byas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i dbang gis byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa sel bar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni phyogs de'i 'dod pas byas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i dbang gis byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa sel bar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: But then, since the definition of a thesis is created by the assertion of a certain party, how could the exclusion of that which is established by the power of the thing itself be accomplished?

original: 'di ltar don dam par ni bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par ni bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: In this way, that which is devoid of the probandum is the counter-position.

original: gang la chos 'ga' zhig bsgrub par 'dod pa de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gang la chos 'ga' zhig bsgrub par 'dod pa de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: That which is the locus of the desire to prove some property is the position.

original: des na gang zhig phyogs su byas pa de yang don dam par mi mthun pa'i phyogs su yang res 'ga' 'gyur ba'i phyir ci snyed phyogs su byas pa de thams cad mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhes ni shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na gang zhig phyogs su byas pa de yang don dam par mi mthun pa'i phyogs su yang res 'ga' 'gyur ba'i phyir ci snyed phyogs su byas pa de thams cad mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhes ni shes par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since that which is made into a position is sometimes also a counter-position in the ultimate, one cannot know that all positions are not counter-positions.

original: des na phyogs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the position does not destroy the counter-position.

original: gal te 'jig na ni chos 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jig na ni chos 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did destroy it, then nothing would be ascertained as a property.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'dod bas byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'dod bas byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the discordant side is also asserted.

original: 'dod pas phyogs su byas pa las gzhan mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i phyir 'di yang 'dod pas byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas phyogs su byas pa las gzhan mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i phyir 'di yang 'dod pas byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the discordant side is made by assertion, it is also asserted.

original: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas ma nges par 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes 'di ni snga ma nyid du bsal zin to //🔽gzhan @134a * //
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas ma nges par 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes 'di ni snga ma nyid du bsal zin to // gzhan @134a * //
translated: Therefore, since it engages the discordant side, there is no uncertainty. This has already been refuted above.

original: yang gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: yang gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
translated: Moreover, if the nonestablished is the discordant side,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa med pa yang chos can la grub na dgag pa bkag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa med pa yang chos can la grub na dgag pa bkag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and if the nonexistence of the discordant side is established in the subject, then since the negation of the negation is an establishment,

original: gang zhig bsgrub pa'i don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ci zhig yod ;
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub pa'i don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ci zhig yod ;
translated: what is the point of stating a reason?

original: cig shos kyis ni mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa tha dad par mthong nas yang smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa tha dad par mthong nas yang smras pa /
translated: The other, seeing the concordant side and so on as different, again says:

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa tsam gyi rgyus ni thams cad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa tsam gyi rgyus ni thams cad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: The mere non-establishment of the probandum is not a reason in all cases.

original: 'o na ga las she na /
analyzed: 'o na ga las she na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: bshad pa / bsgrub par bya ba de med pa de la yin par rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis la nges pa gang yin pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / bsgrub par bya ba de med pa de la yin par rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis la nges pa gang yin pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: It is said: That which is ascertained by both the proponent and opponent in regard to the non-existence of that probandum is the counter-pervasion.

original: des na chos can de la ni bsgrub bya med par ma nges pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid re zhig grub pa /
analyzed: des na chos can de la ni bsgrub bya med par ma nges pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid re zhig grub pa /
translated: Therefore, in regard to that subject, because the non-ascertainment of the absence of the probandum is not a counter-pervasion, it is established.

original: bsgrub bya grub pa yang ma yin pa des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid grub na gzhan ci zhig bsgrub par bya zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya grub pa yang ma yin pa des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid grub na gzhan ci zhig bsgrub par bya zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Since the probandum is not established, what other thing is to be established when the counter-pervasion is established?

original: gal te de lta na ni mtshan nyid 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba'i dpe yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni mtshan nyid 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba'i dpe yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then an example that is doubtful in regard to the property of the probandum would not be a counter-pervasion.

original: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba med par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba med par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not ascertained that the object to be established does not exist.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gtan tshigs des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid 'di ci ltar sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid 'di ci ltar sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Since that reason is not ascertained to be the opposite of the discordant side, how could it establish the probandum?

original: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not?

original: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par ma nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par ma nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because this non-discordant side is not ascertained to be the opposite of the absence of the probandum, therefore it could not.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa ma nges kyang sgrub byed nyid du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa ma nges kyang sgrub byed nyid du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if the opposite of the absence of the probandum is not ascertained, how could it not be the proof?

original: gang gi phyir 'di la de'i shes bya sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la de'i shes bya sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this case the characteristic of the means of knowing the object to be established is not ascertained.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshul gsum pa yin la ;
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshul gsum pa yin la ;
translated: The opposite of the absence of the probandum is the third mode of the proof.

original: de yang 'di la ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni rtags ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'di la ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni rtags ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since this is not ascertained, when there is doubt about the reversal of the discordant side, it is not a logical reason.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par nye bar bkod pa de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa nges par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par nye bar bkod pa de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa nges par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that by merely positing the non-discordant side, the reversal of the absence of the probandum is ascertained,

original: gal te de na ci @134b ltar ma nges pa nyid kyi rgyu las nges par 'gyur mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid las nges par brjod pas ma nges par brjod pas ma nges pa nyid las yin par ci ltar brjod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de na ci @134b ltar ma nges pa nyid kyi rgyu las nges par 'gyur mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid las nges par brjod pas ma nges par brjod pas ma nges pa nyid las yin par ci ltar brjod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then if it is ascertained from the cause of non-ascertainment, how could it be ascertained from the non-discordant side? By stating ascertainment from the non-discordant side, how could it be stated as ascertainment from non-ascertainment?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i sgras ni bsgrub bya ldog pa ma nges pa brjod pa de'i phyir ci ltar bsgrub par bya ba med par the tshom za ba de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par nges te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i sgras ni bsgrub bya ldog pa ma nges pa brjod pa de'i phyir ci ltar bsgrub par bya ba med par the tshom za ba de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par nges te /
translated: In response, it is said: The word non-discordant side expresses the non-ascertainment of the reversal of the probandum. Therefore, just as there is doubt about the absence of the probandum, by that very [doubt], the reversal of the absence of the probandum is ascertained.

original: ci ltar bsgrub bya nges zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar bsgrub bya nges zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is: “How can you be certain of what is to be established?”

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nonexistence of the object of refutation is the object to be established.

original: rnam pa de lta bu phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If the definition of the property of the position and so on is of this kind,🔽then, since the non-non-property-possessor is ascertained as the reason, what kind of extremely irrelevant statement is this?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs su bcad pas shin tu ma 'brel pa ci 'dra ba zhig brjod par 'gyur ba de la bzhad gad du ston pa ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs su bcad pas shin tu ma 'brel pa ci 'dra ba zhig brjod par 'gyur ba de la bzhad gad du ston pa ni /
translated: In response to this, the text says:

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'di chos can 'dis the tshom za ba de'i phyir 'dis 'di na med do zhes bya bar nges zhes bya ba khyed kyis de skad smras pa de ni shin tu mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'di chos can 'dis the tshom za ba de'i phyir 'dis 'di na med do zhes bya bar nges zhes bya ba khyed kyis de skad smras pa de ni shin tu mdzes pa yin no //
translated: “Since you, the opponent, doubt the existence of this object that is defined as the nonexistence of the object of refutation, you say, ‘This is not here,’ and you ascertain it. Your statement is very beautiful.”

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba dang ma 'brel bar brjod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa gang dag phyogs rnam par gzhag pa la mi ltos pa de 'dra
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba dang ma 'brel bar brjod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa gang dag phyogs rnam par gzhag pa la mi ltos pa de 'dra
translated: Because it would be uncertain that anything is established, and because there would be doubt that the opposite of the reason is excluded, and because it would be stated that there is no relation, therefore, those that are the existent and nonexistent phenomena of the probandum, which do not rely on the positing of a position, are not established as the property of the subject.
